name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: Although I've only been using this product for a week, I can already see quite an improvement in the texture and tone of my skin. It applies smoothly and absorbs quickly into the skin so I can follow up with moisturizer almost immediately (crucial for a time-pressed person like myself). I put it on morning and night, and I feel as though my skin is smoother and brighter when I wake up in the morning!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: After seeing some of the negative reviews on this product I was a bit hesitant. But after using this product for 2 weeks I have really noticed a difference. I struggle with hormonal acne which can be quite red and painful. The fact that I no longer use my prescription antibiotic spot treatment because of this product is amazing for me. I did a patch test for a couple days before applying it all over as others have recommended doing. I also find it has worked best with a gel moisturizer instead of oil based (I use Tatcha water cream and origins ginzing gel moisturizer). Really happy with the results.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I have sensitive dry combination skin; I get hormonal breakouts and have a lot of dark spots so I just have really crazy skin overall. I was skeptical about The Ordinary products because the people at Sephora told me “you get what you pay for”. I’ve used this serum once a day for 3 days and I already see my acne and dark spots disappearing and my face clearing up. I’m obsessed!!!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: Niacinamide is such an amazing ingredient. The hyperpigmentation in my cheeks is completely gone and my acne scars fade a lot faster. I also used to have very oily skin and that’s long gone now. This serum is a little thick but doesn’t leave a sticky feeling after putting it on. I usually mix it with my vitamin C in the morning to get all its benefits.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I don't even bother buying the 1oz anymore after finding out that Sephora carries the bigger bottle. You're definitely getting your money worth at a reasonable price and with a high percentage of Zinc and Niacinamide combined!! I stock up on this product every time they have the 2oz! I will forever use this product. This is my ride or die
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: Amazing! I don't think it really helped with any of my cystic acne, but it made all the smaller acne I get disappear!! It's not the easiest to use with other products. It really needs to go on first and then you need to let it dry before applying anything else. It's well worth that little annoyance though. And the little bottle goes a long way!!  I'm so bummed that it's continually out of stock right now. I'm rationing what I have.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: This product is trash! I honestly cannot grasp the hype..I have tried it every way possible and no matter what this product pills and balls-up right off the skin.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I loved it!! The results showed after a week or so. I pires it with the hyaluronic acid and it has helped my skin sooo much!!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: Wanted to love this because of all the great reviews but it just wasn't for me. It broke me out and gave me cystic acne, and small bumps above my lip which I never get. I think the concentration of niacinamide is probably too strong for my skin to handle.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I am pleasantly surprised! I have bad skin, thanks to years of acne and reoccurring cystic acne spots, so I typically have to turn to prescription grade skin products. I read a few promising reviews and bought it, thinking I was put a few bucks if it didn’t work. I am on my second bottle now. I still have some flare ups, but spots are gone for the most part and I see clearer skin! Keep this on the market, because I will be using this permanently!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: Was really excited to try this, worked great just on my nose and broke me out everywhere else :( perhaps I'm one of the few who are sensitive to the zinc? had to return.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: It didn’t solve my acne problem but it did significantly help! My skin is very back and forth with being oily or dry or covered in acne or all 3. This serum significantly helped balance it out and cleared up about 95% of my acne since I started using it about a month ago. The only down side is if you use too much it does pull on your skin with your moisturizer but that’s what I’ve found with most serums.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
I think I left a review on this before and I’d like to take EVERYTHING back. This product is amazing. 

 If you are using The Ordinary, make sure you research each product. I thought I was allergic to this product from the severe reaction I had to it, but that was due to the high concentration of niacinamide. My skin purged for just over a month. After a massive purge and healing, I am now able to use this and my skin texture has improved so much. I am glowing and my skin has never looked healthier. If you already have healthy skin you might not experience a drastic purge, however if you are like me then prepare for a month of acne and another half month of healing. The purge is worth it. I did not break out in areas that are unusual for me and the purge stayed in my usual problem areas. Now when I do have a whitehead, it goes away within a day and does not swell into a little volcano like it used to. I still have redness but the dark spots on my face are fast disappearing. 

 I did build up my skin’s tolerance to this through the use of other niacinamide products, so perhaps that helped. In any case, this is the best my skin has ever looked and felt. Be patient with this one and make sure you do not use it on active acne. Wait until your face is no longer compromised.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I am almost out of my second bottle of this and I can't be without it. Helps keep my skin clear and helps reduce the size any pimples that do pop up. I use it every day under my daily lotion and can't recommend it enough!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: dis stuff is gold. completely eliminated my cystic, hormonal acne !
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
Adding this to my skincare regimen was the biggest game changer!
Before using this product I would always notice around midday oil would start to seep around my T-zone no matter how many matte powders, sprays, and sheets I used. After using this product - I don't experience that anymore! It has done an incredible job of regulating my sebum and also has helped tremendously in eradicating the congestion of small little skin colored bumps I had on my cheeks and chin. 

Been using it every morning for almost 3 months and it has now become a staple in my routine. THANK YOU Ordinary yet again for another great product!!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

review_text: How did I ever live without this product?! I use it in the morning beneath my sunscreen and I’ve repurchased it three times already. Since using it, my t-zone has noticeably reduced oil production, the redness on my face has decreased and my skin tone has smoothed out. I let it sink in for a minute or two before applying the sunscreen so it doesn’t pill. Highly recommend the Ordinary.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

review_text: I first bought this product around a year ago and since then I haven’t stopped using it. It has been a life changer when it comes to sebum production on my forehead and cheeks. After a whole day out I’ll look in the mirror and oiliness will barely be seen. I stopped using it when I ran out of my first bottle and was waiting for the next one and immediately saw a change. My Holy grail.

review_text: I have combination skin and it changes its mood on when it would become extra oily. So, I decided to try this on, on my temperamental skin. The first few uses were plain horrible. It would break me out after a couple of uses, I would stop using, try it on again after a few weeks and the same cycle continued. After that initial bump, it was all smooth. I didn't give up on it and around my fourth or fifth try, this actually started working miracles. I started using this product in January and waited until now to post a review. The blemishes have reduced dramatically, acne has gone away and my skin hasn't looked so good. I use this only in the mornings and moisturize it really will after applying. Love it. This works!

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: This product has been a staple in my skin care routine for a year now. It has definitely reduced how much oil my skin produces. My skin also feels tighter (but not the uncomfortable kind) and my pores look smaller.

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I love this product and have already repurchased it. I use it religiously and have seen a positive effect on my acne. I no longer break out as much (get one or two once in a while). I used to use it twice a day and it never caused me any irritation. It also made my skin tone more even and my face looks much brighter. I had no issues with this product and it lasted a long time. The quality and quantity at that price is unbeatable. I highly recommend this product.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
I’m going to give you a little tip... before using this pure niacinamide and zinc, be sure that you introduce niacinamide in your face before, I suggest “La Roche Posay” Toleriane double repair moisturizer and purifying foaming cleanser which are very gentil, fragrance free and basic formulas they are holy grail for sensitive skin, and primary ingredient is niacinamide on both of them. This could help your skin to get used to it, so, when you put pure niacinamide on to your skin it may be more gentil and not a “new strager” for your routine. Cause your face may FREAK OUT! 

I’m personal this have never gave me a bad reaction or brokeout my face and I’m VERY SENSITIVE OILY ACNE PRONE SKIN. This have being an amazing incorporation for my routine and I love it so much.

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I have combination skin and it changes its mood on when it would become extra oily. So, I decided to try this on, on my temperamental skin. The first few uses were plain horrible. It would break me out after a couple of uses, I would stop using, try it on again after a few weeks and the same cycle continued. After that initial bump, it was all smooth. I didn't give up on it and around my fourth or fifth try, this actually started working miracles. I started using this product in January and waited until now to post a review. The blemishes have reduced dramatically, acne has gone away and my skin hasn't looked so good. I use this only in the mornings and moisturize it really will after applying. Love it. This works!

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I have to start by saying I am in love with three other Ordinary products and they have been a godsend for my 37 year old combination skin and adult acne. The AHA peel is amazing and I have had fantastic results with the Alpha Arbutin and Retinoids products. I would, however, still get an occasional small pimple (usually gone in a day and no where near as huge as I used to deal with), so I thought I would try adding this to my regimen. Huge mistake for me. Within 2 days, my skin was breaking out all over with several large, painful pimples and pimples in areas I never have acne (my nose). This was the only change to my skin and makeup routine so I can only attribute it to this product. I can see it works for some people which is great but it was clearly a bad choice for me. I’m still a loyal customer of their other products though and swear by them, this is just not for me.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

review_text: Not sure what it was in this, maybe the zinc, but it broke me out all over my face, which stopped when I stopped using this product. Make sure you patch test, especially if you have sensitive skin!

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
I’ve been using this for about two months now, hoping to get rid of dark spots left by acne. At first I was kind of disappointed with this product because the rave reviews had convinced me that I’d be seeing quick results, and up until maybe a week ago, I really wasn’t seeing a difference. When I remind myself that skincare is a longterm process, I don’t feel quite as disappointed. 

While it’s taken a while to see any improvement in my hyperpigmentation, one thing I did notice within days of starting to use this was a definite decrease in sebum production. Even with my nighttime skincare products on my face, I woke up feeling less oily than I did prior to starting my niacinamide use. I also didn’t need to use as many oil blotting sheets throughout the day.

As I mentioned, I have started to see definite improvement in the overall appearance of my skin. My dark spots seem to be fading and my face feels smoother. I already purchased a second bottle, and I hope to see more improvement.

Got such an affordable product, this is great. Better than most luxury products.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: Really wanted to like this product (especially after all the rave reviews) but it made me breakout. I left it for a few months, and when tried it again I broke out. Not sure if I’m using it wrong, but my skin definitely does not like it. Which is too bad - because my wallet does!! I’d still recommend it because Niacinamide (Vit B3) is great for skin...perhaps this formulation doesn’t work for certain skin types.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

review_text: This has been a HG product for me. Keeps my skin clear and definitely improves its overall appearance. Extremely affordable. A bottle lasts quite a while and I’ve repurchased 3x, which is a real testament to its effectiveness and quality. So glad to see The Ordinary at Sephora!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
The Ordinary has become one of my favourite brands, and it all started with this one! I have very sensitive skin and have to be careful what I put on it. This is perfect though. I mostly use it as a spot treatment for any pimples or blackheads, but once a week I use it on my entire face. I almost never get a pimple or even a blackhead now. 
But a word to the wise, read up on it before using it because it can react negatively with other skin care serums. The information is all available online. The Ordinary have a page specifically for explaining what exactly it is and does, and what to use it with and what to avoid. And use very sparingly each use. Less is definitely more with this!! But that just means it’ll last you longer. And if used properly, you’re going to love it and love your skin!!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
This is a thick, gloopy clear serum that I had purchased directly from the brand website to help with occasional breakouts. Unfortunately, since I get hormonal breakouts more than bacterial breakouts, I didn’t see a change after months of using this product. 

I also found that if I used this serum too many days in a row, I would find mysterious little red bumps in places I don’t usually break out. Once I discontinue use, the bumps go away. 

I also have a slight issue with this product pilling if I don’t let it dry completely before applying the rest of my skincare products (moisturizer, face oil) or if I rub too hard. Not a big deal, but does feel unusual. 

I will probably continue to use once or twice a week to use up the bottle but will not repurchase. I like many of the products from The Ordinary but this one just wasn’t for me!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
I purchased this product because of #skincarebyhyram 's recommendation on youtube and he was absolutely correct. 

DO NOT touch dropper to face, but add to your fingers first and then to your face.

Pros: 
Contains niacinimide and zinc in the top 5 ingredients
No fragrance
does exactly what it says and reduces blemish marks

I have lots of acne and scars from it. After using this for a week only once a day (need to build up to twice a day), I noticed a major difference in how oily my face was and also the scars on my chin from old and new scars.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I literally could not review this product with enough stars. Within the first 3 uses, this product visibly reduced my hyperpigmentation. Within the first week, my pores have shrunk so obviously my dumb boyfriend who I love noticed and complimented me! And also...it is 6 dollars?? Not even??? One note I have is don't apply this on damp skin or after a serum; it gets kinda weird and foamy, and while I don't know if this is actually negative, it just isn't my favorite sensation. Aside from that, this has just been an absolute pleasure to experience, and I have been telling everyone to get it. I know that it doesn't work for all types of skin, but it is only $6 dollars, so if you have concerns about dark spots, enlarged pores, or hyperpigmentation, it is worth a try because I can almost guarantee it is cheaper than almost everything else out there.

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
After reading the reviews, I gave this serum a try. I have dry/combination, acne/blemish prone skin with a bunch of acne scars both discoloration and pitted ones. My skin is also very reactive, so, I'm very careful when it comes to trying new products and adding products to my regimen.
I started using this at night and my skin seems fine the first two days, and then I started using in the morning as well on the third day. My skin started to have red bumps, like tiny blemishes whenever my skin purge. I thought perhaps twice a day was too much for my skin. But I gave it a week for my skin to adjust to the product. On the fifth day, the tiny red bumps started to disappear and now 2 weeks later, my skin seems smoother and brighter, my acne scars seems to fade. I know it's too early to tell, but so far I like how it works my skin. Will definitely repurchase.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
I have oily skin and USED to break out. I have an excellent skin care regime that I barely ever breakout. Being South Asian I scar easily and I had acne scars from a year ago. I read this would help with scars so started using it. I broke out EVERYWHERE. I never break out around my nose or cheeks. I broke out on my neck too. I used it for a month thinking my skin needs time to adjust but it just kept getting worse. Now I have so many scars that will last years!!! I am so mad I can't even..
My sister on the other hand says it works for her. So this may suit some and not others. Proceed with caution.

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
My skin is thanking this product! I’ve had problem skin my whole life and using it in my routine has been life changing... this is how I use it in my routine... 
1. Cleanse with The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser. Rinse + dry.
2. Remove remaining makeup with Bioderma Sensibo micellar water and cotton round.
3. Wash face with Origins Zero Oil cleanser and Clarisonic Deep Pore brush head. Rinse + Dry.
4. Apply The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% toning solution to cotton round and apply to face and neck.
5. Apply The Ordinary Niacinamide 10%+Zinc 1% solution to face.
6. Apply a moisturizer 
7. Apply Belif Aqua Bomb sleeping mask 
Ta-Da!!! Amazing, clear, hydrated healthy skin!!!

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: THE HOLY GRAIL! My skin was never that bad, but of course I want it to be better so I got this. In my case, I did purge hella bad. It was so bad my friends and family were worried and told me to stop using it, but I kept using it. I never purged before so I was scared this product was just making me breakout or making my skin worse. I even had whiteheads on top of whiteheads! That’s how bad I purged. It lasted for 10 days and it’s a good thing I consistently applied it because it was so sudden that my face cleared up. DO NOT PICK AT THE SCABS! When my whiteheads went away, it left behinds some sort of scab or dry skin. DO NOT PICK AT IT. I cannot emphasize that enough. I guess it’s one of those “Gets worse before it gets better” kind of product.

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text:
I wrote a disappointed review on this product the day after my first use of it but I don’t know where that went, and I’m kinda glad about it. This product had a learning curve to it, but I’ve finally figured it out. I first used it after the Tarte Knockout Tingling toner which I saw had niacinamide in it and I wanted to use them together for whatever reason. First off, That toner is STRONG. When I put the niacinamide on after that, my skin flushed, burned, itched, and stung for hours. I put makeup on later in the day and had flaky red skin and Looked like I sat in the sun for wayyyy too long. GUYS BE SMART. I caution you to wait a while after using acids or acid toner before you put this on because it can irritate. Also don’t use vitamin c because it can cause flushing as well. 

So when I finally decided to give it another try, I used it sparingly and carefully. One day I put a small amount on and washed it after a few hours. Used it again the next day and left it in overnight with a good moisturizer. This serum is so beautiful! My skin is clearer, brighter, and not irritated or dry. I love it! I wear it like a mask some days or still wear it at night and i have seen such beautiful results and a more even complexion because of this. And for 6 bucks?! Amazing. Try it out. You won’t feel like you wasted your money if it doesn’t work out. But I feel like even the driest of skins can use this. I have combo dehydrated skin that is super dry in the winter, and I love it. You will too.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I use this every other day and it helps keep my skin clear of blemishes.  I feel like Niacinamide and Zinc are sort of a secret when it comes to fighting blemishes and minimizing pores. I alternate using this serum in the morning with a vitamin c serum.  The Ordinary’s website says not to use them together.  I do wish the serum was a bit thinner, but it does absorb into my skin well enough.  I’m giving it 5 stars instead of 4 because you can’t beat the price
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: This is great. It helped get rid of little bumps that I had on my forehead that nothing else seemed to work for. I only use it at night because it is drying and put on moisturizer after applying it
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: Do use with caution, I have friends that have had bad reactions to niacinamide! Thankfully, it worked well for me. I originally used this every other day, I had a moderate amount of purging, and then my skin was looking amazing! Now, I’ve cut back to using it twice per week. If I have an area with a noticeably clogged pore, I expect a small zit to form there after using this. This is a little annoying, and I considered giving 3-4 stars, but niacinamide is known to cause some purging, so this does its job. These small areas of purging don’t last long, and my skin looks much better when the area has healed. This is a great product for long term clear skin!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

With or without makeup! The price is obviously amazing, so I figured I would try it, and not even bother to send it back if I didn't like it. That won't be happening!!!

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I’ve been using this product for about 5-6 weeks as a part of my PM skincare routine – and at first I wasn’t sure that it was doing anything. My oily T-zone was still getting as oily during the day. I knew that the effect was supposed to be cumulative – but I was beginning to get impatient. Then I tried also using it on my forehead UNDER makeup, rather than only in the evening – something I had hesitated to do before, afraid of pilling. And I am happy to report that it drastically cut down on my skin’s production of sebum and kept my oiliness to a minimum! So I don’t know if the difference was simply using it twice a day, instead of just once, but it works now. And for the money, who could possibly ask for more? Makes me look into buying more products by The Ordinary brand.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

review_text: Makes my skin glow! I use only at night after my toner and before my moisturizer. During the day I don’t put it on because it can tend to peel off a tiny bit if I rub my skin, and it also smells very ‘chemically’ (obviously). I’ve noticed after a couple of months that I have breakouts less frequently and have less whiteheads.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I have trouble evaluating serums because a serum is not necessarily something you see immediate results with. What attracted me to this serum was the good reviews, price, and miraculous results tackling oily skin and breakouts. I like to review serums based on feel, texture, results, and overall value. This serum stays a little stickier than the vitamin C one I use in the morning that immediately absorbs into the skin. I feel like I can feel this on my skin beyond application, but it's fine because I use it at night before bed. In line with some other reviews, I was very impressed at how this serum vanishes blackheads in only a couple of uses. It really does! In terms of pimples and breakouts, I havent seen any shrinkage after using this, they have gone away in their normal timing. I feel like the amount you have to use and the size of the bottle isnt the best value- I'm going through it fast- BUT it is only $5, so I can't complain. It has definitely made my skin less oily and vanished blackheads which is a plus, but those are the only benefits I have noticed so far. I will use until the end of the bottle and reevaluate when I am finished. Hoping I start to see the other benefits!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: This product helps clear up mild acne and adds a *small* amount of hydration boost when used before moisturizer. Does not make skin oily, absorbs well. Niacinamide and zinc are both very important for the skin and its healing process in general and I've noticed healthier skin and more of a glow since adding this product 2 months ago. Niacinamide and zinc are common in Korean skincare products and are increasingly being added to product formulations here in the West because they have so many benefits for the skin.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

review_text: Really like this product! I alternate between this in the am or the azelaic acid (also from the Ordinary line). It's calmed down a lot of the pore congestion in my t-zone. The only thing i dislike about this product is it pills up after I apply my moisturizer (I use ren global evercalm cream).
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: This product helps clear up mild acne and adds a *small* amount of hydration boost when used before moisturizer. Does not make skin oily, absorbs well. Niacinamide and zinc are both very important for the skin and its healing process in general and I've noticed healthier skin and more of a glow since adding this product 2 months ago. Niacinamide and zinc are common in Korean skincare products and are increasingly being added to product formulations here in the West because they have so many benefits for the skin.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: great moisturizer for the skin, and the b vitamin plus zinc helps keep my face clear. definitely better to use in the winter and not in the summer where there is high humidity. But good idea to apply nightly
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: This serum is truly great! It helps my skin clear from really bad zits and even clearz out my blemishes and dark spots.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I first purchased this about a year ago, and I noticed a significant reduction in my breakouts. However, for some reason, when I ran out after my second bottle I decided not to repurchase. I was still breaking out, so I assume I thought I could find something that worked better. My skin continually got worse, and I finally bought this again about two months ago. My skin has been steadily clearing since, and I definitely won’t be going without it again!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I have noticed a significant increase in my pore size, skin tone texture, and radiance since using this product! This was a game changer in my skin care routine, and it’s almost impossible to believe how affordable this product is! The serum is slightly thick, but does not have any obnoxious scent to it. You can  apply a moisturizer immediately after, since the product does a nice job working with any moisturizer brighten your skin tone.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I've actually been using this as a spot treatment and it works nicely for that. It's so inexpensive that you should probably just try it!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I’ve been using this product for two weeks now and it seems to be working. I apply a small amount at night over my prescription Tretinoin gel. I have not experienced any pilling since I only use a drop or two, which is enough to cover my entire face. It has a smooth, gel-like consistency that does tingle a bit upon application, but is not irritating for my skin. This formula helps to heal my acne faster and reduce inflammation. It also appears to help with hyperpigmentation caused by my acne. I have read that Niacinamide has anti-aging benefits as well, so I look forward to seeing if this helps with skin firming and/or fine lines. Overall, I recommend this product to help speed up the process of healing acne and reducing hyperpigmentation. Bonus if it has anti-aging benefits. And it is a very high-quality product for a fantastic price!
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I use this combined with alpha arbutin to help treat melasma. This has really helped to fade discoloration and brighten/even out my skin tone. I've repurchased several times and will buy them over and over.  With daily use and sunscreen they've helped fade dark spots more than a Rx product without any irritation.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: After all the great reviews and benefits that this product is supposed to offer, I was so disappointed with this! First of all, it has a very sticky texture that I don't enjoy and takes a while to dry down. But the real issue is that I used it and immediately began breaking out. I wasn't sure if this was an "adjustment period" to the product so I kept on using it, but after several weeks my breakouts continued to be terrible and I stopped using the product. Immediately, my pimples were less agitated and now are in the process of healing away entirely. I guess this is just my skin's reaction so I'm not sure what made mine react that way, but I was bummed because the price is great.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

review_text: I would say I saw improvement in my overall skin quality (particularly jawline acne) while using this, but it was a part of a whole routine. I don’t think this on its own is a miracle product, but it certainly didn’t hurt! I am trying other similar products before I repurchase, but for the price I may come back to it.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: This stuff is amazing. I was struggling with these big stupid pimples for the last 2 years and then red spots for months once they finally went away. I was getting facials once a month and buying every mask from Sephora with mediocre results. Then I found The Ordinary and magically my skin is back. This stuff will kill a zit overnight and prevent more from happening. It has made my pores smaller and more refined and faded pretty much all the red spots (in conjunction with other Ordinary products). I use it as a full serum at night but It is a little sticky at first so during the day I only spot treat if necessary or skip it in favor of a vitamin c (niacinamide mixed with vit c dulls the effects of both of them). Bottom line, I would buy this stuff if it was 10x the price. It’s a winner.

review_text: When I first started using this product I got a huge dry rash on my cheek because I think I started using too much, too quick. After using this for 3 months I have seen the biggest difference in my skin! My pores look smaller, tone more even, and I can feel it destroy any acne on my face. Hopefully this is back in stock soon :)
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I'm sure this would work for some people, but apparently my skin is sensitive to niacinamide (or the zinc) I could clearly see the line between where I put the product and didnt, because my face was so flushed. Also made my face itch like crazy. So just beware of this if you've never tried a product containing 10% niacinamide, or zinc.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: Only used this for a week and didn’t notice any difference. Which I know isn’t fair, I can only really properly judge it if I use it for longer. But I noticed that when I apply this over open pores that will become pimples, it prevents them from becoming whiteheads. Which is terrible, because I had three huge unpoppable and very painful pimples on my chin, which are the kind that leave scars. This was about a month or two ago and I indeed have some scars on my chin from those pimples. If you’re a pore picker like me, I don’t recommend this product.
ingredients: Niacinamide, Pentylene Glycol, Zinc PCA, Tamarindus Indica Seed Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I struggled with acne and a lot of congestion in my cheeks. This product has helped me so much in a short amount of time. I had been using something similar, but paying triple the price. When I couldn't afford it anymore I started looking for an alternative. You cannot beat The Ordinary's prices, especially considering the quality of product.

review_text: I was one of those who broke out in stubborn and weird acne using this- i was looking for niacinamide because of a current prescription i have that uses it as one of the active ingredients, and it’s been good stuff. I wish I knew which of the ingredients in this formula I reacted so badly and quickly with- or if it was just the sticky texture wasn’t agreeable. Stopped use after a couple days and tried again a week later with the same breakout again. Recommend trying it out if you’re interested in these actives, but spot treating a small area of skin for a couple days to test for bad reactions.

name: Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1%
review_text: I got this directly from their site a couple months ago and I am happy to say it really works. I have had acne since I was 10 (I am now 21) and although this hasn't cleared it up (as really nothing ever has), it has made a huge difference. This helps control sebum production, which is one of the main causes of acne/blackheads. It reduces current blemishes and prevents new ones from popping up. When my acne is particularly bad, a thin layer of this product applied at night has me waking up with my acne under control. I have tried a lot of different products and despite the low price tag I think this has been the best for my acne out of everything. There is really nothing to lose!

Since using these two products, I’m down to one or two during my period, and virtually clear the remainder of the month. I am ecstatic. I will be repurchasing. Wanted to add I also use a sunscreen and hyaluronic acid daily, too.

I use to regularly use the Dr. Dennis at-home peel pads, but they are so expensive and I couldn't justify to continue using them. This peel mask has the same effect for a way better price!  I have really sensitive skin and this doesn't bother me at all, where as the Dr. Dennis peel pads dried out my skin super easily if I wasn't careful with them. name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I’ve been using this once every 5 days for the past month and I see a dramatic difference in my overall complexing. My dark spots are less dark, my pores look smaller, and my skin looks smoother. This definitely stings when applying, but after a few minutes it dies down. I recommend using for less then 10 minutes, I leave it on for 8 minutes before rinsing it off. I also recommend using this once a week and no more then that, as this is a very strong exfoliant. Please look into what other products you can’t use after this in your routine, like retinol. With any AHA/BHA, I can’t stress enough the importance of wearing sunscreen after using this. If you have sensitive skin I would ignore this product all together.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: There is a reason the peeling solution is always out of stock, this stuff is amazing!!! So my skin has occasional breakouts, uneven texture, enlarged pores, and the beginnings of fine lines taking root; let’s just say it’s not the kind of skin you’re going to be seeing me run around without foundation on. This definitely has a sting to it when I first put it on but that goes away within 30 seconds for me. After the first use my skin was baby butt smooth and my pores looked like they had shrunk by half! I have now used the solution 4 times and my only regret is that I wish I had known about this stuff sooner. My texture on my t zone is hardly noticeable, no breakouts at all, oiliness has decreased, and old marks are faded, and and not to mention the cute little fine lines on my forehead are super blurred now. Please please please, never stop making this product!

review_text: I think this is a great affordable alternative to super pricey products with similar purposes, such as Drunk Elephant's Sukari Babyfacial. While The Ordinary's peeling solution is very different from the Sukari Babyfacial when it comes to texture, color, and packaging, the two peels share a similar breakdown of the percentages of AHA and BHA that they include (TO contains 30% AHA and 2% BHA, while DE contains 25% AHA and 2% BHA). The ingredients in The Ordinary's formula are definitely promising and their effectiveness is backed by research. If you're looking to try at-home peel treatments, you can't go wrong with what trying out this mask for the price of $7.20.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I cannot believe such a great product is so cheap. Nothing I’ve tried before or since (alongside the Ordinary’s Lactic Acid treatment) has made a bigger difference in my skin. I use this once a week and anytime my skin texture is feeling a little rough. This fixes it immediately. The absorption of all my products and serums improves immensely after using this. It’s intense when you first start using this so please follow the directions exactly and set a timer to make sure you don’t leave this on for more than a few minutes. Definitely do a patch test before using so you can assess whether you’ll have any irritation. Then follow up with a thick moisturizer or night cream to help your skin recover. I have a cabinet full of Ordinary products now and this is a staple.

review_text:
I was super nervous using this product because I had heard that it’s not necessarily for beginners using acid peels and I had only had glycolic peel done once or twice before and that too a long time ago. That said, based on the reviews, research and my experience with The Ordinary products, I decided to get it. I followed instructions exactly because I didn’t want to take any chances with something going wrong. It was surprisingly easy but I was overthinking it a good bit.
The results did NOT disappoint! My skin looked brighter immediately and smoother. My moisturizer absorbed so much better into my skin. It looked much more hydrated too! Even my husband noticed and pointed out how good it looked. I can’t wait to see the results from additional uses. The value is unbeatable! I can’t believe the price and how long this product will last me. I am a customer for life! LOVE this brand!

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: wow... I am so impressed by this little bottle! I've been using it every third day for about a month now and I am already seeing an improvement in my combination acne-prone skin! I have not had a single cystic pimple since adding this to my routine (which is a miracle since at any given time I usually have at least 1-2 painful ones). It was a little tricky for me to figure how much I should be using... the first few times I only used 4 drops: just enough to give my skin a light pink tint. Now, after watching a couple beauty bloggers, I use about 3x as much which leaves me feeling a little tingly but not enough to cause any discomfort or pain. Especially for the price, this has become my favorite little bonus product in my weekly routine :)

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: The most effective home peeling that I ever tried, it so gentle for my acne prone sensitive skin. I left it on my face for 8mins only, and I can feel it tingling on my skin, even after I wash it off with warm water it I still feel slightly tingling but not for too long, then I put my moisturizer straight away. Next following day I can tell that my skin feel so smooth, and slightly brighten up my acne marks. Im so impress that for $8/ bottle you really have a good use of it, especially I might just use it once in a week or maybe every 2 weeks, it will last you forever. It is worth to try! I like this peeling better than the drunk elephant sukari baby facial or their tlc framboos. Just remember, DO NOT OVERDO IT, follow the suggestion on packaging.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: This stuff is amazing. I’ve used quite a few acids so the stinging/tingling was extremely mild for me, but I was amazed how much smoother my skin looked the next day. It really minimized my pores and a new pimple I had popping up completely disappeared. I can hardly wait to see what happens with continued use. I did make sure to use a heavy moisturizer after.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text:
I have crap skin.  I was dealt the bad skin card, actually bad teeth and skin - I digress. I've just dealt with it my entire life. I'm 55 and I think I look okay for my age. Of course I could look better but I am going to go natural and have the lived in look because my experiences have made my face. 
BUT I'm trying the Ordinary product line mainly because of price point.  I mean - come on? Seriously can't beat $9 to try skin care? AND I love them all.  I slather them on and my face feels better if not looks better. The redness and angry of my skin of 55 years of abuse lessens. The dry and patchy - isn't so noticeable if only I know, but again, $9? And this stuff.  It's like using a sandblaster on a kitten. No seriously.  It really gives your skin some get-up and getttttttttt on outta here bad stuff.  
Try it on your finger tips before putting on your face gals. Seriously it erases  your finger prints.  NO I'm kidding but your fingertips even feel softer from moving the stuff around on your face.  It does make your skin softer and does even out things and makes you feel just better about how you look - even if you look like 10 miles of bad road before you used it - you'll look like 8 miles of bad road after using it. 
And sometimes bad roads are the best roads to travel. Right? <3 Seriously try this line......it's super amazing and it works!

review_text: I’ve used this only once and my skin drastically cleared up within a week. It does burn a little at first but you can really tell that your skin just feels cleaner and has a glow. Don’t let the low price fool you, this is an amazing product!

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I originally got this for to fade hyperpigmentation on my face, but I found I was too sensitive for that. I then tried it on my arms to see if it would help with my keratosis pilaris and also help fade those scars. After three weekly uses, it is almost completely cleared! I have battled this for years, and now my arms are smooth and will likely be scarless in just a few weeks! I know that it is not it's intended use, but I am so happy with the surprise results and at such an affordable price!

review_text: 1st off I love this brand. This product is strong but so effective. But, please do a test patch if your skin is sensitive. 10 minutes ONLY. Your skin will thank you.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I love this product!!!! I don't use it daily or weekly, but I bust it out of the cabinet every time I feel that my face is about to break out or just looks a bit dull. It really helped me after a major cystic acne breakout that left big red marks and scars on my face. Each and every time I used the peeling solution the acne marks got more and more feint. I actually (since it was crazy bad) used it as a spot treatment for post acne marks daily at one point. It is strong and if you use it more than it recommend it will leave your face red and peeling (but the spot treatment did work). Its amazing that such a powerful and effective peel sells for so cheap!! I have other peels now that I like using daily, but this will always be somewhere in my cabinet. A bit of warning though, this does tingle and sting like crazy if you don't use it properly. Read the label, don't use it on wet skin!! Your face need to be clean AND DRY!!! It stings like crazy when you put it on wet skin. I sometimes put masks on my face before jumping in the shower to wash it off and this is not the item to do that with. When I did that my face looked awful afterwards. If your face is really stinging badly it might not really be dry or you may just need to use it for less time. I worked my way up to full time. It can also be difficult to wash out completely. The red coloring is actually very useful in that sense because if you can still see it the peel isn't off your face.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Sodium Hydroxide, Daucus Carota Sativa Extract, Propanediol, Cocamidopropyl Dimethylamine, Salicylic Acid, Potassium Citrate, Lactic Acid, Tartaric Acid, Citric Acid, Panthenol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Tasmannia Lanceolata Fruit, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan gum, Polysorbate 20, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate, Ethylhexylglycerin, 12Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I bought this mask in feb this year and have (attempted to) use it once a week. but EVERY TIME I use it I get these painful and deep pimples and I notice that when I don’t use it, the pimples go away. I’ve never, ever had a product react like this and it made me so sad bc i really wanted it to work.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I expected this to be good, from all the reviews, but damnnnnnnn this is sorcery in a bottle! Don’t even think about it, just get it! I was incredulous about the instant results, but let me tell you... you rinse this “blood of virgins” off, and you see immediate results. My face looks amazing right now. I don’t have acne or scarring or anything really, and even then I’m like WOWWWW. So try it even if you don’t have any major concerns. This is magic! I can’t imagine what it’ll do after a few applications. I am excited!

review_text: First off, it’s not exactly as good as D.E. Babyfacial, but for the price difference it’s definitely still a good product and a great value. Does what it should. If your facial is already used to acids, 10 minutes is not very long, I started off slowly but can leave it on a bit longer for better results. Stock up on sunscreen because it’s a must when using this product.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: This was actually my first chemical exfoliant. When I saw people online recommend using a low concentration product and then building up to this, I was scared to use it. However, I didn’t have any issues or sensitivity. I guess my skin is resilient. It leaves my skin baby soft every time I use it. Though I wouldn’t recommend others to use this as their introduction to chemical exfoliants. Also, it is very important to stick to the mentioned duration and frequency of usage.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: this is the first real acid peel i’ve done, and grrrrl, i’m so glad i did! my experience with acids was just low percentages of salicylic to manage acne/congested skin. as it turns out, the skin journey continues after acne. over the past couple years i’ve looked towards expensive and inexpensive skin care to show my skin love, in hopes that in return my skin would show me some. Well, three days ago, it finally did! this peel smoothed texture!!! DRAMATICALLY reduced skin redness!!!eliminating dry/flaking skin (without it falling off? where did it go?!?)- and for the first time in years, i went out without makeup. just saying. already arming another bottle because this will be part of my new weekly routine, which includes a number of the Ordinary products. i did still use their 7% glycolic toner later in the same night without irritation, btw. everyone’s skin may not tolerate that, but my skin was so happy about the peel that i didn’t worry. i know this review sounds like an ad, but i’m just super impressed.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I have had quite a skincare journey my whole life, and after getting off Accutane two months ago I have been weary about which products to add to my skincare routine, and when. I waited to use a chemical exfoliant since I have very sensitive skin, and tried this one first. It is STRONG. As someone who has never used this kind of product at all, yet have very tough skin when it comes to retinoid and tolerating active ingredients but man does this burn! I had to immediately wash off. But, determined to give it a try I then applied a much thinner layer, in small sections of my face at a time rather than all at once. The next night after doing my skincare routine, I noticed my huge pores and ice pick scars on my under eye area on the sides of my nose where slightly smaller! I even sent pictures to friends and they said they noticed the difference too. I’m excited to se the results with continued once a week use. But after the first try, I’m already sold. If you’re having doubts, just get it!!

Despite the mild burning, though, it removes the dead skin buildup I get between my eyebrows and my skin always feels softer, without looking/feeling red and irritated once rinsed off.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text:
I’ve used this 3 times in the week and a half that I’ve had it. Even on dry, broken skin, it doesn’t feel as bad as you’d expect it to. I haven’t seen any results as far as limiting breakouts (in fact they’ve been worse but I think that’s from something else), but it has faded my old acne scars fairly dramatically. So far it also hasn’t shrank my pores or even cleaned my blackheads out much, but I’m hoping those will get better with more use. 
TL;DR don’t expect it to change what your skin does much, but it will lighten up any scarring/pigmentation fairly quickly.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I was scared to try this too because how cheap it was, but figured since it’s cheap, I wouldn’t be a total lost compared to other masks I shelled out more money for and didn’t work. Well, surprise, surprise. I am used to acids, I leave it on for 20-30 minutes. It does tingle on application, especially on my cheeks. I wash my face with a Clarisonic to loosen any dead skin cells before which helps with application. I use it once a week and noticed a difference in pure congestion. I haven’t seen significance in my acne scars, but at least my skin is clearing up.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text:
Let’s start by saying that for the price, this is an awesome product! Thank you Ordinary for bringing at great product everyone can afford. This is easily as good as any other at home peel on the market up to $35. If you are new to chemical peels or just want to try something new start here, you definitely will not regret the $8. It’s strong enough to make a difference but not too strong where people with sensitive skin should worry.

Now in the grand scheme of all at home chemical peels, this is probably 3/5 stars. There is no comparison to DE Baby Facial or Dr. Gross Chemical Grade but those come with big price tags. You would have to use Ordinary every other day for a week to equal one treatment of the high end brands but for the price it’s worth adding to your collection.

Personally, my skin isn’t overly sensitive. My face isn’t as sensitive as my neck and chest. I like to use the powerful Babyfacial on my face and Ordinary on my neck and chest (which would not handle the potency of Babyfacial). The Ordinary is still a great product that helps even out skin, minimize pores and can be applied multiple times in a week.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Sodium Hydroxide, Daucus Carota Sativa Extract, Propanediol, Cocamidopropyl Dimethylamine, Salicylic Acid, Potassium Citrate, Lactic Acid, Tartaric Acid, Citric Acid, Panthenol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Tasmannia Lanceolata Fruit, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan gum, Polysorbate 20, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate, Ethylhexylglycerin, 12Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol

I love DE mask and got this one bc lots of people said it works the same, but I can’t see the same results or resemblance. It’s hard to apply it bc it’s very watery so I can’t layer it thick like I like my masks. Regardless of the consistency I don’t get that deep clean feel that I do after the baby facial and don’t feel like it’s getting rid of my dry patches. I don’t get the tingle at all that I usually get with acid masks ..don’t think I’ll repurchase unless I am on a tight budget.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: About an hour ago this showed up on my doorstep, and I decided I should try it immediately to give my face a chance to calm down before an event tonight since peels tend to leave me red right after. BUT NOT THIS. I am blown away by this product! The GLOW UP! I washed my face, let it dry for a few minutes until my skin felt tight, and then spread this on with my fingers and set my first timer for 5 minutes in case the stinging was bad. Once the 5 minutes were up I repeated it for another 5 because it wasn't bothering me, and then after 10 minutes total I washed it off. This is the EASIEST mask to use, because it really does wash off easily. My skin just looked bright and happy in the mirror, and then once I added my normal serum and moisturizer my skin was glowing. I really hope using this on a weekly basis will help keep up with the constant exfoliation I need from using retinoid at night. I am sold and I will be adding an extra bottle to my next Sephora cart to keep on hand. Also, this is better than Sukari Babyfacial... that's saying something.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text:
The Ordinary’s AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution gets great results, and the economical price is amazing!

I used to use Drunk Elephant’s Babyface Sukari TLC for a long time, but it is very expensive. I also used REN Glycol Lactic Radiance Mask— also great, still a bit expensive.

The Ordinary gets exactly the same results for much less money! I will repurchase over and over!

Tip: Make sure your skin is DRY by waiting or using a blow dryer or fan. I thought my skin was dry but it must have still been a little damp. Woooo yeeee, it stings on damp skin!

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text: I can’t believe I spent over 8 times the price of this for Babyfacial. I do like babyfacial but the difference in cost for something that performs just as well if not better is crazy. This is a mask to do carefully however you shouldn’t be afraid! I would begin carefully and do it for maybe half the time starting out if you don’t have experience with these peels. They have made a huge difference in my skin and in my opinion everyone should be using them (unless you have extremely sensitive skin) instead of physical exfoliaters which damage your skin and gives you a false sense of cleanliness. I have been using tretinoin.05% for 2 years and I alternate every other night between that and framboos glycolic serum and once a week use this mask. I also apply flora and bast cbd oil every morning. I used to suffer from VERY persistent adult hormonal acne (I’ve seriously tried everything under the sun)...I believe everything is helping but I strongly believe the cbd oil and this mask have changed my skin texture completely.

name: AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution
review_text:
There's a reason this is probably one of the top rated products on Sephora's entire website and it's because IT IS AMAZING. This is the cheapest, yet most effective product I've used. I've finally gotten my adult acne under control (with a prescription) and feel like I've tried EVERYTHING to minimize my scarring, but nothing has worked as quickly or as well as this. My skin is legit baby soft, I compared it to my newborn cousin's last week! Plus, I have fewer blackheads, my pores are smaller, and my skin tone is much more even. Yes it tingles, yes it kind of looks like blood, but I've had better results with a handful of uses of this $7 solution than I've had with regular professional peels. 

ALSO my 59-year old mother uses it bi-weekly and raves about it. We have totally different skin but this is a staple for both of us. Don't hesitate to buy, but DO follow directions (PM use and time limit!) and wear sunscreen.

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text:
This is a very simple and straightforward product, so there isn’t much to criticize. If you’re someone who needs hydration for your skin, a hyaluronic acid serum like this one would be a great addition to your routine. Hyaluronic acid is one of the (if not THE) best ingredients out there when it comes to attracting moisture from the atmosphere to your skin. The best way to use this is to apply it onto a face that isn’t completely dry, then follow up with a moisturizer in order to lock that moisture in. Of course, if you have other skincare concerns, just using this serum won’t be enough to solve everything for you, and you’ll have to layer your other products in addition to your hyaluronic acid. It might be smarter to just buy another product that contains hyaluronic acid as well as other ingredients you need — this would decrease the number of layers you’d have to do, which is preferable. 

The only thing I’m not a huge fan of is the texture. It’s a watery gel but something about this serum feels a little slimy. It can even feel slightly sticky at first. I prefer The Ordinary’s Marine Hyaluronics much more. That product has a straight up watery texture (it literally feels like you’re putting water on your face) and is therefore much thinner and lighter in consistency, which makes it more ideal for layering. 

Overall not a bad product and very affordable.
ingredients: Sodium Hyaluronate, Pentylene Glycol, Propanediol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Panthenol, Ahnfeltia Concinna Extract, Glycerin, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hexylene Glycol, 12Hexanediol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text: This product took me a little while to get the hang of. I experienced the problem noted by many that it pills under makeup, which it definitely does. As it is did for me under serums and other face creams. The instructions mention to mix it with water based products but that didn’t work for me either. What i do now is went my hands with just a little bit of water and then apply the product.I give it a good 10-15 minutes to sit and soak in, and then I’ll apply my next product. It’s not very convenient and I can’t apply this product when i’m in a rush but I do like it and it’s an excellent value.

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text:
Before I get to my review, make sure you use this product on damp skin! I was applying it to my skin dry after washing, but it works best and is easier to apply once you've washed and your face is still damp.

I have dry spots (eyes and lip area), eczema, and it's all worse in the winter. I've been using this for about 3 weeks now and it's certainly helped keep my skin softer and flake-free. It's kept the dryness/flakiness at bay.  For the price and given the results, I can't complain. Also, no purging or acne and I tend to break out when using new skincare products. I'll be repurchasing.

I know that if you are in a dry area, the hyaluronic acid will draw moisture from your skin - leaving it drier, so I tried to pair this product with light moisturizers, but it caused me to breakout. It doesn’t layer well with makeup either. At night, it’s super drying - it’s not a comfortable feeling. I’ll pass. I’d still recommend it because hyaluronic acid is a great product for (if used properly), but I suggest you do a patch test because this formulation may not work for you

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid is a good (but not great) way to boost your skincare with plain hyaluronic acid or just try to see how this ingredient works for you, given the low price. Texture and effectiveness wise there are many other better hyaluronic acid products out there. I have combination skin and sometimes I feel the need to add extra hyaluronic acid to my routine, to help with dryness. The Ordinary one does help with hydration and smoothness, but doesn't plump my skin as other similar boosters did. The texture is not very elegant (it's a liquid jelly), it has some tackiness and it's somewhat sticky; I used it at night only so it didn't bother me that much. It layered well with the other products in my routine (I usually apply it after exfoliating, before other serums and treatments); but it doesn't work well under make-up; it piles when combined with some products, but I only had this issue with a specific primer and serum. I personally don't like dropper packaging, I prefer airless bottles; like most of The Ordinary droppers, the cap is stiff and hard to open most times; if you don't clean the rims well, `salt` starts forming around the mouth making the bottle harder to open. I know it's cheap, but good functional packaging is not that expensive.

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text: This hyaluronic serum is my favorite right now.  Yes, like other reviews have said, it's different from others I have tried.  When you apply it to wet skin, it sometimes gets a little bit foamy but that absorbs quickly.  It's a thicker serum than most HAs.  It smells kind of like a cold soft pretzel you would get at a baseball game so that's a little weird.  It takes a minute to absorb and if you over use it a little pilling can come up.  Despite those things, this is one of the BEST HAs I've tried as far as efficacy.  My skin is so hydrated when I use this morning and night.  I only use one full dropper and I haven't had any pilling issues with that amount.  You cannot beat this price and I love that it's now available in a larger size!  I recommend this HA to people all the time.  Remember to follow up with an occlusive moisturizer.

review_text: This product is one that has really changed my skin... finally. Im a skeptic when it comes to serums so this really surprised me. I was prone to having these tiny little acne bumps on my face, dark spots from sun exposure and scars - the list can go on. I always thought that my skin was oily because it was compensating for the lack of hydration it was getting - so I loaded on the cream moisturizers. My skin was still oily and I continued to get acne. So finally I just did some research and took a chance by using hyaluronic acid and an oil-free moisturizer. These in combination have changed my skin. This product locks in the moisture the gel-based moisturizer adds. Moisturized skin, without the oily-ness all day. (I use the tatcha water cream with it).

review_text:
Have gone through a few bottles of this and am so glad Sephora carries it now. I used to purchase through a website but so glad I can purchase now through the Sephora app when I run out. 

This is great just after the shower to seal in moisture before finishing your moisturizing routine. It’s a bit firming and tightening and just lovely. When I don’t use this I really notice a difference.

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text:
I was so excited when I saw Sephora was selling the Ordinary as I've been wanting to try this line but it was hard to get in the US.  So when the line went on sale on the ap I bought almost the whole range of products.

I normally live in a tropical climate and coming to a cold, dry climate has wreaked havoc on my skin.  Dry, scaly patches all over my face and neck no matter how much I moisturized and oiled (and I have a huge high-end skincare collection) and acne at the same time - come on!  I was trying everything and this serum is the only one that got rid of my dry flaky patches, and turned my skin into soft, porcelain texture, and OVERNIGHT.  This is an example of less is more folks.  You don't need a million ingredients to address a million problems you just need one that does what is says it will do!

A note on the texture.  Since this serum does not contain any skin-damaging alcohol like many serums, it has a thicker texture and is sticky when you first put it on.  The product does absorb beautifully but you need to wait a lot longer than a normal commercial serum before layering on any other skincare products or makeup.  I made the mistake the first time of only waiting a minute, layering on top of this the niacinamide serum for my acne spots, and so the serum pilled when I put on my moisturizer.  But I have since found that these two steps prevent pilling and leave me with baby soft, non-sticky skin:

1. If using more than one The Ordinary serum, I mix them together in my palm first then pat on, as opposed to layering one on top of the other.
2. I let the serums completely absorb before applying any other products

And that's it!
ingredients: Sodium Hyaluronate, Pentylene Glycol, Propanediol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Panthenol, Ahnfeltia Concinna Extract, Glycerin, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hexylene Glycol, 12Hexanediol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text: This was my first purchase from The Ordinary and my first ever hyaluronic acid product.  I must say that I’m really impressed! At the first application, my skin looked visibly plump and glowing. The price makes this even more worth it. You need very little and the dropper is very helpful in dispensing the right amount. I love this product BUT I knocked off one star for one reason only which is under makeup, this product pills very badly! I’ve also tried one from  the inky list and while that one doesn’t pill, it doesn’t hydrate as well as this one. I’ll be sticking with this one in the future but beware that the pilling can be frustrating.

review_text: This was an exiting discovery since I've splurged on a different brand of expensive HA serum in the past. In my experience, most pure HA formulas feel like water and apply invisibly, but this one is so gloopy and thick. Plus it actually foams up almost like soap when applied to your skin. It feels tacky, doesn't fully absorb, and you can forget about wearing underneath makeup or applying SPF on top because it pills horribly. I'll finish using the rest of the bottle on my neck and chest, which shouldn't take long since you can quickly deplete a bottle of this stuff with regular use (I'm talking 2-3 weeks). Two stars for cool packaging and concept. I'll still try some of The Ordinary's other offerings.

review_text:
I started a new job, hit allergy season face first and had a high number birthday - so major face freakouts occurred! Time to fix my skincare. 
This is the first The Ordinary product I tried and I am now a convert. I will not give up my fave Algenist moisturizers and serums but I am adding The Ordinary’s Hyaluronic Acid to my morning serum and my skin looks amazing. 
The Hyaluronic Acid serum is thick and goopy and a little goes a very long way. I mix it in my fingers with my regular serum then apply to my face and neck. It does take longer to sink in before I can apply my moisturizer and makeup. But my (very judgey) Mom actually told me my skin was glowing within the first few days of using this! And no irritation to my sensitive combo skin. 
Sold, love, will order for years and highly recommend!

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text: I have a TON of dark marks, redness, and acne scars on my face that I was genuinely beginning to believe were permanent. Most skincare products that I used just maintained my current skin condition and kept it hydrated rather than healing old marks and scars. Enter this beautiful little baby - my skin has never looked more clear, hydrated, and glowy! Almost all of my dark marks are gone, my scars have drastically faded, my acne cleared up, and my skin feels SO hydrated and dewy. I use just one dropper-full of product every night before bed after I apply The Ordinary's glycolic acid toner, and it's made a massive difference in the texture and appearance of my skin. Highly, highly, HIGHLY recommend - I'm never living without this again!

review_text: Hyaluronic acid is one of my favorite ingredients in skincare because it draws moisture to your skin. ingredients: Sodium Hyaluronate, Pentylene Glycol, Propanediol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Panthenol, Ahnfeltia Concinna Extract, Glycerin, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Isoceteth20, Ethoxydiglycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hexylene Glycol, 12Hexanediol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text: This stuff is a godsend for me! I have SUPER dry, sensitive skin, and when I layer this on prior to my serums and moisturizer, it helps everything penetrate deeper into my skin so it's super soft and smooth. A little bit goes a long way! And at this price, you can't beat it. I use it morning and night after my toner and before my serums. If you spray a little water as well, such as the Caudalie Grape Water, it REALLY absorbs and stays in your skin. Keep in mind - hyaluronic acid alone is NOT moisturizing! You have to pair it with serums and moisturizers for the best effect. It just helps pull moisture into the skin, instead of sitting on top.

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5
review_text:
I developed dry patches a couple of months ago, and since then I've been on the search for products to help with my dry skin. I use this right before my moisturizer at night and in the morning and apply it on dampened skin. I use the Mario Bedescu facial spray to dampen my face and then apply a couple of drops. This product dries quickly and doesn't leave any weird residue. It's thicker than what I thought it would be, but I actually like that!
I added this into my skin care routine at the same time I added 2 other products, so I'm not sure if this product gave me the results or if it was a combination of all, but my dry patches have seriously improved BY A LOT since I started using this. My skin is supple and feels sooooo much more moisturized than when I was JUST using moisturizer. 
4 stars only because I haven't been using it for too long so i'd like to see how it works over a longer period of time. I would recommend to everyone though because of the amazing price!! If it doesn't work out for you, you won't be out much, so that's a plus.

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text:
So for reference, I have very pale, sensitive, red, splotchy skin. I have large pores and break out a lot. 
I recently starting following the K beauty 10 step routine and included these 2-3x a week in place of an exfoliant. 
Since I use a bunch of things on my face, it’s hard to credit the improvement to just one product BUT I’ve been using the extra moisture from these pads on my décolletage area (and nothing else) and I couldn’t believe the difference! The redness is almost completely gone and it’s so smooth. 
I couldn’t believe it, especially because I was just using left over product and didn’t think so little product would make a difference.
