review_text: I literally just created an account to be able to review these products. I work part time in a factory that has no AC in the hot humid Canadian summers, and now add a mask onto this, yikes for my skin. These daily peels are a skin saver for me during bad breakouts! I started using them a year ago and I really only use them when my skin is really bad but within 2 days my break outs subside and my skin is glowing. I always keep an eye on Sephora for promos or when these are apart of the rewards and stock up cause they aren't cheap. However, I also make the product last a bit longer by cutting them in half, because I find otherwise the entire square is too much for my face!

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text: I am a teenage boy with severe acne. I break out like crazy and my face gets severely  inflamed. A girl from Sephora was dying over these and said she cleared her acne with these, so I decided to splurge on the $88 box with 35 pads :(. These pads really tingled my face very painfully when I rubbed them on my face, but my skin felt baby smooth when I woke up. I had smooth skin, but I had severely RED burning skin. 10 days in, my acne has been calmed down. Like crazy calmed down, I haven’t gotten a zit in days and my pimples are shrinking, but my face is still red, even after some aloe. 20 days. I’m shook. My pimples are gone and my scaring is fading, but my face is still inflamed and my face is very sensitive to the sun with this product. I live in Cali, so I’m exposed to the sun 24/7 and get sensitive regardless with a hat and sunscreen. 30 days in, im really impressed by how my pimples have been gone, scarring is getting better, but my face is still very red with these. Honestly, I would use these, but get the less intense version and wear a hat and loads of sunscreen!!!
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text: I bought 3 of the 5 treatment boxes so I was able to use this for 15 days straight. I have oily combo skin, prone to acne and not sensitive. I have a specific serum that keeps my acne & texture at bay but stopped using it because these peel pads are potent and really shouldn't be mixed with other active ingredients. Anyway, now I am done with the pads and I must say I'm impressed and underwhelmed at the same time. The pads sting every single time and they are wasteful as everybody has mentioned. But I noticed that using these pads removed all of the blackheads/texture on my nose, it is super smooth and shiny now! I removed stars because these pads did not keep my acne & texture away and it did not brighten or have any super noticeable results. These are super potent so I expected my whole face to be smooth and texture-free but that was not the case so I dont see myself buying them again.

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text: These have drastically improved the texture of my skin. I only use step one as step two has dimethicone in it which doesn't agree with my skin, and I just leave it on. It's called extra strength, but I find that it's well-formulated enough that leaving it on actually benefits my skin. I have struggled with my skin for the past four years and I have had friends ask me what foundation I'm using when all I'm wearing is a little bit of tinted moisturizer my skin is so smooth from using these. Highly recommend.

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text:
To give you a sense of how much I love these daily peels: I have been a Sephora fanatic for over a decade now, and this is only the 2nd review I’ve ever written. To give you a sense of my skin: it’s incredibly sensitive and acne prone; I have used Retin-A, antibiotics, Accutane, Spironolactone, Benzoyl Peroxide / Clindamycin, Aczone, Differin, Renee Roulee Anti-Bump serum (formerly Anti-Cyst), and countless other prescription and OTC products.

These peels are AMAZING! I have sensitive, dehydrated, flaky yet oily skin with cystic / hormonal acne, blackheads, and rosacea. When I started using these peels (once daily at night with nothing applied after), I had been fighting a horrible breakout of acne / blackheads / bumpy rash on my chin after discontinuing 200 mg Spironolactone (max dose). I had tried multiple different prescription and OTC acne products for over a month to try to clear the breakout to no avail. The first morning after using, my skin looked SO much clearer — the bumps had flattened, the acne didn’t hurt as much, my blackheads looked better, my complexion was more even, etc. The second morning, the pain was basically gone, the acne had almost completely flattened, blackheads and skin bumps looked immensely improved, etc. I’m hoping that my skin continues to progress in this way, and intend to write an updated review once I’ve been using longer.

I had no lasting irritation with this product, but the first night I used it, my face did flush and stay a bit red / warm for a few hours after application. It stings a bit *while* using but not after, and it does not leave my skin irritated. My face tingles intermittently for a few hours after application, which I love (it means something is working!).

If you have difficult skin and are scared to try these due to the ingredients, strength, and concept (peeling always made me think initial breakout), do not hesitate! These may be just the product you need to simplify your routine and clear your skin!
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text:
30 year old acne prone girl here with lots of red marks from picking. I was using the prescription ACZONE from my derm which was helpful for a while keeping acne at bay, but then a couple months ago I had a huge flare up on my jawline/chin/neck durnig that time of month (i always break out more during that time, but this time it was AWFUL!). 

So I got the DAILY universal peels first 30 day. Seemed to help some and I didnt have any bad reactions, but progress was not great after two weeks. So I upped it to extra strength.

Within the first use I was breaking out all over again. So I stopped and went back to my universal dailies. Skin started to clear up. 

Then I tried to go back again to extra strength. BREAKING OUT AGAIN.

Sticking to the universal ones. Hopefully I'll see better difference otherwise I don't get the hype of this product.

However, it takes me a long time to use this peel just once per day b/c it really hurt (tingling) at the beginning. I started with one pack of wipes every two days for about three weeks, and one pack every one days for about two weeks, and now one pack every day. I have to admit that this peel help my face the most when I use it every day. So I imagine it will work even better if I can tolerate tingling (but I can’t), and use it twice daily. Overall, I think the peel worth to buy.

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text: These Dr. Dennis Gross Daily Peel pads are an absolute game-changer. They are so easy to use, super convenient even for travel, and best of all, THEY WORK. I have combination skin that is dull with some redness and texture. I’m mid-30s and had perfect skin my whole life until I got pregnant, and it’s never gone back to what it was before. Now I have to work at it! These pads have made my dull skin look radiant and glowing. My pores look smaller, my texture is smoothing out, and fine lines are lessening. These pads replace a ton of other serums and treatments that I have in my current arsenal of skincare products! Wish I’d found them sooner!

review_text: I've been using this for a couple of months now and from the moment I began using this daily peel, it become a HOLY GRAIL. I used to have discoloration, dull/dry skin and acne. I use to wear foundation most of the time because I was not confident enough to go out with a bare face, but after using these daily peels I can run out the door without make up.

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text: I never heard of these until I was offered a chance to sample these from pinchme. I was a lil scared and skeptical about trying these at first but was beyond happy that I did. The first treatment step does smell weird/strong but I got past that. Second treatment smelled alot better. They were extremely easy to use/apply and I didn't experience any burning sensation or any discomfort while or after using. Within just 2 hours after my first treatment I noticed how much more incredibly soft and smooth my skin felt. After using my 3rd treatment all the tiny small under skin bumps on my forehead was completely gone and I was sold on these. My forehead hasn't been this smooth and bump free in years! I'm definitely gonna be a loyal user of these from now on. Definitely one of my all time holy grail products ever! Don't waste any time thinking about trying and just do it. You'll thank me.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text: I love this product for three reasons! Firstly, it actually works. I have problem skin that is oily and prone to breakouts and I really on at home peels to keep it in check. I was a habitual user of Dr. Brandt but I’ve made the switch. Secondly, it doesn’t dry my skin out but leaves it taught and refreshed. Thirdly, single use packets are so convenient and keep waste to a minimum.

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text: I must admit, I was a little nervous about trying this product,... I had never used a peel before this Dr. Dennis Gross Alpha Beta Extra Strength Daily Peel. I made sure to follow the instructions exactly and I was pleasantly surprised with my results! This specific peel is a two-step process,... First you apply the exfoliating/smoothing treatment, wait 2 minutes, and then apply the anti-aging neutralizer. The first step did have a slight burning sensation, but it wasn’t severe enough to cause me major concern. I followed through with the second step and finished off my evening by moisturizing my face. After just one use, I saw a huge improvement in the radiance and smoothness of my skin. Even though the brand assures you that you can use this peel daily, the instructions do say that first time peel users may apply every other day until their skin becomes acclimated. That’s the option I went for and I absolutely loved seeing the beautiful transformation that my skin went through while using this product from Dr. Dennis Gross! My skin is slightly on the sensitive side, but this product did not irritate my face or cause any negative reactions whatsoever! I would gladly buy more of these Alpha Beta Extra Strength Daily Peels to incorporate into my skincare routine!

review_text: Having received a couple as a sample it is good to give first impressions.  The pads are easy to use and conveniently kept in their own packaging.  The feel- not as soft as some wipes I have felt. Is that because of the acids? The effect- not as gentle as some peel products I have tried.  This isn't my go-to, however, if you don't want to tote a bottle of product with you, then these would be quite handy for travel.  5* for travel.

name: Alpha Beta® Extra Strength Daily Peel
review_text: I have skin that is very acne prone and not sensitive, as I use acids on a daily basis so Im used to them. This did not irritate my skin as much as I thought it would. It was red a little but nothing horrible. My skin was left smooth, all the dead skin was wiped away and I was left with skin that felt amazing. These are extremely expensive, however I use them every other day. I would NOT suggest anyone with sensitive skin to use these, as I use multiple acids (acid toner, acid serum, acid moisturizer) all in one routine and that is why my skin did not react negatively to this. My skin needs something SUPER strong to keep the pores clear and acne away and this has helped with scarring and active acne! Love this!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
I had never used a vitamin-C product before buying a tube of this. The main reason I purchased it was because TLC Framboos worked so incredibly well for me, I thought I would “boost results” by using a day serum as well. 
I do like this product. I have sensitive combination skin with acne scars, and I live in a large metropolitan area with pollution so I figured I’d be a prime candidate for the product. 
The main perk of this for me is that my skin is LUMINOUS when I use it under my makeup. My face glows and my boyfriend and coworkers have complimented me. 
I’m not sure it has dissolved dead skin cells or faded sun spots or acne scars, however, it has helped with dullness and my skin feels plumper. 
The formula itself is watery and orange. I keep it in my skincare fridge and mix a *small* pump with a pump of B-Hyrda after washing my face in the morning. It’s tacky but don’t let that scare you- let it sink in for 5 minutes. This product tingles in a good way- I can definitely tell when it sinks in. I put makeup (with SPF!!) on top of it and it seems to hold up well. 
Bottom line- this isn’t my favorite DE product but it delivers some results. After I run out, I might try to see if I notice any difference in my skin before deciding whether to re-buy or not.

review_text: I enjoy putting this product on my face every morning (despite the smell and stickiness), because it gives my skin a nice glow for the day. However, it is not very effective at reducing the appearance of sun damage or hyperpigmentation from mild acne scarring. As a result, I do not think it is worth $105+HST. name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I really wanted to love this but after a month of use, I realized it was only making my skin worse, not better. I am new to DE and I started with using the TLC serum nightly and added this C serum to my routine for use during the day. My skin purged a lot and I thought it was from the TLC because I’m pretty new to AHAs and BHAs, but 3 weeks in and my skin still wasn’t getting better. I was about to give up DE products all together because my skin was so terrible and I had horrible red bumps and patches all over my face but the woman at Sephora told me to keep using it because it usually takes 30-60 days to see results. I started using this every other day to give my skin a break and the first day I skipped it my skin immediately looked better. I will discontinue using this but will continue my other DE products, because now I am noticing the results I was looking for. The TLC is amazing! I also really enjoy the marula oil and the lala retro. This and the protini (which also gave me bumps/milia) were no’s for me. :(

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
Let me first disclose, I have only been using this product for 2 weeks.

Every morning, I religiously mix 1 pump C-Firma with 1 pump B-Hydra and apply to my clean face, neck and décolleté. The first couple of days, I didn't see much of that "glow" everybody was talking about. After almost a week of use, my skin radiates from under my makeup! A little about my skin, I am combo in the summer and a little drier in the harsh winter months. So dewy skin is very much welcomed! I feel my skin stays hydrated throughout the day, my makeup applies beautifully on top without any issues.  There is a very faint scent to the actual product which does not bother me at all. I am curious to see how long this bottle will last me when I use it daily. Because it's only been a couple of weeks, I cannot comment yet on the long term results (therefore the 4 star review) since it takes about 6-8 weeks for you skin to adjust to new products. However, the short-term results, I have been very happy thus far!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
This is by far the most potent vitamin C serum I have used (I've also tried Farmacy's and OleHenriksen's versions). It brightens my skin and helps lighten hyperpigmentation. 
My skin is sensitive, but C-Firma never made my skin tingle or sting. It does hurt if I apply it over a scratch, but that's to be expected with any acidic product.
The only con: it really does smell smokey. When DE first launched C-Firma, it smelled strongly like hot dogs. I think later formulations smell less nasty but even now, it doesn't smell great. I've gotten used to the scent but it might be too off-putting to some.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This was the first product i ever purchased from DE. Its so potent and to be honest it made me purge some acne a little bit at the beginning which made me not love it completely at the start. I actually stopped using it for a few months. But then i returned to it after my skin cleared more, and it worked wonders for my hyperpigmentation. Now i use it every morning - even when i am in the middle of a bad break out as my skin clears up faster because of it. It has a tacky feeling so i will mix it in with either a moisturizer or a drop of BHydra so it spreads easier.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I so want to love Drunk Elephant products. They receive such great reviews from critics and customers. However, this is the second product I’ve tried and both broke me out. My makeup went on like it was sitting on top of oil and felt sticky.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This is a holy grail when it comes to getting rid of scars. I have had acne for about 6 ish years now and i have a lot of scars/dark spots. I cant tell you how many products i have tried at sephora for this iver the year and none worked. This PRODUCT IS MAGICAL. It fades your scars so quick you will notice a difference overnight (i only use it at night).  I believe after 5 uses your scar that you were targeting will be close to gone.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: WOW! My skin looks amazing! I am so happy with this product. I can't believe how great my skin looks. It is kind of expensive but I don't mind spending money on something if it actually works. I have tried so many vitamin C serums and none of them really showed any results I have been alternating between this and the DE retinol and my skin looks better than I think it ever has. I can actually go out without makeup and be proud of my skin. Thank You Drunk Elephant.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
Let me start off this review by saying DON’T LET THE HIGH PRICES FOOL YOU!!!! I had Drunk Elephant on my radar for over a couple years before biting the bullet and trying some of the products. I used to get a facial once a month but due to the pandemic I needed to really think about how I did this at home instead of relying on someone else. I had great skin in my teens, then my twenties hit, and my skin went downhill (mostly due to being on birth control & the different hormones). I have sensitive skin but also tan very well but I MUST keep my face out of the sun (due to tanning bed in my late teens early twenties & some bad sun burns on my face due to not wearing sunscreen). I have dark spots, freckles (a lot of them) & BAD melasma on my forehead. 

*The C-Firma™ Day Serum is now a must have staples in my morning skin care routine!!!!  I have noticed a better completion after using this and softer skin. I store it in the fridge (along with the C-Tango™ Multivitamin Eye Cream) so it goes on nice and cool and reduces any puffiness in the mornings. It has also minimized the appearance of my freckles with continued daily use.
ingredients: Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ascorbic Acid, Laureth23, Glycerin, Lactobacillus, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Phyllanthus Emblica Fruit Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Lactobacillus, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Hydrolyzed Quinoa, Phytosterols, Glutamylamidoethyl Imidazole, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Ferulic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tetrahydrobisdemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodiferuloylmethane, Glycine, Leuconostoc, Sucrose, Maltodextrin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Isohexadecane, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sorbitan Isostearate, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hydroxide, Chlorphenesin, Polysorbate 60, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Potassium Sorbate, Sorbic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
Honestly, I don't understand what the hype is about with this product. It smells horrendous, and causes your hands to smell like it too, and no amount of washing helps it come off. 

As far as effectiveness goes, I didn't see any difference after using up a whole $80 full size bottle. 

The packaging is supposed to keep it from oxidizing, but it begins to turn immediately upon opening, with a noticeable difference in the color browning over the course of just a few days.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I had used for 3 years before switching brands. I took off one star for the change of ingredients which I find to be more tacky and sticky and has lead to more breakouts. And another star for the price. After doing plenty of research I’ve realized there’s actually plenty of great alternatives like mad hippie, timeless, and dr breners. It’s a good vitamin c but I just can’t justify the price anymore. I really don’t see the need to re purchase anymore.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I'm a fan of their TLC Framboos, Protini, and Umbra. I was hoping I'd love their C-Firma as much too, but it fell short. The first 3 weeks was fine, it didn't really do anything to my skin tbh, but it didn't irritate it or cause any breakouts. During the 4th week, the color of the product started to change, it became darker. I was told this might happen but the product should be fine to use. However, it became so sticky, it didn't absorb well on my skin, it just sits there, and my skin felt sticky and tacky, and when I layer things up, it starts to pill. I just had to return it.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Vit C is a skincare game changer, especially when used with other products like hyaluronic acid (or Drunk Elephant B-Hydra serum). The Drunk Elephant C-Firma is by far my favorite C product that I've used so far. It has a thin, serumy texture and as you apply into the skin it feels as though it "firms" into place. It's definitely something you have to try for yourself! There are no yucky extra ingredients in here, no added fragrance, just clean goodness!

review_text: Love this product! It's the ideal serum for my combo skin. It has reduced my breakouts, reduced the size of my pores, and I definitely feel like it firms my skin. I do wish it wasn't so expensive, but it should last a long time as you only need 1 pump for your entire face.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This is the third time I’ve tried this serum and I’ve always used it wrong! This always broke me out so I would always stop using it and pass it along. This time, I learned that vitamin c can be irritating for many people, and I learned from a dermatologist that a moisturized face is less likely to get irritated and is a better vehicle for other products. So, very hesitantly, I tried this again because I really wanted to get rid of hyperpigmentation from past acne. I moisturized, let it that dry completely, and THEN put this on... WOW! My acne scars are almost gone after a week and this has not broken me out. Try this method out if you find this breaks you out.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: if you can get past the smell that does NOT linger, it’s amazing. I was getting anxious because i didn’t notice results for a good 2/3 months. but i’m very happy. my skin is bright and clear now and no more breakouts. my skin was so good i didn’t even notice because it was that good. it gives a nice glow and glass like look. i tried to use the glow recipe pineapple one to save money but it sucks— get this instead, as painful as the price may seem

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I redeemed 100 points to receive the Drunk Elephant vitamin c serum through the Bazaar Rewards.  I'm disappointed.  I can't really tell if it's working and that's mainly because I don't like using this product.  It is not scent free.  Like many reviewers I notice a salty scent that reminds me of soy sauce but my husband say's he smells maple syrup.  The product is very sticky.  It doesn't matter what moisturizer or spray I add on top my face remains sticky.  I wish I had saved my points to redeem later on instead of getting this.  On the plus side the size of the bottle I got is quite small so I should run out of product soon and I didn't wast $105 on a full sized bottle.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This is an excellent vitamin c serum. It's the third brand of serum I've used in 8 years and is my favorite. The issue I have with vitamin-c serums in general is that they seem to do a good job getting your skin to look radiant and healthy, but they don't actually fade your dark marks. I've made peace with that over the years, by using c-serum with other skin-brightening agents. So I find that this c-serum, in conjunction with my prescription acne-scar medication, really does the trick in imparting a more even and radiant skin tone. Still I'm removing a star because it doesn't actually fade my acne scars (though it does brighten my skin and makes it look healthier and more even overall). Not bad at all!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I used this serum every morning for two weeks and my skin tone improved dramatically, it's much more even now. My acne scarring also faded and it brightened my complexion. It has a nice woody-orange scent that kind of reminds me of Christmas for some reason. I would sometimes follow with the Lala retro whipped cream for added moisture but it really doesn’t need it. It made my skin feel hydrated without making me look oily at all.

review_text: I had a pesky scar on my cheek from a cystic pimple that I just stopped keeping track of. I was halfway through the bottle when one day I noticed my scar was gone! name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Have been using the product for 3 years on and off. Works well overtime, results are not immediate. Does not cause any concerns on acne prone or sensitive skin. I apply this right after morning shower and Belief Moisture Bomb on top of it and Elta sunscreen. Only thing I noticed lately, on days I wear glasses, if I don’t allow the moisturizer to dry, it seems the skin on my nose where the glasses rest seems to become dry and seems to burns a bit. So let the product dry before wearing your glasses.

review_text:
I love almost all of DE products but this is a huge miss.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
Hands down my favorite vitamin C product! Easy to use, great texture, not too sticky (1 and sometimes a partial extra pump will do), sits beautifully under makeup! Unlike others I have tried (and there has been MANY) that I wanted to love but THIS IS IT! 

Many comment on the price but I think it is well worth the extra money!  If I could only pick one Drunk Elephant product I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this one. 

Also it's been mentioned a billion times but cannot be stressed enough do not stock up on this product (also says it right on the box). If you are a stocker like me purchase ONLY when needed and store in fridge if your skincare storage area runs warm.

review_text: This is a very heavy, weighty serum. Felt a little tingly and I could see some slight benefits in the overall dullness of my skin, but the smell is unbearable. Imagine a musky 5 year old mayonnaise sans the sourness. Based on the price, the slight benefit it had on my skin, and how horrible/lingering the smell that this will coats your face in, this is a definite no from me.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
This serum is LIFE CHANGING! I am a Licensed Esthetician and have not found a serum yet that worked for my skin... or worked at all. That is till i tried this serum. I purchased the Day in addition to the night serum and i am obsessed and are now a permanent staple in my skin care routine.

I have Oily/Combo skin that is also prone to breakouts

review_text: This serum I wanted to love so much but it actually causes me to break out every time I use it. I’ve used other drunk elephant products and absolutely loved them. I wish I loved this one. It’s expensive for the effects that I got. Unfortunately it wasn’t work the price I paid to have to fix the blemishes I got.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This serum is the only thing that works for my very picky skin. I get really bad texture and pesky blackheads. Nothing ever gets rid of them.. until this! I’ve been using it for 1 year now and just ran out and started using something else and my skin started to look dull and clogged. I started using this again and my skin went back to being clear and bright. The smell isn’t anything that bothers me. It fades after 1 minute. I absolutely love this and recommend!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: My skin hated this serum! I ended up with a chin full of whiteheads, blackheads, and milia while the rest of my face was all red. I ended up breaking out with large nodules. I really wanted this product to work for me, but after taking it in and out of my skincare routine, I kept getting the same results. It’s going to take about 9 months for all the red acne scarring to fade and I need to go to a dermatologist to get the milia removed. Don’t take a chance on this serum, it’s not worth the risk.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Why is it so orange? Almost seems likely it is already oxidized. It is also very sticky and takes forever to dry. At first I thought I received a bad sample but I purchased a different bottle and I still had the same tacky texture. For the price.. there are better more effective vitamin c serums out there.

review_text: Is it pricey?  Yes.  But I have not found a better Vitamin C product for my skin yet.  I was a newbie to skin care when I tried this and over time, it has helped improve the brightness and tone of my sun damaged skin.  Is it a miracle in a bottle? No, but it is a really solid product that does what it claims.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is the price.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This product goes on like a film and leaves my pores congested. in my T-zone. I shelled out the cash after hearing such wonderful things, and was nothing but disappointed. It says to wear it i the morning, but reacts with the Protini Moisturizer and turns into a weird lather. So, rather than messing up my daily moisturizer I try to use it at night, but it is still no good. This products goes on slimy and leaves my skin feeling tacky and gross. I love the results, but it's not worth the price, hassle, or skin downfalls.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I haven been using this product for 4 years in conjunction with their TLC and baby facial. I apply this every two days and it is holy grail status for me. I find this especially helpful after dermaplaning/waxing. It gets rid of any shadows around the mouth within days! This product really helps with hyperpigmentation, dark spots and post acne marks. I highly recommend this serum.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Didn’t know there was a product on the market that could make such a difference in my skin. In 2 weeks my skin was brighter, pores refined and pigmentation significantly reduced. In fact, I have freckles I hadn’t seen in years showing clearly. The only reason why I didn’t give 4 stars is because the serum is thick and leave a sheen on the skin that’s more oily looking than glowy. Disclaimer: I have oily skin

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This is by far the worst vitamin C serum out there. It goes off super quick so unless you plan on using the whole bottle in about 30 days, your going to waste your money. Once it turns dark orange and has that chemical smell its bad. Also, dont think about purchasing this as a back up. I did that, didnt even open the bottle up and then went to go use it and it was expired (only had it in my possession for about 2 months un opened)

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I really wanted to like this. I like the brand a lot and the minimal ingredients, no fragrance, and honestly super cute packaging has won me over. This product in particular, however, is a fail. Bottom line: it leaves my skin shiny/greasy looking & sticky and I haven't noticed any visible changes to my skin since using it (for months now). Even when I apply makeup over it, my face is insanely shiny when it normally isn't. I will go back to my old Vitamin C serum (which by the way is ~$25).

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I’ve tried other vitamin c serums and they ended up coagulating and rubbing off my skin leaving it feeling dried out or irritated. This one has been so perfect even when mixing with other daytime serums. Would highly recommend.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I’m in love with this Vitamin C serum. It smells amazing and it has really toned my skin. The fine laugh lines around my mouth and the lines on my neck have been minimized. My neck is where I noticed the most firming. I don’t use the serum every day because it’s pretty strong. You definitely need a good moisturizer but it’s not so firming that you’re uncomfortable. Definitely worth it.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This by far my favorite. It instantly gives me that glow I want that last all day. I use this serum everyday sometimes I add a couple drops of Marula oil and if you want fast results add one pump of Glycolic Night Serum day and night. No joke you will see fast results immediately. I used to use it that way when I first got it but now that my skin looks amazing I only use this in the day time and my Glycolic at night only. This is actually better than the Glycolic serum I just love the line so I’d rather use their night serum instead of another brand.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Love this serum!i mix it with the bhydra when my skin feels more sensitive but I use it alone a lot too. Vit c is so important! I love that this serum isn’t chalky like a lot of other vit c creams and serums. Make sure you keep it in the fridge and only buy it as needed! Don’t stock up! My skin definitely looks brighter and more youthful when I use it consistently

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I have repurchased this many, many times.  It is my go to daytime serum and it works SO well brightening and firming.  It's really one of those things that you don't realize how much of a difference it's made until you stop using it.  It feels nice and lightweight, doesn't cling pores.  Yes, the smell is a bit odd but it doesn't really bother me and dissipates quickly.  It DOES oxidize after about 4 months but that is to be expected from Vit C serums containing L ascorbic acid.  I feel like everyone over 30 really should be using a Vit C and this is a great option.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Best VitC serum I've ever tried. Really makes my skin glow. Did not like that it came light orange in the mini size, contacted DE to see if it was still good and they said it was good for another 6 months. Did an apple test, still good. Ordered full size because a) I love it b) to see if there is a difference in colour/efficacy when at a different colour.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I've been using this as a daytime serum for about two weeks now, and it definitely lives up to the hype.  My skin is noticeably glowier, even after I wash my face at night.  Unlike others, I didn't have any reaction, even though I have sensitive skin.  Nevertheless, C-Firma could use some improvement - it's a little thinner than I would have liked, and leaves my skin slightly greasier, but this is easily fixed with setting powder. Also, after application, my hands smell like pennies unless I wash them, but I'll take the smell over synthetic fragrance.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I'm convinced I got a bad batch of this stuff. I sure hope I did. The night serum is so thin and absorbs quickly. This day serum is so thick and oily. I do notice it is giving my skin a glow, but I really hate how it goes on compared to Tatcha and Ole Henriksen serums for example. I really wanted to love this stuff as much as I love the night serum.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I love how thin and watery this serum is, it makes it so easy to apply...but it also dries down in a kinda weird way that makes it sticky to where if you don’t work fast or you don’t have enough product on your fingers it get hard to apply bc you’ll get stuck on sticky patches of fast drying areas, making it hard to glide over the skin and tugging which is not great. As far as effectiveness though I do feel it works! Reduction of dark spots and increase in even tone

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I have been wanting to add a vitamin C serum to my skincare regimen, so I was very excited to receive this! I like the texture of it after it dries. The smell out of the bottle isn’t too bad (I was expecting the worst after reading all the “hot dog water” comments). I do notice a slightly metallic smell that lingers on my hands, but not a big deal. I mix it with the B-Hydra, let it sink in while I do my hair, and then put sunscreen on top. No pilling or anything! I think my skin is a little more glow-y, but I’ll need to use for longer to see if there are long term effects. I’m now curious to compare this to a cheaper vitamin C serum since this one is rather expensive, especially if it’s only a matter of months before it oxidizes!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I just got this as a sample just to check it out. It did lessen the appearance of my post pimple marks within 2 weeks of using it. Didn’t do much for my dark spots, but maybe it will over time. It’s nice that it has a reservoir effect (you’ll know because you can still smell it a little even after washing your face). The smell is odd, but that’s how you know they use clean ingredients.

review_text: Really great Vit C product. I've used cheaper ones and also tried Ole Henriksen samples and this is the one that I've noticed really makes a difference. After about a week I notice my skin texture evening out and my acne scares faded quite quickly as well. Definitely love this product and the whole DE line. I mix this with the B-Hydra gel as recommended and am considerably brighter and less dry in the winter.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Stopped using this during winter because it was too drying. Found it in my bathroom cabinet and started using it a few weeks ago. Clogged my pores terribly! I’m still trying to recover! Threw it out!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Love this serum!i mix it with the bhydra when my skin feels more sensitive but I use it alone a lot too. Vit c is so important! I love that this serum isn’t chalky like a lot of other vit c creams and serums. Make sure you keep it in the fridge and only buy it as needed! Don’t stock up! My skin definitely looks brighter and more youthful when I use it consistently

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I just added this product to my skin care regimen about 1.5 months ago and I am loving the difference it is making to my skin. My concerns with my skin are with the brown spots and skin preventative. My skin is brighter and doesn't seem to be red or irritated pre/post menstruation (let's face it, hormones are awful during this time

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I had never used a day serum before this product and I love it! I have been using the DE system for six months and have not had a single breakout or day with dry skin. My dark spots have faded significantly and my fine lines have diminished. I have used everything from La Mer to Obaji and nothing has impressed me more than this line.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I’ve been using the trial-sized version of this serum for about three weeks, but only as a targeted treatment. On my right cheekbone there’s a large, brown sun spot, about the size of peanut. My skin is healthy, loves the sun and tans easily, but once you reach a certain age (41 for me), the consequences of sun exposure appear. The unsightly discoloration became increasingly annoying to me, as it can’t be covered with makeup. It was making my face look dirty. After a few weeks of strict exfoliating and using this serum immediately after, the spot has faded by half. It’s remarkable. I’m going to buy the full size now because I want to see if lighter discolorations can also be coaxed into vanishing. I’ve experienced no skin irritation despite the serum’s potency, though my skin isn’t sensitive. This is a wonderful, effective addition to my overall skincare strategy.
ingredients: Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ascorbic Acid, Laureth23, Glycerin, Lactobacillus, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Phyllanthus Emblica Fruit Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Lactobacillus, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Hydrolyzed Quinoa, Phytosterols, Glutamylamidoethyl Imidazole, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Ferulic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tetrahydrobisdemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodiferuloylmethane, Glycine, Leuconostoc, Sucrose, Maltodextrin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Isohexadecane, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sorbitan Isostearate, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hydroxide, Chlorphenesin, Polysorbate 60, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Potassium Sorbate, Sorbic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I got this serum because of all these good reviews but it is super sticky! I use it with hydra serum but still my skin gets super sticky and it is hard to apply my moisturizer and sunscreen after it. I really want to like it since it is a large container but i am really having serious difficulties.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I like this product so far. I have used it for about a week now. My face has looked very glowy, and I have noticed a slight fading of sunspots on my face. I have been using this mixed with B-Hydra serum and I am liking the combination.  I have been allowing myself more makeup less days than I am used to, because I feel like my skin is looking more even  and less spotty. One criticism I have is that this product has a slight odor to it. I'm not sure which ingredient is causing it, but they can't really hide it because the product has no fragrance added in.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This serum keeps my skin firm and radiant with a healthy glow! It's very lightweight, I like to pat it into the skin with my palm and fingers. It has the typical vitamin C scent that's definitely noticeable as you apply but dissipates once it dries. Leaves a soft and smooth finish.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: If you want an effective vitamin C treatment, look no further. This is the industry standard for vitamin C. Use in the morning after a balancing toner. It’s a bit sticky, which is a turn off as well as having a hefty price tag. But the results are worth it. I received this product complimentary for review purposes.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I love DE products, and was super excited about this—but after one bottle’s use wasn’t that in love and felt no need to repurchase. It was okay, but I’ve used other Vitamin C serums that provided better immediate and long-term results. I wouldn’t not use, but not at the top of my skin care reccos.

review_text: C-Firma has been part of my daily skincare routine every since my sister introduced me to the brand 2yrs ago. Great product with lasting results. I especially love that it comes with a pump and in an enclosed bottle so no light can get in to turn the product.

review_text: Stings if you have any open wounds from acne on the skin, and really don't see it does anything to my acne scar. Very very sticky, does not feel good when applying. I used up a whole full size religiously for 2 months, during those two months i had constant acne and im not sure if it actually caused it. Disappoint purchase.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
My faces Best Friend every single morning and all year round! I also follow this with Drunk Elephants B-Hydra serum every morning too. This vitamin C serum has made SUCH a difference in my skins brightness, fades discoloration, smooths texture and firmness! I simply can’t go without this! Haven’t found anything that outperforms this Vitamin C serum yet! 
I HIGHLY recommend the C-Firma serum and Drunk Elephants ENTIRE skincare line! I’ve gotten many friends & family hooked on DE!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I have only been using this product for two weeks so I will have to update later, but so far it's been a miracle worker for my the discoloration and acne marks. My skin has basically settled down recently after reducing/eliminating dairy and refined sugar, but I was left with a lot of pigmentation. Drunk Elephant's Baby Facial helped, but I wanted to find a product that could work on my skin each day. This serum noticeably lightens spots after two days, and they are basically gone in two weeks! I started off using it as a spot treatment to see if I would breakout out, and when I didn't, I switched to using it all over my face. I'm looking forward to using it this spring and summer as vitamin C is supposed to work in tandem with my sunscreen to protect my skin from the sun. It is not a cheap product, but it is one where I see the effects immediately. I highly recommend if you are looking for a good vitamin C serum and/or a way to even skin tone!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Honestly I'm not sure that this did anything to my skin that my other skincare products haven't. It has a slightly strange smell, but plenty of skincare does. I found that the recommended pairing with the b Hydra wasnt enough to really lock in moisture for my skin, especially against the harsh northeastern winters. I'd probably save my money and get a really nice moisturizer to pair with a vitamin c serum from a less expensive company. I liked it, but I can't justify the price.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: So, I loved this product despite the smell. I swear it went away after a week of use you just kinda get used to it and other products go on top so you stop noticing it. However, I just repurchased this product and there is certainly a reformulation. This serum used to come out orange and more acidic. I would always feel a slight tingle when applying it to my face. Now, this serum is clear and does not tingle at all. I genuinely thought I received a defective product because this change hasn't really been advertised. After digging a little I realized that this is a new formula. I've used it for a few days and it's very... different. I don't know that it's a bad change, but it's odd to not feel it working on my skin. I will continue to use this DE product simply because all other vitamin C serums have fragrance and this one does not.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
My main problem with this serum is the oiliness, one of the main ingredients is marula oil. That wouldn't be a problem for very dry skin, but I have combination skin. If i don't mix it with B Hydra, it leaves my face glowing, but not in a good way - more like an oily glow. It's also very liquid, would have loved for it to be a little thicker. 

The oxidation is also a real problem, it can feel like 2 different products if you get a fresh one vs one that is half into its shelf life. 

I do think it has powerful ingredients, and my skin likes it, it seems clearer and healthier while using this product. I appreciate the DE line, the products are clean and effective. 

However I can't say this is my favorite product, I wanted to love it but the oiliness and the price are my main drawbacks.
ingredients: Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ascorbic Acid, Laureth23, Glycerin, Lactobacillus, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Phyllanthus Emblica Fruit Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Lactobacillus, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Hydrolyzed Quinoa, Phytosterols, Glutamylamidoethyl Imidazole, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Ferulic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tetrahydrobisdemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodiferuloylmethane, Glycine, Leuconostoc, Sucrose, Maltodextrin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Isohexadecane, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sorbitan Isostearate, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hydroxide, Chlorphenesin, Polysorbate 60, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Potassium Sorbate, Sorbic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I have only been using this product for two weeks so I will have to update later, but so far it's been a miracle worker for my the discoloration and acne marks. My skin has basically settled down recently after reducing/eliminating dairy and refined sugar, but I was left with a lot of pigmentation. Drunk Elephant's Baby Facial helped, but I wanted to find a product that could work on my skin each day. This serum noticeably lightens spots after two days, and they are basically gone in two weeks! I started off using it as a spot treatment to see if I would breakout out, and when I didn't, I switched to using it all over my face. I'm looking forward to using it this spring and summer as vitamin C is supposed to work in tandem with my sunscreen to protect my skin from the sun. It is not a cheap product, but it is one where I see the effects immediately. I highly recommend if you are looking for a good vitamin C serum and/or a way to even skin tone!

review_text: I don’t like this product as much as I want to. That confusion is real. Please don’t waste your time on this. I have tried BETTER vitamin c serums. Love DE products. This has to be my least favorite.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I wish I had longer to test this product before having to review it. Have been using it for close to a month in conjunction with many other DE products and thayers toner and have only seen slight differences in the overall appearance of my skin. Perhaps this is because of abnormal eating and drinking (sugar and alcohol) around the holidays, I’m just not sure. This serum is light orange and does have the smokey scent others have talked about. I love the airtight twist pump bottle to help keep the product protected and fresh as long as possible. It’s lightweight and travels well. I mix one pump of this with one pump of bhydra in the morning and it’s more than enough to cover my face (avoiding eyes which I use the eye serum on) and neck with some left for the back of my hands. Depending on how dry I feel I’ll use the teal peptide moisturizer or some of the marula oil. Then top everything off with their umbra tint or their regular face spf. Was so happy to learn this serum topped with spf actually increases the effectiveness of the spf! With the mixture of the b-hydra, I don’t find it as sticky as others seem too. Having all of these products layered on my face in the morning is new and I’m finding I don’t need as much foundation and have even left the house without foundation. So I guess my skin is improving, just nothing remarkable yet. I think I would recommend this for someone with a high budget. Even though I love this brand and their other products I may try another vitamin C serum before investing $80 in this one! We’ll see based on the results once it’s closer to empty.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I’m torn. I enjoy this product. I don’t find the scent offensive as other reviews have stated, not do I find the product sticky. Yes, initially it has a slightly sticky texture, but after a minute or so it completely disappears. With that being said, I initially noticed a brightening effect when I started using it but I’ve been using the product every morning for about three month and have not noticed any long-lasting effects. I do not plan to immediately repurchase to see if I notice a difference once I discontinue using it. Like I said, it’s not a bad product, per se, I just cannot justify the price tag at this moment.

review_text: I wanted to love this product because I love the TLC Framboos and Babyfacial products but this product just didn’t work for me. I had to throw it away and that’s a very pretty penny to have to toss! Maybe I just got a bad batch, but I will not be repurchasing this item.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Vitamin C serums are hits and misses with me. Some irritate my skin and others can break me out. This one brightens my skin while not irritating. I’ve had no breakouts from this and love the glow it gives me!

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: One of the worst things I have ever put on my face. First of all, the product is sticky when you pump it out and it feels that way on your skin. It made my skin break out horribly. I hadn’t had that much acne in years. It also made my cheeks extremely red. I couldn’t even wear makeup over it because the oil production from this would cause the makeup to melt off. Returned. Definitely not worth this price.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
I received this product as a free sample. While I am very attracted to the Drunk Elephant brand and their philosophy, I did not find this Vitamin C serum to be good for my skin. I used it as my day serum on dry clean skin and used sunscreen followed by light makeup.
The texture of this serum feels heavy and a little oily, however my skin absorbed it very well, my main issue related to the texture is that I felt like I became oilier and shinier than normal during the day while using this serum. 
Another thing I did not like was the smell of this serum, it smells slightly like bacon grease or something similar... It actually made me a little uncomfortable, I still applied it regularly since Vitamin C is a “must have” ingredient that many skincare experts swear by.
The packing is perfect as all the other DE products.., I did not notice a difference while using this product but I also feel like my skin just don’t appreciate Vitamin C.
I give this product a 3 stars vs a lower rating because I enjoy the fact that Drunk Elephant formulates their products free of parabens, essentials oils and fragrances. They are perfect for people with sensitive skin like myself. They are very safe for everyone! My skin just hates Vitamin C
ingredients: Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ascorbic Acid, Laureth23, Glycerin, Lactobacillus, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Phyllanthus Emblica Fruit Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Lactobacillus, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Hydrolyzed Quinoa, Phytosterols, Glutamylamidoethyl Imidazole, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Ferulic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tetrahydrobisdemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodiferuloylmethane, Glycine, Leuconostoc, Sucrose, Maltodextrin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Isohexadecane, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sorbitan Isostearate, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hydroxide, Chlorphenesin, Polysorbate 60, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Potassium Sorbate, Sorbic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
This is hands down the best vitamin c serum I have ever tried. It’s slightly tacky when I first apply it, but does fully absorb into my skin so the tacky feeling goes away on about 5 minutes. I also noticed significant results just a few days into using this product. My skin it more even toned and I feel the tightening but not in an uncomfortable way. I also love that this is a daytime serum. 

My ONLY complaint is that I wish they sold this product in a 15 ml size. It does oxidize in about 3-4 months even though the shelf life says 6 months. It still works when oxidized but not as well and the consistency gets thick and more tacky (and the tackyness doesn’t go away) I just bought my second bottle of this and will try storing it in the fridge to make it last a little longer. Either way, a 15 ml bottle would be nice so that I don’t feel like I’m throwing away like $20-$30 of product.
ingredients: Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ascorbic Acid, Laureth23, Glycerin, Lactobacillus, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Phyllanthus Emblica Fruit Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Lactobacillus, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Hydrolyzed Quinoa, Phytosterols, Glutamylamidoethyl Imidazole, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Ferulic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tetrahydrobisdemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodiferuloylmethane, Glycine, Leuconostoc, Sucrose, Maltodextrin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Isohexadecane, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sorbitan Isostearate, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hydroxide, Chlorphenesin, Polysorbate 60, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Potassium Sorbate, Sorbic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I wish I had longer to test this product before having to review it. Have been using it for close to a month in conjunction with many other DE products and thayers toner and have only seen slight differences in the overall appearance of my skin. Perhaps this is because of abnormal eating and drinking (sugar and alcohol) around the holidays, I’m just not sure. This serum is light orange and does have the smokey scent others have talked about. I love the airtight twist pump bottle to help keep the product protected and fresh as long as possible. It’s lightweight and travels well. I mix one pump of this with one pump of bhydra in the morning and it’s more than enough to cover my face (avoiding eyes which I use the eye serum on) and neck with some left for the back of my hands. Depending on how dry I feel I’ll use the teal peptide moisturizer or some of the marula oil. Then top everything off with their umbra tint or their regular face spf. Was so happy to learn this serum topped with spf actually increases the effectiveness of the spf! With the mixture of the b-hydra, I don’t find it as sticky as others seem too. Having all of these products layered on my face in the morning is new and I’m finding I don’t need as much foundation and have even left the house without foundation. So I guess my skin is improving, just nothing remarkable yet. I think I would recommend this for someone with a high budget. Even though I love this brand and their other products I may try another vitamin C serum before investing $80 in this one! We’ll see based on the results once it’s closer to empty.
ingredients: Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ascorbic Acid, Laureth23, Glycerin, Lactobacillus, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Phyllanthus Emblica Fruit Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Lactobacillus, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Hydrolyzed Quinoa, Phytosterols, Glutamylamidoethyl Imidazole, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Ferulic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tetrahydrobisdemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodiferuloylmethane, Glycine, Leuconostoc, Sucrose, Maltodextrin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Isohexadecane, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sorbitan Isostearate, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hydroxide, Chlorphenesin, Polysorbate 60, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Potassium Sorbate, Sorbic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I really love how this vitamin C makes my skin use. I use it as directed in the morning before moisturizing with the Protini moisturizer. It leaves my skin glowy and bright, and I’ve noticed my acne scars are lightening along with my freckles. My skin tone is becoming more even and I love it. I docked off a star for how sticky this serum is. The texture is ridiculously sticky and isn’t pleasant to apply. For me the stickiness goes away a few minutes after finishing up with my moisturizer.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I'm giving this 4 stars because I really do love Drunk Elephant's products....however this one is probably my least favorite. I usually use 1/2 to one pump for my whole face. It's very sticky and feels weird going onto my skin, however I must say my skin has been glowing nicely since using it. Not sure I can tolerate the smell; it even lingers on my hands after. I've used the Ole Henricksen vitamin c serum previously and may go back to that or try Sunday Riely CEO serum.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: This was my first vitamin C serum I have tried. I have to say that it makes my skin fell tighter and firmer. Some people have mentioned the less that pleasant smell. It does have a scent to it but let’s face it this isn’t supposed to be perfume.  I think it has that scent because the vitamin c and pumpkin extract. Overall I think this is pretty amazing product that I would buy in the future.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Although I haven't noticed anything dramatic with my hyperpigmentation, I do enjoy this product.  Maybe it needs more time (my hyperpigmentation is stubborn).  I like the pump - it keeps the good stuff from oxidizing and keeps the product pure (no fingers dipping into the product). It's fragrance is mild if at all.   I really like that Drunk Elephant is cruelty free!!  I would buy this product again.

review_text: I am totally in love with this product! I've had an issue with vitamin C products in the past because of texture, but this feels amazing! It leaves the slightest tacky feeling for a bit but still comfortable to wear under makeup. I really love that you can mix it with the B Firma because the consistency is a bit thick on it's own. Price wise this is about what I would expect for this amount of product and I love the packaging.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text:
I was so scared to try this product for some reason, but I am so glad I did—it’s the final piece to my skin care routine and I actually think it’s making the biggest difference out of everything I’m using (all DE). My skin is literally luminous, so dewy, and feels so soft after a week of use. At first it made my face feel itchy, but then I applied the Marula oil first, then this on top and it has worked beautifully. I will continue to repurchase this forever. It is so worth the money. 

Also, I’d like to give a big shout out to Sephora. I originally ordered this online, and by the time it got to me it had oxidized already (was a deep orange color). I went to the store and exchanged it for another bottle and the employees were so nice about it. They said that sometimes it’s best to buy this particular serum in store instead of online because of how sensitive vitamin C is to heat (and who knows where the package was sitting during the shipping process). They also let me test it before I left the store to make sure it was the right color. So if yours isn’t a very light golden color, just exchange it :) Vitamin C can be finicky, no matter how good the brand is.
ingredients: Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ascorbic Acid, Laureth23, Glycerin, Lactobacillus, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Phyllanthus Emblica Fruit Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Lactobacillus, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Hydrolyzed Quinoa, Phytosterols, Glutamylamidoethyl Imidazole, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Ferulic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tetrahydrobisdemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodemethoxydiferuloylmethane, Tetrahydrodiferuloylmethane, Glycine, Leuconostoc, Sucrose, Maltodextrin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Isohexadecane, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sorbitan Isostearate, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hydroxide, Chlorphenesin, Polysorbate 60, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Potassium Sorbate, Sorbic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: Being honest, I'm not sure why everyone says to use a daytime C serum. However, I've tried several different brands and this is my favorite -- it doesn't have that horrible smell I associate with most C serums. It also applies smoothly without being sticky or greasy, and plays well with my moisturizer. So while I'm not convinced anyone needs a C serum, if I had to use one I'd keep using this.

name: C-Firma™ Vitamin C Day Serum
review_text: I wanted to like this but just can’t... I love DE.. some of their items are incredible... like their Sukari Baby Facial and their lippe balm... but this is not great. It didn’t break me out, so I gave it two stars, but it just didn’t do anything at all. It’s pungent and leaves a strange feel to your skin. I have hyperpigmentation and I was hoping this might help. No such luck. I switched to a different brand with the same potency and it is doing wonders! I’m at a loss as to why this did so little... I expected more from a DE product.

review_text: This is the best vitamin C serum I have tried. The effects were immediate and I continue to see brighter skin everyday. I use this in the morning routine. Would definitely invest in this!

name: "Buffet"
review_text: This stuff works great! My skin's dry spots have cleared up. It is thick and a little goes a long way, but after I put my moisturizer  and makeup on its fine. Use AM & PM, doesn't pill under my makeup (powder or liquid foundation). Dry spots have cleared up FINALLY! Had them on my chin, cheeks and a small area on my forehead. Also use the Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA moisturizer with this. If you don't reapply, the dry spots will return but that's the point of a daily routine is to wash off then reapply. LOVE IT!

And best of all I've only been using this product for 3 days!!! I've been cautious about using this product on my chin because that area is really sensitive and I can get cystic acne if I used the wrong product there. So far it hasn't given me any breakouts. name: "Buffet"
review_text:
I have been using this product for a full 2 months now. I wanted to test this product out to see the pros and cons within the product before writing a review. I apply this product after using The Ordinary Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1% every AM and PM. 

Cons: it is a bit pricey compared to their other serums but you are paying for quality and this where it's at! it is a bit sticky when you first apply it

Pros: This product is a combination of peptides to help hydrate and fix/prevent any signs of aging hence the word "buffet", leaves my face feeling super healthy every time I use it, helped with my acne, did not break my out 

Overall, this product was amazing. I am currently on my second bottle. I am honestly so OBSESSED with this product! I have recommended this product to majority of the women in my life and they seem to enjoy it too! :)

name: "Buffet"
review_text:
This is my 3rd bottle of this serum; I've been using it for months, purchased directly from the brand's website.
This is an unfragranced, viscous and gloopy (it almost has a melted gel-like texture) serum. It applies slightly sticky but does not leave the face feeling sticky. I use it in the PM after toner and before my other serums as a part of an age prevention regiment. 
Since I started using this serum in March 2017, my skin has been noticeably smoother and brighter. Combined with the rest of my skincare routine changes, I've been able to confidently go foundation-free at the age of 29. 
Needless to say, I'm a fan and will continue to purchase this. One bottle lasts me about 4 months of once per day use (about 2 small globs per use). 

I have combo normal/oily skin and have not reacted negatively to this produt.

name: "Buffet"
review_text: I was very happy & existed to try this product hoping to make my fine lines disappear. I started to get blemishes on my forehead & other places where I never got them before. I was using more than 1 new product on my skin so it took me a long time to figure out which one because I first thought this one was not in cause. Well it is. This product makes me break out, many little red bumps or just bumps. I revised the ingredients list and I figured out it was the hydrogenated castor oil blocking my pores. I now know that this hydrogenated castor oil IS a comedogenic ingredient as much as coconut or hydrogenated coconut oil. Since Sephora has the best return policy I might be able to return it for a store credit since I am now scared to use this buffet. Wish the hydrogenated castor oil was not part of this product so I could enjoy it. I say you should be careful if ingredients with a rate of 2 or higher on the comedogenic list gives you clogged pores like me. Recommend only if you don’t have clogged pores issues.

review_text: I don’t know why these work so well but they are awesome. Works more quickly and without the smell of a drying lotion.
