name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: really skeptical, but finally decided to try after hearing from someone who used. after 3 nights i was kind of amazed. why was i so weary !?! i have always had bumps and acne on my cheeks but now its starting to clear up slowly
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: seriously this stuff works! pop a pimple, but a patch on and the next day its gone. im giving this a 4 star because it can cause a circle on your skin to lighten where you left the patch on.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I purchased these for my daughter because she had a terrible one on her nose that wouldn't come to the surface.   She left one of these on overnight and woke up to see that this dot pulled the gunk to the surface and the swelling had gone down considerably.  She had no problem with it falling off and it stuck well.  The dot blended in well with her skin and was barely noticeable.  It was much better than the days before where she was walking around the house with creams globbed on her nose.  Overall, these are great and so worth it.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I’ve only used a few of them, but I’m pretty impressed. My husband has cystic acne on his back, and this has been helping the healing time by half.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These are so helpful! There’s nothing worse than getting a pimple
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: This reduced the size of my pimple with lightning speed. I was very happy with the result. I will definitely buy again.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Ok so I’ve used pimple patches from like CVS and always thought like eh they help a little bit but nothing crazy.... until trying these patches!!!! So I get hormonal acne especially around my mouth. Make sure you put these on after you wash your face because you need clean dry skin. I put these on over HUGE pimples I had and a few hours later I could already see the patch covered in white from all the gunk (sorry ew but also satisfying) and in the morning I’m telling you they are completely flat now it’s insane like I can’t recommend these enough!!!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Ugh I really didn’t want to like these but I do, they are actually quite expensive for what they are bc if you’re like me and often have multiple breakouts on your face, you’ll go through the box fast. This really does help in sucking out the bacteria in your pimples and you’ll see it when the patch turns white. That being said, it only works if the pimple is already broke or the surface is popped. It won’t work that well on under the surface cyst type acne. It’s good for a pimple you popped that still isn’t completely drained/healed. I would say this works more like the final step to healing a pimple rather than when it’s just beginning to surface
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: One of the best spot treatments! These work so great. I just put them on one I feel a pimple coming and they work their magic.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These are way more effective that the acne dots that were popular in the 90s. I appreciate how they serve a dual purpose of protecting skin from irritation/the yuckies and also medicating the spot. I understand that the price per dot ain't cheap but it is worth it. If you are trying to not pop pimples, to draw out deep pimples, or to speed up the process of a standard pimple, then these would help. I also find it really satisfying to use these and see how it flattens out cystic acne. I should have taken before and after pictures. These are bomb.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I’ve used other Peace Out products with great results and I think these dots are just as good. Definitely thicker and higher quality than some cheaper brands. These appear to really work well and also keep me from touching acne. They are a little more than others, but really work and seem much higher quality. The effectiveness is very noticeable to me.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These work so well! When I put one of the dots on a blemish before I went to bed it was gone the next morning!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: It works! Used it on multiple size and types of pimples. The bigger, cystic looking ones needed more than one patch. It SHRUNK my pimples so well overnight. During the day I also use it on pimples that are close to bursting as I have to wear makeup for work. I followed up with the dark spot one after my skin scabbed over since I scar easily.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These really work! I've struggled with acne for most of my life, but the last few years I was able to get it under control. Unfortunately, my breakouts have started to come back in full force, but I was able to find these beauties. They really are the magic bullet. I put one on as soon as I get a breakout and they are either noticeably smaller or completely gone within a few hours. They are great in an emergency!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I am now a big fan of these Peace Out Acne Healing Dots!   I  wish that they came with more dots per package.  I love this colloidal material.  These work much better than other brands of acne healing dots that I have tried.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Works like a charm! Works better than all the other patches. Wear overnight.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I really love these! I’ve purchased this at least 3 times bc they work so well. I get really bad hormonal acne, the kind that will sit beneath my skin and hurt really bad. Since I’ve been buying this, these either make my early zits go away over night or zits that have already formed come to the surface and get all the gunk out. It will also flatten already existing zits and when you pull the patch off you can see all the gunk on the patch. I don’t ever want to be without these! I tried the Kate Somerville Eradikate acne treatment and it did absolutely nothing for me. Nothing! Highly recommend these patches!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I have no idea how these cute little stickers work, but whenever I cap a whitehead - in any stage of development - with one of these for the night, in the morning it’s gone. LOVE these!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: i haven't tried these dots on top of a "un popped" pimple yet because i was told they work best after you pop a pimple and they do! after you pop anything on your face you want to seal it anyways to avoid additional bacteria. this does just that while pulling any other gunk to the surface of the dot. and after you remove it, the pimple it completely flat, clean, and healed!!!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Love these! I use these for hormonal acne (which usually take weeks to go away) but within a few days they’re smaller and almost gone!

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I have been testing these dots out for over a week now and I can honestly say that I saw great results. They even worked on some neck and chest blemishes that popped up. Though they (mostly) did not completely disappear, all blemishes I placed these on reduced significantly in size and redness. I noticed that they seemed to work better and give that gratifying "white spot" when placed over a blemishes that have already come to a head. Otherwise, it's just the size and redness reduction (which is STILL a win in my book.) They are pricey, so I wouldn't use them on barely noticeable spots, but would definitely put them on any spots looking particularly red and angry.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I was very skeptical but these literally work. LOVE them
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: So I have tried at least 5 different brands of acne dots and this brand, by far, is my favorite. It just has the best combination for combatting zits without drying out or flaking. My only complaint is the price and only because there are decent, comparable products that are way less than these.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: This are like magic! I place it on at night over the spot and in the morning when I peel it away it’s left with just a pink spot!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text:
Omg!!!! It worked pretty well!! I also tried other products in the market but this is alot better than the other products. 
I had acnes and they are actually big giant one and only one night- they are healed like a miracle! 
So happy to purchase this product! Right before my graduation purchased it, to give this product a chance. Now boom! my face is super clean. Highly recommended!!!
Cant wait to try other products!!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These are my new obsession! I thought they were a gimmick but after doing thorough research on the benefits of hydrocolloid, i took the plunge and MAN i am not disappointed! These things help immensely with acne. Seriously, i need a monthly subscription
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Used it before my wedding! I definitely saw a difference- made my blemishes disappear. I used it three days in a row.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Get rid of white head and big acne, all you need is put on and go sleep , magic will happen second day morning . Really love this product and will keeping purchasing it
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I leave it on a white head overnight and by the next morning it’s already oozed out. Usually I pop the white heads and it leaves a mark. Amazing product. Does what it says.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I got this for my teenage girls and they love it. When they see a zit they applie it over night and in the morning bb zit just amazing.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: My 14-year-old daughter swears by these. She applies at night, and when she wakes up the following morning, the pimple is gone. I haven’t tried these on my adult hormonal or cystic acne, so can only attest to the benefit for teenagers.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Finally something that truly works. At the same time it reduces the size of the pimple it doesn't make your skin peel.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I like to use these acne dot stickers mainly on those deeper acne bumps to speed up healing process. I noticed it leaves slight redness around the bump where the sticker was once peeled off but it goes away within an hour or two.  The bump also gets a little bit more visible as if it got freshly dried out but it definitely reduces the size of acne area. It will speed up the overall healing process without a doubt.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Nothing works like these little miracles! I have combination skin, that is (thankfully) pretty clear. However, I do break out occasionally due to stress, hormones and lack of sleep. After I wash and tone my face, before my serum, I place one of these little dots on and wear it all night. When I wake up, the spot is noticeably smaller and less irritated. After two patches, the pimple is gone and the surrounding skin is healing and happy. Other patches do not compare. The combination of the patch itself and the ingredients make all the difference.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: these work really well, it's cool to see the white dots on the dot after you've worn it overnight. they're not a miracle, but better than nothing that's for sure. helps keep me from accidentally touching and scratching pimples and making them worse and scar
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: When I was getting the perk facial in store they used one of these acne dots on a breakout I was having and it was seriously like the before and after pictures they use for marketing. It went from being a pretty large zit to completely flat, I was amazed and I’m definitely going to pick them up.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: It's great if you have a break out and want it to diminish. It doesn't completely erase the pimple, but it does significantly go down. It also serves as a protection. I get hyperpigmentation after a pimple, but it doesn't treat that.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: My go to spot treatment! Works so well overnight, i put one on a pimple thats flaring up and the next morning its significantly reduced!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text:
I’m inpatient, so I prefer to use benzoyl peroxide and BHA for treating a red and closed breakout. I only use this patch when the breakout ruptures (or when I pop it). I make sure all the gunk is out, clean the area with some antiseptic and then put this patch on. It prevents the open wound from developing a dark and hard crust, which takes more than a week to come off. It also calms down any residual Inflammation overnight. When I take it off in the morning, the redness and swelling are usually gone or very minimal, and I can cover up the area with concealer smoothly, without the texture making it more prominent. 
Overall, it makes the healing process much faster. Combined with regular exfoliation and azaleic acid, the post-acne marks remain red for a few days before disappearing completely! It’s quite expensive, but it has been the best acne patch I’ve used!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I absolutely love these things! I have tried so many acne spot treatments that say that will get rid of a coming zit/pimple within a couple hours or over night - much like this product stated, so I was skeptical at first. But now that I have tried it, I will never use anything else. When I notice a spot of acne coming up or bothering me, I just put on of these bad boys on it and within hours the bump and redness are basically gone. And also, when you peel the dot off, you can see where it was "fighting" the acne as there will be a kinda white-ish puffy spot on the dot.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I get hormonal acne on my back and for some reason I can’t seem to keep from picking at them...so these are life savers! Usually the rubbing of my bra strap or the texture of what I’m wearing will remind me that it’s there due to constant irritation, but not when I stick one of these babies on it. Put em on and forget it’s even there. Even my boyfriend gives in to wearing em and he jokes that it’s not fair that they’re not invisible on him lol
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I’ve tried a few brands of pimple patches and continue to come back to these. I think they do a great job of shrinking the pimple without completely drying out the area and leaving the area flakey.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

review_text:
i love these so much. it is a little pricey, so i feel best purchasing the 40 pack option online. these are so easy to use! just put a dot on top of your pimple right before bed (best results if the pimple is red and angry). in the morning when you wake up, there will be a white bump on the dot where they soaked up all the gunk from the pimple. it might take 1-3 days of dot usage before the pimple is completely gone, but after the first night, it’s less angry, much flatter, and easier to cover up.

tip: with smaller pimples, just cut the dot in half! this saves the “product” and your money!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: The only thing that helps my deep stubborn cystic acne. Also, they draw up any puss/fluids that might be lurking beneath the surplus. They make zits go away a million times faster!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I didn’t buy these for the longest time because it seemed like a gimmick and over-hyped. But after a series of pesky blemishes I picked up a box on a whim at Sephora—and all I can say is wow. 4-6hours after putting on most blemishes are just ~gone~. I will say they don’t seem to work as well on the really deep, cystic spots (at least for me), but I don’t tend to suffer from those so much. Will always be keeping these on hand now from here on out.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These Peace Out Acne Healing dots work like magic! I put one on a blemish before bed and when I woke up in the morning it was almost 100% gone. I was really happy that the dot stayed in place, since I move around a lot in my sleep.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Hydrocolloid patches have been the holy grail of my skincare regimen since I discovered them about 2 years ago.  Now whenever I get a zit I just throw one of these bad boys on and about 4-6 hours later it will magically have sucked gunk out of the zit.  It usually takes 2-3 to completely heal a zit and remove all the pus, but that's a lot better than waiting much longer for it to heal on it's own, or me picking it.  Along with the Peace Out Acne Serum my skin has never looked better!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Wow! I was so skeptical about this product. I have a lot of acne that are whiteheads and big cystic acne. This product makes the pimple disappear!  I leave it on overnight and the next morning it's gone and or smaller in size. The whiteheads always disappear and the cystic shrinks down smaller than half it's size! You really should give this product a chance. I was so blown away! I can't imagine living without this. They really need to come out with a face mask with this exact formal for people with more acne. Just take the plunge and purchase... You will not regret it!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I just started using these and they are amazing. When I get a breakout that’s ready to be popped, after popping and cleaning I put one of these on overnight and the next morning it’s gone! I’m obsessed and repurchased.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: i like these alot. after wearing them my blemish is smaller and less red. i've bought these several times over, i just wish they werent so expensive !
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: these are the best things ever. I've been cutting up hydrocolloid bandages from the drugstore for a while now to cover zits at night and suck out oil but these are even better because salicylic acid in the patch.  they are costly so I even tried using salicylic acid *UNDER* a regular patch but not the same effect.  these things SHRINK the zit over night it is flat as can be. this is a miracle for my cystic bumps. don't skimp buy it because it works.  PS the emergency pack is a better value if you can snatch it up before it sells out.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These are the best healing dots are the market. I have tried several different brands and always get the best results with Peace Out. Adult acne is terrible - these make blemishes disappear within a day or two. I try to make sure I never run out.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: So, these work very well, but they are not worth the price ($1/pacth) simply because they are not unique, you can buy  almost the same product (a good quality one) from another brand for a fraction of the price. I tried these and the cheaper ones and they had exactly the same result, even though the other wasn't medicated. I just used some topical salicylic acid before placing the dot and voila. Still, if you don't mind over paying, I recommend it.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Super sad that the dots did not work for me. I have very tough skin and not all products work for me.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I used a few of these on some blemishes and didn’t see much change, but kept using them anyway since I had them lying around, but I’ll be throwing them out after today. I had a small blemish on my cheek — not normally a sensitive area — and it left a huge painful red circle where the sticker was. Photo is from about 16 hours after I took the dot off.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Very expensive for acne-prone people who have occasional acne. This made my pimples much more larger afterwards. My favorite will always be the pink drying lotion. This was a complete waste of money.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I had 3 really ugly pimples at one time... it was a rough week.  I put a dot on each overnight for 3 days.  Didn't see any change to them at all.  Then, the next week, I put a dot on a medium pimple and it was smaller the next morning.  Did nothing to my recent lower eyebrow pimple either.  Maybe it's just me?  Salicylic Acid comes in other, more consistent forms IMHO.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: i wore a sticker overnight on a cystic pimple. it is now 2:30 PM and i STILL have a bright red circle, the size of the dot, on my skin over my pimple. my CC cream isn't even covering it up. i'm done with these.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I honestly couldn’t tell the difference and I have a lot of pimples that I’m treating so it was SO EXPENSIVE in the end for me

review_text: I tried this product several time and it hasn’t helped with my breakout for even one time

review_text: these are good and they work but there are cheaper ones out there that work just as good if not better. Also ones that have more than this pack. I would recommend checking kbeauty ones first.

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Doesn’t reduce inflammation or anything and is honestly a waste of money. I’ve tried them multiple times on different types/sizes of pimples to see if they MIGHT work but no luck thus far. I’ve left them on well over 6 hours which is the recommended time...
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text:
The patches WORK. I still have redness after using but I’m fine with that. My pimples get super swollen and tender, and these flatten them and also help me not pick at them.
That being said, the 20-patch one is NOT worth it for someone who has pimples that need to be treated 3+ nights a week. The patches come in a box, and they come in two separate resealable bags. Why? It’s such a waste! One sheet per bag? I’m trying to be more environmentally cautious, and I DEFINITELY would not have bought these had I known how wasteful the packaging was.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text:
This stuff really pulls out the acne. I like the quantity you get for the price. I'm on my last sheet so I've been using it sparingly only on major breakouts that need extra help to pull out. 

I highly recommend. They are so convenient for travelling.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Why are these so expensive? I use them and when a pimple has a head they do work but if you don't just suffer with the occasional zit, then using these can add up. It's like a dollar a dot. It is satisfying to see how much sebum it soaks up.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text:
I don’t have a problem with any acne at the moment. I just get a blemish here and there so I thought a spot treatment like this would be great on such occasions.
Each dot averages to almost a dollar when you compare the quantity to the price. For that price I would of expected them to do something. Anything! They didn’t. I used a total of four (over four consecutive nights) on one blemish and I didn’t see a difference. The redness didn’t subside, size didn’t change, sensitivity (to touch) was still there, and on and on. Even if there were a nickel a piece, I would not waste my money on these!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I got these free from influenster to try out. All opinions are my own. At first I thought these would be a gimmick, the more I started using them, the more they started shrinking out my acne. They are comfortable and easy to wear. They are easy use and they really speed up the ance healing process.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: This product was not my saving grace. The dots had a hard time staying in place and I didn’t see the results I was hoping for. However, in the morning when you pull the dots off you can see the sebum it pulls out of your skin. For some reason, my blemishes remained the same.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I got these for free to test out and they did not do a single thing. They’re simple and easy to use, but don’t waste your money. I didn’t even have huge zits I was trying to get rid of, just the typical small zit here and there and I’d leave them on all night and in the morning the same zit would be there with no improvement. They are way too expensive to not actually work.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Honestly amazing! Be aware there are cheaper colloidal type stickers on Amazon, however these contain salicylic acid  and vitamin A (retinol) which helps kill P. Acnes and unclog the poor so overall for the price if you are in a pimple emergency this will really really really help but not completely solve the mark in one use.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Love these! I had a bad breakout on my t-zone after using a mask that was not a match for my skin. After using these dots two nights in a row on large cysts, the most irritated ones are 80% smaller and the smaller ones were completely gone after the first night. They don’t irritate your skin at all like many salicylic and vitamin A products do. These are great, the results I saw were similar to using prescription Epiduo. the only reason I’m giving 4 stars is because they are pricey. If you have acneic skin and lots of pimples, using these regularly would be more expensive than using an acne serum or mask.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These are okay, they don’t really do much except draw out impurities. I don’t see much of a real transformation, just a little less puffy and sometimes makes a zit form a head. They are cheap for how many you get so it’s kinda worth it, but Target has the own brand that you get 36 for $8 and those work well too
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text:
This product really intrigued me so I had to try it out. The dots stick on and don't come off which is awesome and they do not smell like chemicals. I put one on overnight, with a whitehead pimple, and it definitely shrunk in size. It didn't completely go away but this product really helped if you're looking for a quick way to reduce inflammation. I will be continuing to use these!!
 I was sent this product in exchange for an honest review.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Finally, an acne spot treatment that isn’t a clay and alcohol mess that dries out your screen. I get the occasional hormonal spot on my face and this helps to really reduce the redness and inflammation of those painful ones that stay for weeks. The other ones that are open or getting there, this speeds up the whole process and really helps them heal, I do sometimes see reduction in size overnight and definitely reduction in redness and swelling. Love these but wish they cost less!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Ugh I love these things so much and always try to keep some on reserve. Tried other brands and they weren't as effective or fast. I've noticed they tend to work better on an open blemish.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: THESE ARE LIFESAVERS. I suffer from hormonal breakouts, and this is truly the only product I've tried (and I've tried a lot) that reduce size, inflammation, and redness basically overnight. There have been times where it heals a pimple COMPLETELY over night and other times when I have a more stubborn blemish it may not heal completely overnight but it still makes such a difference. I always make sure I have two packs of these in my cabinet at all times, and always bring a pack with me when I travel.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I would have thought these were magical zit-be-gone dots, but reading reviews on here really helped me understand how to use them.  I had three small, angry zits on my forehead, and one of them had a white head.  Two had been popped at some point (Allegedly the patches are designed to heal broken skin).  So, I was cheap and took HALF a dot and cut it into three pieces.  They were the perfect size for my zits.  And the thick material somehow formed a second skin and didn’t come off all night!  I toss and turn when I sleep, too.  When I took them off, all three blemishes were flat, my skin / redness calmed down, and one patch even looked like it sucked the gunk out of one (gross, I’m sorry).  They were probably 50% healed, which was good enough for me.  Like a time machine for healing skin.  I intended these dots for the rare, painful, scarring pimple, but to know I can cut them into tiny pieces and they’re still effective is pretty awesome!  And they’re cruelty-free... thumbs up.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Awesome. These actually shrunk my pimples over night. Very cool. They’re not gone but def smaller.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text:
"I'll have what she's having", Sephora.
All jokes aside, this product can do no wrong! I LOVE it.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: I received these as a complimentary sample to try out however fortunately my skin is clear so I decided to use on my boyfriend. He deals with basic acne and has mild scarring so I figured it would be great to try on the scars he already had and to prevent acne he felt coming up. They are super easy to use and in the matter of 3 weeks weeks the difference is pleasantly noticeable! I totally recommend these however don’t expect overnight results and I found they work best when you use on acne at first sign or it forming.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text:
I love love LOVE these dots. No they aren’t not a miracle cure, but they are effective. I just pop these on after cleansing, and I wake up with a visibly smaller pimple. Usually it’s less swollen and you can see all the gunk it’s sucked out of your pimple while you sleep. I move around a lot at night as well and these suckers don’t rub off!

They do slide off if I do a full face routine and then put these on after moisturizing. So I suggest either putting on right after cleansing and then do the rest of your routine around it OR do your routine and then slightly rub off the top of the pimple before placing so that it’ll stick.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: It really help reduce redness and acne.
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: Works really well on blemishes that are on the surface or close to it. Did not work for cystic. Helps reduce picking behaviors which will lead to less scaring and damage. Overall win.

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These do work, but not as well as the Mighty Patch brand ones do. These are also really expensive in comparison to others, so I was disappointed.

review_text: I received these complimentary through Influenster and I have to say I’m pleasantly surprised! To be honest I expected these to be kind of a gimmick but they actually really work. The best way to use them is to cleanse and dry skin before bed and apply these - by the morning your spots are much smaller, flatter to the skin and a lot of times you can see the toxins being pulled out when you take off the dot the next day. Will definitely be repurchasing these!
ingredients: Hydrocolloid Polymer Technology, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate

name: Acne Healing Dots

Again, overall really good!

review_text: As someone who breaks out way to easily, I love using these when a bump starts to really act up. Can see a significantly positive difference in just one overnight use.

review_text: These are amazing. They makes your pimple disappear in one use. When you take the little dot off the pimple is completely drained. They are life changing.

name: Acne Healing Dots
review_text: These are so easy to apply and they really work! They stick to your face super easily and don’t come off even if you roll around in your sleep like I do. I don’t know if I’ve ever seen results this quickly from a product. I had a huge pimple that was under my skin and 2 nights in a row I applied one of these stickers to it and now it’s gone! I am so thankful that I received these complimentary but I will absolutely be buying them when I run out.

review_text: There work super well! I struggle with occasional cystic breakouts and these truly do clear up zits after either the first or second use. The only downside to these is the price. name: Alpha Beta® Universal Daily Peel
review_text: I hate how much I love this product. It works, but it is a big hit to my wallet. It does do a lot of things, so you can get rid of other products and you don't have to use them every day to see results. This product helps with my cystic acne, my regular acne, my fine lines, my acne scars and hyper pigmentation. So it does everything really. It's an expensive thing to just pick up and try, but it works. The only downside is that it takes a long time to apply. If you don't have the time for that you can cut the sheets in half and use the other half the next day. What I do is rub it all over my face until it gets dry and then I put it on my neck, chest and the top of my hands. This means it takes about 10 minutes to apply because there is a lot of product on those little sheets. I even scrape out the remaining drops left over in the bag.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

review_text: I love this, and it definitely give me glowy, clearer skin, that even my husband noticed a difference! I have combo skin, and in my late 30s, it does sting a bit and skin turns a bit red like other reviewers mentioned, however all goes away shortly. It preps the skin for other products, as I can feel my skin just drinks up the serum and moisturizer right away afterwards. The only down side is the price tag, so I started to cut the pads in half, and there's no noticeable difference for me. 2 boxes of these later, although I didn't notice much reduction with my dark spots, but my skin's overall condition is at its best! I will definitely repurchase!

If I could see it fade these things I would say it's worth the $$. But I can't right now. 

SKIN BACKGROUND: Asian and acne prone. Hormonal acne. Have had acne since the 5th grade (am now 30 and struggling). Been on acutane, retin-a, tretinoin, antibiotics, aczone. Allergic to spironolactone. On birth control.

I now buy the 30-day pack and have never looked back. I am 31 and these work wonders for dull skin, pores and blackheads.

name: Alpha Beta® Universal Daily Peel
review_text:
First let me say this...

One of my girlfriends pointed these out one day while in Sephora saying she wanted to try these out. 
About a year later, I received one as a sample. 
MONTHS later I wanted to give these babies a try and couldn’t with how expensive they are. 
So I tested it out with the 5-pack and have been buying the 5-pack for months now. I am hooked. They’re so easy to use. Perfect for right before makeup, or for right before bed. I prefer them for right before bedtime as you have this glowing effect with minimized pores and acne in the morning. Yep I said it. 

These are amazing Peel Pads. Yes it does tingle and slightly sting but that goes right away. Then I follow up with my skincare. 

***NOTE: This is not to be washed off.***

I’m trying to use them enough to start using the extra strength but trust me, you’ll see a difference in your skin. I like to use these 3 days in a row or every other day. 

I love the little box that they come in now as opposed to the packet that they used to come in.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Alpha Beta® Universal Daily Peel
review_text: I was using them for about three months when I stopped. I started off with these and then purchased the extra strength ones in a set. At first my skin started to breakout, which I expected. My skin freaks out when I try something new and then settles down. I really felt like it was clearing all of the gunk out of my pores. However, the breakouts didn’t stop. I purchased these mainly for fine lines on my forehead and a couple age spots on my face. Not only did my main concerns not improve over the months of use... my skin actually looked worse from breakouts.  I was really wanting these to work. I for some random reason took pics when I started lol because I felt like I was going to see drastic results. Nothing... lines and age spots look exactly the same. A little disappointed. I still have a box left, but I’m not going to continue to use them.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I have been using this product for 4 years now. This product is holy grail status. I have issues with hyperpigmentation, acne, and redness. I went a week without using this and noticed an immediate difference in the overall appearance of my skin. This dramatically improves all skin issues without causing irritation. Flaky dry skin? Acne? Stubborn blackheads and whiteheads? Ice pick scars? Large pores? Ingrown facial hairs? This serum is the cure!! Although many companies pair AHA/BHA together, they lack the additional skin benefits that this one provides. Yes this is a high concentration of AHA but they have included several soothing and calming ingredients to counteract any adverse reactions. This is a great 2 in 1 product. Typically BHA’s are better for oily skin or for people who have acne, as BHA h is oil soluble...it can dive deeper into your pores than AHA and really clean them from the inside out. AHA is typically better for people who have dry skin. This product contains BOTH and is great for ALL SKIN TYPES! Don’t be fooled by other AHA/BHA hybrids that come in jar packaging or any see through container. Drunk Elephant has mastered the science behind their serums and packaging. No irritation, added antioxidents, an effective PH with a sealed opaque container that protects each ingredient from light exposure and air (which could otherwise render these ingredients useless!)This serum paired with their vitamin c is heavenly and dramatically changed my skin. It is pricey but 100% worth the money.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Salicylic Acid, Lactic Acid, Citric Acid, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Opuntia FicusIndica Extract, Aesculus Hippocastanum Seed Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Rubus Idaeus Fruit Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae Extract, Buddleja Davidii Meristem Cell Culture, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Allantoin, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Galactoarabinan, Propanediol, Disodium EDTA, Xanthan Gum, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Nitrate, Potassium Sorbate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text:
This is a very nice serum in a very nice package. It is gentle active, and it mixes well (per instructions) with the Lala Retro cream. It doesn’t seem to cause purging, but I also regularly use BHA and AHA products. It’s high priced, but as with all, a little dab will do you, and it doesn’t sting (Which the Ordinary glycolic can). I think I actually prefer the thicker serum texture to the more liquid products I’ve used - I don’t lose any in the application. 

If you already know that your skin likes acids and you want a more luxurious/clean/differently textured option, this is an excellent choice, although the high price point makes it a tough sell for a first time.

review_text: So worth the price tag! If I had to choose one drunk elephant product, this would be it for me. I’ve been breaking out like crazy from wearing a mask and decided I needed to give this skin product line a try. Sooo worth it. I’ve noticed a significant difference. I stopped breaking out, the pores on my nose are seemingly getting smaller, and I’ve noticed less texture on my face. I use this every night but I would skip it if I’m using the drunk elephant’s retinol. I can’t afford everything from drunk elephant so I use it with my current skin care products. I use it in this order: cleanser, toner, tlc, mix my moisturizer with drunk elephant’s marula oil and call it a night. Next morning I wake up to glowing and supple skin.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: Yet another gem from this line! This product has begun to make a tremendous difference with acne scarring. Some glycolic products are too harsh or not strong enough. This one is the perfect in between. If you haven't used glygolic prior to using this product, follow the instructions and build up a tolerance to it. You will not regret it. You will flake and skin will slough, but that is the product doing its magic and work. I did use both with the recommended Drunk Elephant Marula Oil and with Caudalie Overnight Recovery Oil; which both worked amazingly and I definitely recommend with use. It helps make the flaking/sloughing of skin not to obvious. You don't need to use this just for helping with scarring, it is great for helping to prevent wrinkles and making your skin a bit tighter. The price, again, is worth it, and considerably cheaper than any other name brand glycolic product. Don't believe me, do the research yourself. Go get a sample today to try

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: So worth the money! I used DE before in the past (a few products) and I thought my skin looked great, so I stopped using it because I thought I could maintain the good skin with other brands that were cheaper. This was a year ago. I started using TLC Framboos a few nights ago, and after the first night, my skin looked better immediately the next morning. My skin looked smoother and brighter after one use. I now use this in conjunction with DE Hydra-B and Firma-C (I like to use it AM & PM) and I combine that mixture with my Sunday Riley A+ retinol, and my skin looks like glass now. I haven't had any breakouts, and in fact, my pimples look much smaller and more healed the next morning.I do wake up with a slightly greasy face, but my skin is oily/breakout prone, so I attribute the grease to that. Also, I use the 1 oz bottle and just use 1-2 pumps and my bottles last months. Honestly, the price is steep, I will admit, but I feel it is worth the cost if it means I have great skin.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I use this product in conjunction with the protini and c-firma so I’m sure it’s the combination of them all working so well but this one in particular is really nice. I use it every other night  and always wake up to very bright and smooth skin.  I have extremely sensitive and acne prone skin. I wasn’t sure how I would handle acids but nothing a dermatologist could give me would work so I went for it and it’s one of the only product that does not break me out. My skin has not been this smooth and clear sense while on Accutane. It’s very light weight and a little goes a long way. One pump covers my face and what’s left I put on my chest. I rarely use a moisturizer with it so I don’t believe it’s drying. There’s also no smell or sticky residue. It does sting slightly upon application only on any blemishes or broken skin and it goes away very quickly. I would give this product five stars but the price point being at $90 is really steep. I do continue to buy it because it works, but it is difficult to budget in as it typically only last me 2 to 3 months.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text:
This is a great glycolic acid serum, that definitely improves skin texture, pimples and small surface wrinkles. I just loved using this product and seeing the results overnight; my skin just looks healthy. I have used both AHA and BHA before, this serum has quite some strong concentration/power; I would advise starting slow. I'm used with chemical exfoliation so I used this every night. The oils and antioxidants help with moisture as well, making this product more gentle. It absorbs quick into the skin, it's lightweight and layers well with my night routine (which includes tones, another serum and moisturizer).
Can you get same results with cheaper products? Yes. But I had a sample for this serum and I just love it.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I heard great things about this serum so I decided to give it a try. Unfortunately I have very acne prone combination skin. I understand the difference between a purge and a breakout but this gave me breakouts over and over, mostly in the form of whiteheads. Once u stopped using it the breakouts stopped. Upon digging further into the ingredient list I noticed that it does contain Marula Oil (listed as Birrea Oil) on the ingredient list, which is a great antioxidant BUT it will clog pores and cause acne. So while this worked great for many people it’s definitely a NO for me and anyone with acne prone skin. Oil free glycolic serum is the only way to go.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text:
I tried this based on a friend’s recommendation and am so happy I did. This serum goes on as a gel and takes about 15 minutes to fully absorb into the skin. It can be a little tacky as it dries, but the stickiness goes away once it is fully absorbed. It is super effective thanks to a highly concentrated blend of AHAs, with some salicylic acid in there for good measure. It literally tackles every skincare issue you can think of – aging, hyperpigmentation, dullness, pore size, acne, etc. I love that it is available in travel size too. 

This serum has given me brighter, smoother and more even skin. In fact, it has reduced redness and blotchiness faster and more effectively than any other AHA serum I have tried. What more can I say? This product is freaking phenomenal.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text:
(Originally purchased as part of DE's NightBright™ Resurfacing Duo with DE's Marula Oil & Received a Free Sample)

This was a great first step into the world of chemical exfoliators! After about a month of usage, I noticed the texture of my skin was completely smooth. My skin has been subject to acne and scarring for years, and it felt amazing to feel what a soft, even skin texture feels like. I also noticed that a small smile line I was forming disappeared. A little bit of product went a long way. These two mini bottles lasted about 5 months (about 13mL/.44oz of product total).

Though I enjoyed this product, I have gotten similar results with other chemical exfoliators that cost less and do not think it provides anything different. For me, I would not pay for the full size; however, if you have your heart set on this product, it will definitely deliver!

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text:
Let me start off this review by saying DON’T LET THE HIGH PRICES FOOL YOU!!!! I had Drunk Elephant on my radar for over a couple years before biting the bullet and trying some of the products. I used to get a facial once a month but due to the pandemic I needed to really think about how I did this at home instead of relying on someone else. I had great skin in my teens, then my twenties hit, and my skin went downhill (mostly due to being on birth control & the different hormones). I have sensitive skin but also tan very well but I MUST keep my face out of the sun (due to tanning bed in my late teens early twenties & some bad sun burns on my face due to not wearing sunscreen). I have dark spots, freckles (a lot of them) & BAD melasma on my forehead. 

*The T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Night Serum is a staple in my night time routine now. I have noticed a big difference in the wrinkles on my forehead and around my eyes using this serum. I try using this every other night as this can make your face dry. & a bottle goes A LONG WAY.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This is an average product for me. I have tried and used many different chemical exfoliant products with the same percentage of aha bha as this one. It has a gel texture and dries down and doesn’t pill. It takes at least a few weeks to a couple months to really see results according to science so I wouldn’t listen to people saying their entire skin changed within a few days. I don’t have sensitive skin and was able to use this every night with no irritation, but my skin is used to chemical exfoliants since I’ve tried so many before. It does help with my texture, but do I think it’s worth 100+? No. There are other products out there at a cheaper price that give the same results. Plus this packaging is unrecyclable so the entire hunk of plastic goes straight to the landfill.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I got a small sample of this that has lasted about 4 uses. I've been using this every night and am definitely seeing results, even in such a short timeframe. My pores looked less noticeable within the first day, and I have seen continued improvements since then. It has not caused me any irritation, even when used in combination with retinol products. However, I think there are cheaper products out there that provide similar results.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Salicylic Acid, Lactic Acid, Citric Acid, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Opuntia FicusIndica Extract, Aesculus Hippocastanum Seed Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Rubus Idaeus Fruit Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae Extract, Buddleja Davidii Meristem Cell Culture, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Allantoin, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Galactoarabinan, Propanediol, Disodium EDTA, Xanthan Gum, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Nitrate, Potassium Sorbate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I’ll start by saying I’ve been using chemical exfoliant and adapalene for years, so my skin is pretty tough and can handle treatments like this. TLC Framboos, however, wreaked havoc on my skin! During the time I was using this, I was breaking out all over my forehead. I might get a pimple here and there occasionally, but using this I was breaking out the entire time. Not only that, but I had tiny blisters on my cheeks!! After I stopped using my face cleared back up and went back to normal. As to not waste it since it’s so expensive, I started mixing it in with another chemical exfoliant mask and rinsing it off after ~20 minutes, so that’s where the two stars came from since my skin can tolerate that. I definitely will not be repurchasing. Aside from that, the packaging is also very misleading with how much is inside it—one ounce is much smaller than this bottle appears to be.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Salicylic Acid, Lactic Acid, Citric Acid, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Opuntia FicusIndica Extract, Aesculus Hippocastanum Seed Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Rubus Idaeus Fruit Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae Extract, Buddleja Davidii Meristem Cell Culture, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Allantoin, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Galactoarabinan, Propanediol, Disodium EDTA, Xanthan Gum, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Nitrate, Potassium Sorbate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text:
I don’t give five stars often, but I definitely felt that this product deserved it and here’s why:

I’ve tried to many acne three steps over the years but always struggled with little blackheads and acne. Nothing ever seemed to work. Finally I decided to do research on skincare to hopefully find something that would make a difference. This product did it. It’s the first product I’ve used that I noticed a visible difference the NEXT DAY. This stuff really smooths my skin texture, and it calms my breakouts. Of course you won’t wake up with a new face, but it really is worth the buy. 

I suggest mixing with 1 pump of Drunk Elephants B-Hydra stuff (blue bottle) if you have more sensitive skin. It doesn’t burn, but it will tingle a bit at first (for non-sensitive skin people). So far, mixing it with the B-Hydra makes it not tingle at all.

review_text: Mix with hyaluronic acid! I have really congested skin, acne & hyperpigmentation - I like this product but I can’t justify a frequent $90 purchase as part of my skincare routine. Trying to get the same results but cheaper using Tarte’s tingling toner plus Differin.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text:
Always in the nightly rotation! I like to switch up my products in the evenings, one night face mask, one night extra exfoliant, one night retinol, one night extra moisture, etc.  This product from Drunk Elephant will always be in my skincare routine! 

After 3 plus years of trying a variety of both clean/natural and science based cosmeceutical products, I will continue to repurchase. Love they have the larger size now (if they could do that with C-firma - tho I understand why they don't - that would be amazing!), highly recommend!

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: Great night serum!  I've been using this serum a little over a month now, and I can start tell a difference on my forehead lines...they are appearing less noticeable to me.  My skin is starting to look a little more even in tone.  I do mix this with the DE marula oil.  My skin does tingle a little after using it, but the tingling does go away.  But I wouldn't use it right before going to bed because the tingling is noticeable enough to keep you awake...it will stop tingling after a few minutes though!  Two pumps is plenty.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I tried this product in the Night Bright trial set. I could not justify spending $90 on a face serum, but I had heard such incredible things about this product that I had to at least try it. Let me tell you- my skin improved drastically after using this for 3 months. I had a lot of acne scarring and clogged pores, and after using for about a month, I noticed a drastic improvement with my skin. My acne scars were fading, and I was breaking out less frequently. The trial size lasted me for three months, and when I ran out, I bought the full size. It will last me forever- you only need one pump for your entire face! I am so glad I gave this a chance. Yes, it is ridiculously expensive, but it is so worth it if you have problematic skin.

review_text: A holy grail product. I would have given it a 5 star if it was more affordable and made my skin 100% smooth. I have been using this night serum for over a year. Overall a great and effective product!

I don't think I used this one long enough to really give it a good test (I ended up returning it), so this one might actually be a product that works/is worth your money, but the only thing I can really say about it is that it's not a miracle product or anything - I didn't notice any differences in the 2 weeks I used it (not that you're necessarily supposed to) - and I, again, just felt like it was overpriced for what it was.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I use this but I also use Tretinoin (Cant recommend it enough life changing) The top layer of my skin sheds pretty much constantly I am not sure if this product has a lot to do with it because it is a side effect of Tretinoin too. but when I use this I can get a better result after cleansing. Placing makeup on top of peeling skin is difficult and this helps to loosen those cells for a seemly foundation application. An AHA BHA did make a difference in my skin texture prior to starting tretinoin just not as dramatic with it. I have not tried DE retinol but it does seem to have a high parentage of Vit-A which is the active ingredient in Retinoids so you may want to try that if you cant get a prescription.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text:
I’ve been dabbling with different types of products like retinol, resurfacing peel masks, and AHAs and I really like that this product gives such immediate results unlike my tretinoin which makes my skin really red and dry even at a low concentration (I didn’t use both of these at the same time obviously). I woke up the next day after using it with really smooth skin and a slight glow, and a couple days later when I used it again. 
I wish they would note on their instructions to slowly incorporate this product into your skincare routine so you don’t risk disrupting your natural skin moisture barrier but used right, this is a nice product. Plus I really enjoy that DE has unscented products, as I’ve been more interest in unscented products!

review_text: I enjoy this serum. It definitely smooths the skin and makes it feel plump and soft. I need a heavy moisturizer after, and it does leave my skin sticky after using. Typically I will wait 5 or so minutes to apply my moisturizer.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This is one of my first DE skincare products and I still use it and love it to this day.  This is a powerful serum, used primarily for nighttime/before bed, that helps renew skin and prevent any skin blemishes/breakouts.  It can also be used as a spot treatment for pimples.  Since it's a powerful serum, I typically only use one pump, mixed with a DE moisturizer.  (Fun Fact:  You can mix all DE products together since their ingredients are clean and have no negative effects if mixed and applied together).  I have been using this product for years and found significant skin improvement including minimal to no breakouts and healthy-looking and smooth skin.  If you only use one pump per day, a full-size bottle should last about 9 months, which is well worth the investment to me.  This is a product that will always remain in my skincare routine and if you don't already use it, I really highly recommend you give this a try.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Salicylic Acid, Lactic Acid, Citric Acid, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Opuntia FicusIndica Extract, Aesculus Hippocastanum Seed Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Rubus Idaeus Fruit Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae Extract, Buddleja Davidii Meristem Cell Culture, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Allantoin, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Galactoarabinan, Propanediol, Disodium EDTA, Xanthan Gum, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Nitrate, Potassium Sorbate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: The first Drunk Elephant product that I ever tried was the TLC Sukari Baby Facial. And while that face mask does wonders for your complexion, this serum gives you those same results everyday! In fact, using this serum every night, I have found that I don’t need to use the Sukari Baby Facial nearly as often. The combination of AHAs and BHAs in the TLC Framboos glycolic night serum keep my sensitive, combination skin under control. Even though I am in my thirties, if it is that time of the month or I am super-stressed put, then I will still breakout. But this serum is my secret weapon because when I use it daily, I find that my skin stays so much more clear (even during my period and when I am stressed out, etc.). I have tried so many products over the years and not a single serum, lotion or potion has improved my complexion as much as this serum has... especially in combination with all of the other amazing Drunk Elephant products that are a part of my morning and evening skincare routine. And if you really want to your skin to look like your using an IG filter (without actually needing to use one), alternate nights between using this serum and the DE retinol mixed with a few drops of marula oil in the evenings. Of course make sure to do all of the other important steps of your evening skincare routine, but I have noticed continuous improvement to my complexion since I went back to using all Drunk Elephant skincare products. I love this brand and they offer clean/green beauty products that actually work and over a matter of weeks you will actually physically be able to see and feel how much your complexion has changed for the better in not that many weeks time. Regardless of how my skincare routine may change overtime, this serum isn’t going anywhere (unless Drunk Elephant or another brand comes out with an even more incredible skincare product).
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Salicylic Acid, Lactic Acid, Citric Acid, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Opuntia FicusIndica Extract, Aesculus Hippocastanum Seed Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Rubus Idaeus Fruit Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae Extract, Buddleja Davidii Meristem Cell Culture, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Allantoin, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Galactoarabinan, Propanediol, Disodium EDTA, Xanthan Gum, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Nitrate, Potassium Sorbate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: Started using this serum last month in my nightly skincare routine along with the Drunk Elephant cleanser + protein moisturizer and I will say, it definitely helped clear up my skin. BUT, the Glycolic acid percentage is so high you really have to be careful. A few weeks ago I developed a scaly red rash on the outer corners of my mouth. Had no idea what it was, to the point where I went to the doctor and they guessed it could be a vitamin B deficiency. I’m 29 and haven’t had that as an issue before so I highly doubted that was the case. 4 days ago I took the Framboos out of my nightly skin care routine and the rash healed right up. I live in the desert where the air is very dry so that + my already dry skin + the Framboos dried out my skin way too much. If you have dry skin I recommend only using this serum at night once a week. I’m going to start doing that in hopes my skin doesn’t have a reaction that way.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Salicylic Acid, Lactic Acid, Citric Acid, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Opuntia FicusIndica Extract, Aesculus Hippocastanum Seed Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Rubus Idaeus Fruit Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae Extract, Buddleja Davidii Meristem Cell Culture, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Allantoin, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Galactoarabinan, Propanediol, Disodium EDTA, Xanthan Gum, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Nitrate, Potassium Sorbate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This is probably my favorite DE product and one of the only ones I’ve found to be worth the money. I noticed a difference within a couple of nights of using it, and have been using it for about a month now with no issues—it doesn’t feel harsh at all. I actually had the sample size and then bought the full size so I could save the rest of the sample for when I travel. It’s really fixed the uneven texture of my skin and made it much easier to take care of.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I received a sample of this product with my last purchase and I used it last night. I have horrible cystic acne and at the time was having a horrible outbreak on my chin. I used this product mixed with DE Marula oil and when I woke up my acne spots were almost completely gone. This is amazing considering they were under the skin and very painful yesterday! My skin is extremely sensitive but this product didn’t bother my face at all. I have already ordered the full size bottles! Just as an FYI I have combo skin with acne, rosacea, large pores and acne scars. This seems to be my holy grail.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This is my first product with Glycolic being the active ingredient. I can't say to the effectiveness as it's only been a week and the review deadline for this complimentary product is soon. However I do feel it sting a bit when I used it and there was immediate flaking as the skin exfoliated. I'll need more time to introduce the product but the peeling does indicate that it works. I appreciate the clear and thin consistency. It allows the product to spread quickly and easily. The price however is ridiculous. I would hope there are alternatives.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This has COMPLETELY changed my skin! I wouldn’t say my skin is super textured, but the little bumps were there and all over. First couple days, I broke out. Bad. But I am certain that was just all of my underlying acne coming to the surface. Now, my skin looks soooo smooth, the texture is completely gone, and my pores actually look smaller too! I cannot rave about this serum enough!!

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This is one of my absolute favorite skin care items that I couldn’t live without. It does everything it claims. I have been going to a dermatologist for over a year and this product has been more helpful than all of the prescriptions I have tried. It has helped to calm down my out of control acne. My skin is much brighter. My areas of discoloration and red marks are fading and skin is looking more even as well. If anyone is on the fence because of the price I recommend trying the night bright duo sample. It is worth every cent.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: After using accutane for 8 months, much of my scarring and pigmentation is finally gone. Turned to this product in persuit of fixing bumpy residual acne texture on the surface of my skin and I truly couldn’t be more impressed. I’ve never seen my skin like this in my life—I never thought I would. It’s an emotional change. Will definitely repurchase.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This is the best product out of the drink elephant line. This little guy helped so much in reducing my dark marks from inflamed acne. I was so worried because I just hated having those marks because you could see them through makeup and I didn’t think anything would really help. Then I tried this and I am so glad I did. It’s reduced the color and makes my face look so much better and brighter. Pair this with a vitamin c and watch your skin glow!

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I’m currently switching my skincare to all Drunk Elephant products. This was the second product I added to my regimen. It’s not as effective as the C-Firma serum for the AM, but it’s definitely most effective when paired with the oil. For the price, I expect it to be more effective for lightening blemishes and scars. The Murad Rapid Age-Spot and Pigment Lightening Serum actually works better and is about $20 cheaper. I could just switch back to Murad but I love so many of the Drunk Elephant products and so far I’ve seen great results when I use the products together.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Salicylic Acid, Lactic Acid, Citric Acid, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Opuntia FicusIndica Extract, Aesculus Hippocastanum Seed Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Rubus Idaeus Fruit Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae Extract, Buddleja Davidii Meristem Cell Culture, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Allantoin, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Galactoarabinan, Propanediol, Disodium EDTA, Xanthan Gum, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Nitrate, Potassium Sorbate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This is great. I’ve only been using it for a week but my skin is used to acids so I was able to dive right in. I adore the packaging first of all, great for travel and adorable! But my skin is already smoother and, surprisingly, more even - a benefit I wasn’t expecting. I struggle with red cheeks and when I wake up after using this, they’re completely calm! Really impressive for such a high concentration of acids. This has helped heal fading acne marks (not scars, just healing dark marks) and I am thoroughly impressed - might even be worth the $$$.
ingredients: Glycolic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Salicylic Acid, Lactic Acid, Citric Acid, Vitis Vinifera Juice Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Opuntia FicusIndica Extract, Aesculus Hippocastanum Seed Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Rubus Idaeus Fruit Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae Extract, Buddleja Davidii Meristem Cell Culture, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Allantoin, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Galactoarabinan, Propanediol, Disodium EDTA, Xanthan Gum, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Nitrate, Potassium Sorbate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I love the packaging, it’s fragrance free, and worked so so. I was mixing it with the moisturizer as directed, but was waking up like a grease ball. I had worse blackheads until I used it alone. It WILL burn if you have open areas. I think it does improve texture, but I don’t like how greasy I am after putting an acid on my face.

name: T.L.C. Framboos™ Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: This serum has been amazing! I have combination skin and suffer from enlarged pores, occasional breakouts and all around not great textured skin. After using this product combined with the jelly wash and whipped cream I have noticed a dramatic difference in my skin. My pores seem smaller already and any breakouts that occur are very minimal and clear up very quickly. I have only been using this product for two weeks so I can’t wait to see what happens after extended use. I highly recommend!

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: I had this sitting for a while because it was a gift and I was afraid of getting attached to it since it's a hefty price to pay. I started having really bad skin issues so I decided to try it. It definitely has helped with my texture. My foundation doesn't look as bumpy as it used to. I didn't know if it was doing much until I went to the aesthetician for the first time today. She used a light on me to see how my skin was and was surprised at how smooth it looked/felt. I told her I was using a lactic acid treatment and she said it's working for me so that's when I finally felt 100% good about this. I think it's helped heal my acne as well. The reason this is only 4 stars (wish I could do 4.5) is because it isn't brightening my scars at all. I'm still healing from a breakout from over 6 months ago and it hasn't lightened the scars at all. I can't justify the brightening part, plus I don't have many wrinkles to recommend this for that either but I love it for texture and breakouts.
ingredients: Extract Blend Lactic Acid, Caprylic, Butylene Glycol, Squalane, Cyclomethicone, Dimethicone, Ppg12, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth 20, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg100 Stearate, Arnica Montana Extract, Peg75 Meadowfoam Oil, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Oil, Triethanolamine, Xantham Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Steareth20, Dmdm Hydantoin
