review_text: Good, but it could be better. The product has a slightly sticky consistency. It was very moisturizing to my skin, but also irritating. I broke out immediately. It was not a major reaction, but I prefer TO lactic acid serum, and will stick with that moving forward. I recommend lactic acid for improving skin texture, but some ingredient in this was irritating to me.

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text:
Received 7 day challenge with Sephora purchase. And -Woooo hooo. Super effective. You have to make it work for you tho - not a one size fits all product. Dry skin people or sensitive combo skin - be careful - make sure you follow with a moisturizer. Extremely drying. Also if you have dry skin do not use everyday (alternate days or even every three days) and keep your skin hydrated. Smells awful but that’s lactic acid for you.

Also, can sting and itch at application - if it’s super itchy might be because your skin is dry. Itchiness subsided after 20 min for me. Next day skin was lovely - dark spots still there not really lightened - but the healthy skin I had was glowing. I can see how people with good skin love this.

Also, does nothing for existing acne. But again areas that were breakout free were so smooth and have stayed smooth so might be a good preventive serum to use a couple times a week.

And use sunscreen! I had spf 50 on and went for a hike the next day and at night my forehead was sunburnt - and I don’t burn easily. Make sure you wear your sunscreen!

Super effective be careful with it tho! I use once a week and it dries me out a lot!
ingredients: Extract Blend Lactic Acid, Caprylic, Butylene Glycol, Squalane, Cyclomethicone, Dimethicone, Ppg12, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth 20, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg100 Stearate, Arnica Montana Extract, Peg75 Meadowfoam Oil, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Oil, Triethanolamine, Xantham Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Steareth20, Dmdm Hydantoin

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: Love, love, love, love, love, love love. Out on at night and your skin feels silky smooth in the morning. I’m in my later 30s and have definitely noted it calming some of those little nasty lines that have been popping up (out of nowhere! Haha). It’s a little on the speedy side, so I buy it in waves, but highly recommended for use morning and night! Has a bit of a tingle to it, but I feel like that tells me it’s working it’s magic!

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: I got this as a sample once before and remember really loving it thinking that it really smoothed out my skin... Well I went ahead and purchased a bottle of this and I've been using it for about two weeks and havent oticed any difference. I wanted this for all of the claims... Texture, dark sports, and fine lines and wrinkles. I don't think this did anything it claims at all. My skin didn't even look smooth like it had before with my sample. I think they changed the formula bc it doesn't have the same scent as before. It smells like lemon now. I will be returning mine. I have no idea why this is at the price it is when it doesn't do anything. This is a strong pass for anyone with major skin issues like myself

review_text: Look, this stuff is nice and it works. The consistency makes it easy to use, the ingredients will do what they say if your skin responds well to lactic acid, and one pump should be enough for your whole face. (The smell, however, is something else, but you'll get used to it.) The thing is that you can absolutely find something at a fraction of the price with the exact same active ingredients that have the exact same effect if paired well with other skincare items.

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: Y’all... I was so excited to get this in the mail. Used it the first night, it stung a little, but I wasn’t concerned, people had mentioned that in their rave reviews so I wasn’t surprised... woke up the next morning with some serious breakouts... I thought maybe it was just purging my pores... so I reapplied on day two... worst mistake ever. I do not have very sensitive skin and I don’t struggle with breakouts really unless it is that time of month... so I dug a little deeper... low and behold I found my answer. Yours truly is allergic to formaldehyde... and guess what is in this lovely product?! DMDM Hydantoin... which is... you guessed it! Formaldehyde... what gives?! If you are formaldehyde sensitive DO NOT USE THIS. The dermatitis showed up almost instantly... not worth it... there are so many other products out there!
ingredients: Extract Blend Lactic Acid, Caprylic, Butylene Glycol, Squalane, Cyclomethicone, Dimethicone, Ppg12, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth 20, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg100 Stearate, Arnica Montana Extract, Peg75 Meadowfoam Oil, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Oil, Triethanolamine, Xantham Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Steareth20, Dmdm Hydantoin

I think this product is for more mature skin. I’m 30 and don’t need this in my life. My mom loves it (after I gave it to her).

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: I’ve gone without this treatment and tried other products that address the same issues for me (acne, uneven texture, dullness, etc...) simply because of how expensive this product is. Finally, I gave up and repurchased. It will surely be a staple in my skincare routine as I have found no other adequate replacement. I do alternate between several products and use this sparingly 2-3x a week and have noticed no difference from using it everyday. Also, expect to feel a tingle/slight burning sensation upon application, which is to be expected when applying any concentrated AHA and/or BHA product. However, since this is sensitizing, use it at night to begin with simply to assess how much temporary redness you may get. I am pale and redness prone so I only use this at night. Lastly, this fits in well to my K-Beaty routine (even though it’s not Korean) because it layers well under a sleeping mask.

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: I was initially hesitant to buy this because of the price point and since I just turned 30 I thought I wouldn't need something so expensive and "strong". I went ahead and bought it during a sale and let me tell you.. THIS IS WORTH IT. A little background: I have had cystic acne since I was 16 and being south Asian I'm very prone to hyper-pigmentation and scarring. This absolutely helped with the scarring and texture. Another thing I noticed is a glow to the skin. Brown girls will understand the dullness we have to our skin sometimes, this product brings a healthy glow and I don't really need foundation anymore. If you are hesitant to buy this because of the price point, I suggest go ahead as this will be an investment. One pump is more than enough so a little goes a long way. the 50 ml bottle lasted me 10 months.

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text:
This product goes on smooth, it is runny like a serum not a cream, not sticky, no overly powered scent, absorbs fast and I don’t feel any residue. Works good with layering moisturizer on top of it and doesn’t  affect my make up at all,  I only use this product in the a.m. and 1 pump is more than  enough for my face and neck and seems to be lasting me a while.
 My skin is light, combo, sensitive, prone to breakouts.  The first time I put this product on  immediately after getting out of the shower I felt a slight stinging sensation but that didn’t last long. 
 I can’t say that I noticed immediately the first time I used it any drastic changes in my skin. 
After using it regularly once a day I have noticed that I have not had any new breakouts, my skin feels smoother looks more even, my skin feels firmer  and the pores on my nose are less noticeable.

Outstanding!! Removes redness and dullness!! I look so dewy and radiant after using it! I’m 20 years old and don’t want wrinkles! This is a super deep exfoliator so I use it only once in a day twice a week without another exfoliator. 
I have sensitive skin so I follow the mask instructions! Leave it on for 15 minutes then lightly wash off with lukewarm water >3>
ingredients: Extract Blend Lactic Acid, Caprylic, Butylene Glycol, Squalane, Cyclomethicone, Dimethicone, Ppg12, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth 20, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg100 Stearate, Arnica Montana Extract, Peg75 Meadowfoam Oil, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Oil, Triethanolamine, Xantham Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Steareth20, Dmdm Hydantoin

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: I used a whole bottle before writing this review because I know you need a minimum of 30 days to see results since it takes your skin that long to generally restore itself. I have acne prince combination skin. I used this in combination with retinol daily. I saw no results. As I am writing this my face is still covered in acne scars and breakouts which I would have expected to be minimized by now. There are a lot of issues with this product. It does not reveal the % of lactic acid so I don’t know if it’s all fluff with 0.2% of lactic acid. The real kicker is the bottle itself (please see photo). They shove a plastic pouch into the bottle to deceive consumers into thinking there’s more product when in actuality the bottle is empty. Overall this product was a huge disappointment. Going back to skinceuticals which never lets me down.
ingredients: Extract Blend Lactic Acid, Caprylic, Butylene Glycol, Squalane, Cyclomethicone, Dimethicone, Ppg12, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth 20, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg100 Stearate, Arnica Montana Extract, Peg75 Meadowfoam Oil, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Oil, Triethanolamine, Xantham Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Steareth20, Dmdm Hydantoin

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: I only got this for my dark spots and this really helped. I tried a lot of products before this and they were helpful as well, but this works quick and I saw a huge difference! Dark spots are one of the most difficult to get rid of and takes a long time. I been using this along with Sunday Riley's Tidal moisturizer (since I have stubborn dark spots) for a month and a half and my dark spots faded up to the point they are almost gone! I also do the "facial flash" (this product and Sunday Riley's Ceramic slip clay cleanser combined) 1-2x a week, which is just a bonus to the Good Genes because my face brightened drastically! The only problem is the price, but at least it is effective.
ingredients: Extract Blend Lactic Acid, Caprylic, Butylene Glycol, Squalane, Cyclomethicone, Dimethicone, Ppg12, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth 20, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg100 Stearate, Arnica Montana Extract, Peg75 Meadowfoam Oil, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Oil, Triethanolamine, Xantham Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Steareth20, Dmdm Hydantoin

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text:
I have cystic acne-prone normal to dry that used to be oily with lots of unevenness, scarring, and large pores. I’ve used up one sample tube and two regular bottles of this stuff. It really is great. It has helped refine my skin’s texture far sooner than the prerequisite three months needed for skincare to work. It brightens overnight. I have used The Ordinary’s Lactic Acid (the higher %), and it didn’t seem to deliver the same results, BUT I had already been using GG a good period of time, so a lot of work had already been done.

My sister is now finishing up the current bottle I have, as the effects have plateaued a bit. She is extremely cheap, and she’s happy to buy this when she runs out. She’ll be buying both GG and TO to test side-by-side, so consider trying it before spending on this.

The scent debate reminds me of the cilantro debate: “does it taste good or like soap?” Except this debate is “does it smell like pet urine or citrus?” The sample smelled more like urine and the regular bottles like citrus. This isn’t to say the sample actually smells like pee - it just has a hint that makes you side-eye what you’re experiencing. How did we get to this point? Anyway, the inclusion of the scent itself is a downside. It isn’t needed, and scents irritate the skin over time.
ingredients: Extract Blend Lactic Acid, Caprylic, Butylene Glycol, Squalane, Cyclomethicone, Dimethicone, Ppg12, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth 20, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg100 Stearate, Arnica Montana Extract, Peg75 Meadowfoam Oil, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Oil, Triethanolamine, Xantham Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Steareth20, Dmdm Hydantoin

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: This is hands down one of the best products I have tried. This treatment helped with breakouts, texture, and dark spots. It is on the expensive side but the product will last you a long time, a little goes a long way. It hasn't removed my dark spots completely but has definitely minimized their appearance. Maybe if I continue to use they will :) I can tell the difference on my skin especially when I apply makeup. My skin looks so smooth and now feel comfortable enough to go about my day with no makeup days. I totally recommend this product to everyone. Start slow using once a day then move on to twice a day if needed. I am on my second bottle and still only use it once a day as it can become drying if used too much.

One day I will save up to purchase again!

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text:
Let me just first say - Wow! I’ve been using this for 3 weeks and have noticed a difference in my skin. I bought this because I’ve been struggling with acne scars and Milia (white little bumps on my face) since wearing a full coverage foundation. It was a catch 22 because wearing a full coverage foundation was to cover my scars but making my skin worse but I didn’t want my scars to show then I’d get these little bump or a pimple that I’d end of popping to only get more scars.

So enter Good Genes and in 2 days no more Milia. I haven’t seen one since. So I knew something was working. About a week or so later I began to notice some scars fading or flaking because of skin turnover that Good Genes had helped make happen. I’m really excited to see more results as I continue to use this. I have deep and dark scars that I have been trying to get rid of for months. I’ve tried other high end products but never seeing results. Good Genes is definitely helping me with not only fixing the issues I have but preventing my skin from getting worse. 

Also a little goes a long way. Definitely try it out but give it about 2-3 weeks to notice some differences. If having darker and deeper scars you might have to wait longer like I do to see a dramatic changes. But from the little changes I’ve seen so far, I know something is working!

review_text: It took me a while but I finally made it through the entire bottle! I love this stuff despite the hefty price tag. It helped my texture and brightened my acne scars. It gave me smooth skin and the scent was nostalgic and pleasant. It is drying however, so I kept it away from my dry/sensitive areas where I tend to flake and peel at when I apply acids. To the rest of my face where I’m more normal to oily my face loved this serum. I wish it was less pricy but I don’t regret my purchase one bit. Be sure to use it on bare skin for best results. I found when I put on serums prior to this, I didn’t have as great of effect as on bare skin.

review_text: This is that product you hate to love because it's so expensive. It smells like what you imagine lactic acid to smell like-- sour, tart, milky. The consistency is thick and sticky and never truly sinks into your skin. All roads point to "not gonna work" but voila in the morning your skin is hydrated, plump, clear, and bright AF. I use this every night as my last step, on top of my face oil, and sometimes seal it all in with an overnight mask. It's like a drug. The moment you go off of it, your skin will disappoint you.

review_text: I admit I was scared to try this at first because of the lactic acid, (sensitive skin) but I was able to use a deluxe sample successfully without any adverse affects. Honestly the only true effects I've seen thus far is that my skin cell turnover has increased. I've noticed a lot more skin peeling off when I use my peel gel. Smells nicely of citrus, but of course a lot of that is the acid. Seems like a great product for skin cell turnover. I don't see myself buying it for that price though. I'm happy with my current regimen.

review_text: I purchased the small set of the mini good genes and mini luna night oil at first. I had awful texture on my forehead and acne scars everywhere and after using good genes it completely went away. So I went back to sephora and painfully bought the full size good genes. The full size one lasted me almost 2 years, one pump is more than enough to cover my face. Now I’ve run out and my acne scars and texture are starting to come back. name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: This product is amazing. Like any treatment-those with sensitive skin should be cautious. Doesn’t mean it’s not for you but don’t use it more than once a day. I found it works best when used at night every three days at first and then every other day. It can cause some little bumps to appear but don’t fret- they probably won’t get out of control unless you overdo it. Let your skin take a breather if skin because irritated. Slow and steady wins the race!The price is high but it’s worth it. Only reason I didn’t give it 4 stars is the fact that it has formaldehyde in it. That’s sorta scary but the results are so good!!

Purchased over the last four years and will continue to use... if you love it I recommend buying the value size!

review_text:
A bit pricey, but I am loving.  I have combo/dry skin that get all upset with me if I don't moisturize or exfoliate. This pretty much does both!

I use this after washing my face in the morning, and then follow up with a water cream (currently Sunday's Tidal water cream).  My makeup goes on very smooth, and I swear it's because this created the smooth canvas.  It's not oily, at least for me, and absorbs quickly.  I will be repurchasing; it's worth it.

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: Holy Grail!! This product has helped my skin more in ONE WEEK than any other products has during its entire use. My skin is smoother, fine lines aren’t as noticeable, hyper pigmentation is starting to decrease, and I haven’t had a new pimple since using this (I have pretty bad cystic acne...this has even helped some of the huge bumps go away that I’ve had for months!!!) if you are at all curious with this...I would definitely try it. I know it’s expensive, but there’s a reason why!! I’ve only been using a week but I can already tell it’s a holy grail product. Go buy it!!

review_text: I noticed improvements in my skin texture. I don’t feel that lactic acid is strong enough to meet all of my needs. I would only use 1 pump of this every night and the bottle didn’t last long at all, despite what I considered a conservative amount of use. Before I repurchased, I tried out another brand’s glycolic acid which gave the result I was looking for. If you have dry or sensitive skin, good genes may work great for you. Unfortunately it was not strong enough for me so I won’t be repurchasing.

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: I recently received a sample of Good Genes from Sephora and it definitely lives up to its claims. It works like a chemical exfoliant to make your skin smoother and less textured. My only issue with this product is the smell! It takes a couple hours after application for the fragrance to dissipate. If it wasn’t so stinky, I would definitely give this product five stars. If anyone knows of a product that works as well as this one sans the smell, please let me know. Good Genes definitely lives up to the hype surrounding this product. I am really impressed with the results. I have sensitive, combination skin, so I prefer to use this product every other day. Because of the smell, I prefer to apply it prior to a face mask or in the morning before I apply my sunscreen and makeup and on of my favorite Tom Ford fragrances to help mask the smell of this product.
ingredients: Extract Blend Lactic Acid, Caprylic, Butylene Glycol, Squalane, Cyclomethicone, Dimethicone, Ppg12, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth 20, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg100 Stearate, Arnica Montana Extract, Peg75 Meadowfoam Oil, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Oil, Triethanolamine, Xantham Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Steareth20, Dmdm Hydantoin

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text:
A bit pricey, but I am loving.  I have combo/dry skin that get all upset with me if I don't moisturize or exfoliate. This pretty much does both!

I use this after washing my face in the morning, and then follow up with a water cream (currently Sunday's Tidal water cream).  My makeup goes on very smooth, and I swear it's because this created the smooth canvas.  It's not oily, at least for me, and absorbs quickly.  I will be repurchasing; it's worth it.

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: This product is simply a godsend. It does exactly what is says it will - my skin has honestly never looked better. It takes a couple of weeks to make a significant difference, however, from my first use my skin felt more supple and looked refreshed. After about a month, i had people asking me what I was doing for my skin, it looked so improved from before. I have noticed a big decrease in the spots/scarring on my face and it is definitely smoothing out a lot of bumps and unevenness. Great product. it is WORTH every penny. Honestly, don't be dismayed by the price, it lasts a REALLY long time because you don't need tons of product. If you reason how many times you use it vs. the price it's really worth it.

name: Good Genes All-In-One Lactic Acid Treatment
review_text: This cream does all it promises. even though my skin is quite sensitive, this treatment doesn't irritate me at all. I work back and forth between this and my ordinary bran retinoid treatment. this keeps my pores visibly clearer and helps to bring up blemishes to the surface faster so they aren't brewing forever and getting huge. I still break out some, but this definitely has changed my skin.

review_text: If you go slow your skin will glow!!! I get addicted to the soft magical overnight transformation from good genes and as a consequence, I have suffered the purging but it’s worth it!!! I’m on my second bottle and my skin is now adjusted to this. I recommend starting out to use it once a week for a few weeks and then twice, etc. it’s seriously powerful. I also recommend using it for KP on the back of your arms and for any little chest/back acne.

Worth the money in my opinion

I typically use this 3 times a week where on my off days I use a pha/bha toner and an aha face mask once a week. This works beautifully with the b hydra serum and found that when used in conjunction it improves results.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: Out of a little fear and not really knowing much about it, I avoided Retinol for years.  On a whim, I finally decided to try Drunk Elephant’s 2 weeks ago.  I love and use almost all of their other products, so I thought how bad could the Retinol be?  I bought the smaller size of A Passioni and it’s been a game changer for me.  I will definitely be repurchasing the larger size.  I do have sensitive skin, so I’ve started out with a small amount every other night.  There is some slight burning and redness similar to when using a stronger AHA, but it goes away within a few minutes.  I’ve also had minimal peeling.  I’ve been able to use it with my B Hydra, Protini, C Firma, and TLC Framboos without any problem.  My skin is noticeably smoother.  My pores and fine lines are definitely less noticeable.  I can’t stop checking my face out in the mirror.  I’m soooo happy with this purchase!
ingredients: Glycerin, CocoCaprylate, Stearic Acid, Coconut Alkanes, Glyceryl Stearate, Niacinamide, Caprylic, Cetearyl Alcohol, Pentylene Glycol, Passiflora Edulis Seed Oil, Retinol, Simmondsia Chinensis Seed Oil, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Prunus Armeniaca Kernel Oil, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Brassica Oleracea Acephala Leaf Extract, Brassica Oleracea Italica Extract, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Chrysin, Persea Gratissima Oil, Linoleic Acid, Linolenic Acid, Ceramide NP, Xanthophylls, Phytosphingosine, Phytosterols, Jojoba Esters, Physalis Pubescens Fruit Juice, Stearyl Glycyrrhetinate, Oryza Sativa Extract, Glycine Soja Oil, Carthamus Tinctorium Seed Oil, Palmitoyl Hexapeptide12, Cetyl Palmitate, Trehalose, Lauric Acid, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Olea Europaea Fruit Oil, Glucosamine HCL, Tocopheryl Acetate, CocoCaprylate, Pisum Sativum Extract, Tocopherol, Bambusa Vulgaris Leaf, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Carbomer, Trideceth6 Phosphate, NHydroxysuccinimide, Ceteareth20, Sodium Hydroxide, Laureth23, Steareth20, Propanediol, Chlorhexidine Digluconate, Polysorbate 20, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Chlorphenesin, Potassium Sorbate, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: This is a really nice retinol product.  It's definitely on the potent side, I imagine one might have some irritation if one jas never used a retinol before.  It definitely works.  Evens texture, smooths, adds a more youthful look to the skin.  I really appreciate the airtight packaging and a little goes a long way.  I took off a star because this just does not do for me what a prescription retinoid will do.  It doesn't really do anything for my hormonal acne or breakouts.  It also doesn't work as fast as a prescription product would.  If you've tried a Rx retinoid and couldn't tolerate it or found it too much or just aren't interested in getting a prescription and aren't dealing with acne, this is a great way to go.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
I’ll preface this review by saying I use mostly DE products and am kind of a fanatic. I originally bought this to use only once or twice a week and was unimpressed because I didn’t see any results- just minor peeling after the first use. 

I read reviews that this is most effective when used as frequently as possible, and bumping up from 1-2x per week to every other night made ALL the difference. My skin has seriously never looked nor felt this good. It’s balanced, silky smooth, no acne flare ups and reduced redness, blackheads, and pore size. 
I struggled for a while to know WHEN and HOW OFTEN to use DE products, so i’m including my full routine for anyone who might benefit:
AM: cleanse with Clarisonic, Tatcha cleanser, and apply C-Firma mixed with B-Hydra. Once that’s sunk in, I use Umbra tinte for SPF. 
PM: if wearing makeup, cleanse with Slaai and then Tatcha with Clarisonic. I alternate days using Framboos & Tatcha water cream moisturizer OR A-Pass and B-Hydra mixed. 
Once a week I shave my face, use Babyfacial, and top with F-Balm.
ingredients: Glycerin, CocoCaprylate, Stearic Acid, Coconut Alkanes, Glyceryl Stearate, Niacinamide, Caprylic, Cetearyl Alcohol, Pentylene Glycol, Passiflora Edulis Seed Oil, Retinol, Simmondsia Chinensis Seed Oil, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Prunus Armeniaca Kernel Oil, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Brassica Oleracea Acephala Leaf Extract, Brassica Oleracea Italica Extract, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Chrysin, Persea Gratissima Oil, Linoleic Acid, Linolenic Acid, Ceramide NP, Xanthophylls, Phytosphingosine, Phytosterols, Jojoba Esters, Physalis Pubescens Fruit Juice, Stearyl Glycyrrhetinate, Oryza Sativa Extract, Glycine Soja Oil, Carthamus Tinctorium Seed Oil, Palmitoyl Hexapeptide12, Cetyl Palmitate, Trehalose, Lauric Acid, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Olea Europaea Fruit Oil, Glucosamine HCL, Tocopheryl Acetate, CocoCaprylate, Pisum Sativum Extract, Tocopherol, Bambusa Vulgaris Leaf, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Carbomer, Trideceth6 Phosphate, NHydroxysuccinimide, Ceteareth20, Sodium Hydroxide, Laureth23, Steareth20, Propanediol, Chlorhexidine Digluconate, Polysorbate 20, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Chlorphenesin, Potassium Sorbate, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I was nervous to try this product. Retinols seem to be so scary for some reason. I started off slow.  I got very dry and flaky the first time but after I made sure to use the serum and moisturizer after the other users . I mean I don’t have horrible skin, but it’s not model worthy. In the summer my complexion always seems to be so much better due to some sun exposure (with sunscreen) I was recently pregnant and had to wait to use this product so just recently gave it a go. I can tell you I’ve never had so many compliments on my skin after using this! This is the answer. This will forever be a part of my skin care routine and I mean my skin care routine is quite extensive. Here’s to step 10! Haha

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I have been using this product (A-Passioni   B-Hydra) for two weeks and so far, this combo has been good for my skin. I have an acne prone skin, with cystic acne in the chin/lip area, and acne scars on my cheeks, and my skin tone has improved, my acne is less important and my skin appears firmer than it was before. Usually, when I use a new product in my skincare, I breakout a lot, and that was not the case with this combo. Hope it will continue to make my skin better. I absolutely love it, and it feels light on the skin. I use it before bed, every other day.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
This product is very effective. I noticed a considerable difference in my skin after only one use. I had a more even complexion and an instant glow. Even my boyfriend asked me what I did differently, which says a lot. 

The formulation is great because it is moisturizing enough that it counterbalances the drying effects of the active ingredient (retinol). However, I would caution using it around the eye area as it can make the skin around the eyes sensitive or sore. The label clearly states that you should avoid the eye area, but the worst wrinkles on my face are under my eyes, so I applied it there anyways. I did not develop a rash or burn by doing this, but I would recommend avoiding the eye area as much as possible because it can cause discomfort.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: So not gonna lie, I was hoping not to love it because the 1 oz of this is so expensive, especially compared to The Inkey Retinol. But because of all the reviews and hype I gave in and just bought the mini size of the Drunk Elephant A-Passioni Retinol that comes with the B-Hydra. Aaand, okay, the Inkey Retinol works really great, but let's face it, it's a beginner's retinol, so when you're ready to graduate to something stronger, the Drunk Elephant won't disappoint. I'm happy I started with the Inkey Retinol - it def provides results if you're new to retinol - 'cuz yeah, not sure I could've started with the Drunk Elephant, you can tell it's just stronger. In the first couple times it was a little bit drying, so you def need to take it easy at first and only use once or twice a week to start. Also, I had to make sure to use some other extra hydrating products alongside it, like hydrating masks, and extra hydrating moisturizers. But now I've been using the Drunk Elephant and following it up with Kiehl's Midnight Recovery (a squalane-based hydrating oil to hydrate) and this is a magical combination. My skin feels luxuriously soft and smooth in the morning. You just need to make sure you have a nice hydrating product to use with this. Maybe a little trial and error to see what combo works for you. The B-Hydra is not hydrating enough, but a nice product to mix with the retinol when you're starting out.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I’ve tried so many different vitamin A products including two different ones from a dermatologist and none of them came close to delivering the results this product did! I’m about half way through my tube and will be repurchasing! I started using it once or twice a week but now I use it about six times a week (and on my off days I’ll use Farmacy’s honeymoon serum). My skin tone evened out drastically, and most of the texture on my skin is all gone! I’d give this product 10 stars if I could!

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: After reading reviews, I was worried this would ruin my skin considering it's sensitive and acne-prone. Surprisingly, I'm not experiencing any severe dryness as most. In fact, my skin seems to be pretty tolerable and after a months use I may start using this twice weekly. I must disclose that I do have experience with Retinols. In my early twenties I was on Accutane, and i've just recently switched to this from Dr. Brandt's Retinol serum (they made a horrible reformulation). I really have noticed this smoothing out my fine lines, especially on my forehead, and it's also helping to diminish texture. My complexion appears more supple, even, and my pores even appear smaller. However, I do feel my current skincare regime is aiding in positive results. Don't use a cleanser that strips your skin, causing extra dryness. Get a good Hyaluronic Acid cream. I didn't like the serum DE provided with this product; I suggest the cream from Youth to the People. This is probably the most important: Invest in a mild exfoliator that you can use DAILY, such as the Foreo Mini (this is what I use). The Foreo will help unclog the pores so your product can be readily absorbed, and it'll also slough away any dead skin cells on the surface which may be causing dryness.
ingredients: Glycerin, CocoCaprylate, Stearic Acid, Coconut Alkanes, Glyceryl Stearate, Niacinamide, Caprylic, Cetearyl Alcohol, Pentylene Glycol, Passiflora Edulis Seed Oil, Retinol, Simmondsia Chinensis Seed Oil, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Prunus Armeniaca Kernel Oil, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Brassica Oleracea Acephala Leaf Extract, Brassica Oleracea Italica Extract, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Chrysin, Persea Gratissima Oil, Linoleic Acid, Linolenic Acid, Ceramide NP, Xanthophylls, Phytosphingosine, Phytosterols, Jojoba Esters, Physalis Pubescens Fruit Juice, Stearyl Glycyrrhetinate, Oryza Sativa Extract, Glycine Soja Oil, Carthamus Tinctorium Seed Oil, Palmitoyl Hexapeptide12, Cetyl Palmitate, Trehalose, Lauric Acid, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Olea Europaea Fruit Oil, Glucosamine HCL, Tocopheryl Acetate, CocoCaprylate, Pisum Sativum Extract, Tocopherol, Bambusa Vulgaris Leaf, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Carbomer, Trideceth6 Phosphate, NHydroxysuccinimide, Ceteareth20, Sodium Hydroxide, Laureth23, Steareth20, Propanediol, Chlorhexidine Digluconate, Polysorbate 20, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Chlorphenesin, Potassium Sorbate, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: This was my first time using retinol. I’ve got some leftover pigmentation from breakouts and with my olive skin tone, they just never go away. I stepped up my use of this as recommended, from once a week to a few times a week to every other day, then nightly. Be very careful when using this product. I’ve used it and gone for a brow wax and had my skin ripped off. Although it recovered using Polysporin, you can’t go for a wax within 10 days of using retinol, which includes even one minimal application. In the beginning, I noticed a “purge” of my pores where my skin got worse than it was, but cleared up again. I am using it to get rid of the leftover pigmentation, and so far it is doing a great job. It has also flattened my raised bumps. It also has my skin looking rather clear and fresh upon waking and as a result I’ve barely been using my masks which I used to use every day. A tip: don’t scrub your skin with any type of exfoliant while using this product. It will make your skin very sensitive. Also, use only a pea size amount as directed. Don’t overdo it because it will make your skin unnecessarily sensitive. I actually use a moisturizer after it to prevent drying, which works well. I use an essence water and a preserum before, but not an actual serum.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I wanted to love this product but it was havoc on my skin. It made my skin look so dull!! It caused me to break out more than the normal purging stage and then the breakouts went away they left dark marks!!!! That has never been as issue for me before. I stopped use and my skin is glowy and clear.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: Like any retinol products, it takes a very long time of consistent use to notice any effect. I think this works because my skin gets irritated after daily use for few days, I have been using prescription grade retin-A but switched to this one instead because I wanted to try something new. Even though I’m not retin-A naive , this dull burns my skin so this stuff works! Make sure to use sunscreen during the day. I like to put on a face oil before apply this, make it less drying. Love the texture, not greasy. I wish they make one for the eye area.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I really like this. It’s quite strong at 1st so you really need to ease in, every other day tops. It will make you peel if you use too much right away, but now that my skin is used to it my pores are smaller, and my skin is brighter. It helps if you mix it in with a moisturizer so it’s even across your face and isn’t so harsh. Retinol is apparently one of the only skin care ingredients that actually is proven to reduce lines and wrinkles. Everything else is advertised as “This may reduce...” You probably don’t need it if you’re younger than 28 but once you get to your late 20s/early 30s it’s a game changer.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
This little guy packs a punch ! Start slow, mix it with moisturizer or patch test to not have unpleasant surprises ! It doesn’t contain silicones so this thing goes right into your skin ! Haven’t used in long enough to speak about anti aging but the retinol is definitely doing its job.

Tube is very sensitive :) touch it lightly and only squeeze from the top(red stripe).

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: This product has helped my skin IMMENSELY. I had terrible cystic acne for months and nothing helped and I was starting to get deep scars and couldn't even put foundation on without feeling awful about myself. I started slow as a lot of people warned and then was able to work my way up to every other day. It has really helped to calm the huge pimples that pop up and its starting to re-texturize my skin so you see the scars less. I am so grateful for this cream!

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I have been using this for almost a year now. I am 25 so I am using this as a preventative measure and for early signs of aging. Before starting to use this, I had a line on my forehead that was getting deeper. It didn’t seem to go away when I first started using this retinol cream so I thought it wasn’t doing anything... but I persisted. Now that I look at myself in the mirror several months later, I notice that my forehead line is barely noticeable! This is the first retinol product that I’ve tried and I had to ease into it (once a week then twice a week because it was a little drying) and now I can use this every second night if I want to. I mix a small amount with my moisturizer and I feel like this tube will last me soooo long. I feel like this gives long term results, so be patient. I will definitely continue using it.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: HOLY S#@%!!! I am shook. My skin looks soooo good! I am 39 and I'm just starting to get some fine lines around my lips. The so-called "smoking wrinkles", except I don't smoke. I also have some wrinkles between my eyebrows and across my forehead and those are a little deeper. I have been using tretinoin for about a year and I see MUCH better results from the Drunk Elephant retinol cream. I use DE C-Firma serum during the day and the A-Passioni at night and the fine lines around my mouth are completely gone. GONE! I can still see the lines on my forehead but they are much less noticeable. Thank You Drunk Elephant!

review_text: This retinol is very effective and does everything a retinol suppose to do. However, you have to really get adjusted. I've been using various retinol for years, but getting use to this took me over a month. I had peeling, rash and burn in the beginning. However, Patience paid off as it's now one of my favorites.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: The last retinol I purchased was the Peter Thomas Roth professional 3% retinol serum. With this only being 1% I was skeptical as to whether or not it would work or if I’d be able to feel it. I can definitely feel it!!! There is a reason this comes with a tiny vial of the moisturizing serum. Until your skin gets used to this you’ll definitely want to mix it in with the retinol cream. The first 2 times I used it I didn’t mix it and my skin got very red and very dry lol I am trying to build up my tolerance now. It’s definitely a potent product which I did not expect at all! 2 thumbs up!

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: Absolutely love this product!  I've been using for about 6 months now and the results are great.  I'm not a stranger to acids and haven't used retinol in years; but this was definitely super strong in the beginning. after about 3 weeks the irritation subsided and now i just get the standard peeling that is easily remedied by a good wash and hydration.  I had a recent visit to the dermatologist and he commented that my skin was clearer and wanted to know what I've been using.  While there's definitely a lot of 'extra' in this product i think it's worth every penny.  A tube lasts me almost the entire year, 3 times a week.  i would definitely keep this away from your eyes, though.  and if you have oily skin the extra oils and some other ingredients may do more harm than good. i only mix with a light moisturiser when necessary and im good to go!

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I love this brand and most of my skincare is drunk elephant and I was really excited that they decided to use a retinol in their line. One thing that i greatly appreciate about this brand is the thoughtfulness that they put into the packaging. Unfortunately, this product is the exception. The packaging isn't great, but the product itself is ok. the thing is, most times I go to open the lid the product comes rushing out uncontrollably. I don't live in somewhere with a very high elevation so I'm not sure what the problem is. I like that the product contains a range of skin soothing ingredients along with a potent retinol. I'd just like to see that in in pump so i'm not waisting a lot of product every time i go to use it. Definitely not for someone who travels or lives in an are of high elevation. That being said, I would definitely repurchase once the packaging problem is fixed.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
A lot of reviewers mentioned the issues with A-Passioni's packaging. I agree that it's a pain, but there's a reason that Drunk Elephant did not put this product in their signature twist top bottle. Retinol reacts to air by breaking down into an inactive oxidized product. In other words, prolonged exposure to air will make the product ineffective. Therefore, it has to be kept in an air-tight container, and that's why A-Passioni is in a metal tube. Because it's air-tight, when you take the cap off it releases pressure and product may ooze out involuntarily. But once you get the hang of dispensing the product (as I now have), a bit of hassle is much better than an entire bottle of spoiled retinol, in my opinion. I just keep a finger over the opening and release as needed to dispense the product until I have enough, then quickly twist the cap back on.

But now let's get to the actual product. I've never used a retinol product before and I am 28 with combination skin. I started with 1x/week application, then bumped up to 2x per week, and now I'm up to 3x/week after a few months of use. I never experienced any peeling or dryness, but I don't have sensitive skin and I have always followed up with a face oil (DE's Marula oil would be similar to what I use). I also mix DE's T.L.C. Framboos Glycolic Night Serum with it, which is an Alpha Hydroxy Acid product.

I've struggled with my complexion for years due to PCOS and no other skincare products have ever made a difference. But A-Passioni and T.L.C. Framboos have completely changed the texture and tone of my skin. The hyperpigmentation spots from acne are gone, and my deeper scars are filling in as well. Not only that, but my fine forehead lines are disappearing too! I'm shocked when I look at before/after photos of myself. I can now confidently step out of the house without foundation or concealer, and that is a huge deal for me.

This skincare skeptic has turned into a true Drunk Elephant believer!

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
I'm not new to retinol and have tried a few retinol products. I have a few issues with this product. 1) the packaging is terrible like most people have indicated. The cap gets extremely messy because the product just keeps coming out so it's close to impossible to just get the perfect amount of product out because once you push some out... it keeps wanting to come out and you end up wasting product. 2) the consistency - I found it hard to spread this over my face. The cream is a bit thicker and I felt like i needed a lot of product to cover my face. 3) Price - this is an expensive product especially when you have to use a lot of it. The thing with retinol is that it normally takes a few months before you see results and the combination of needing to use more product and wasting product and the time it took to see results I was just not a fan of this product.

I was using this product every 2-3 days for a few weeks and didn't see any change.  I also didn't experience any peeling so this product is gentler than other retinols I have tried. I would suggest starting off with the ordinary retinol as it is much more affordable and a bottle will last way longer!

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: When I reach for the Drunk Elephant A-Passioni Retinol Cream I take a look in a mirror and of course I use the retinol in strategic areas. For me I like to use it on my forehead to smooth the fine lines, on some dark spots and acne scars on my face as well as the pesky laugh lines. Now the Drunk Elephant A-Passioni Retinol Cream is to be used one or two times a week AM or PM gradually increasing your frequency to every other night and then every night as your skin tolerates it. I personally use this twice a week for 2 weeks and then I use it about 4 days a week there after. The recommendation from Drunk Elephant is to use a pea-size amount or less to clean dry skin which is what I did. You can also mix it with your favorite Drunk Elephant Cream or Oil I used it the B-Hydra Intensive Hydration Serum included in the box of A-Passioni Retinol Cream and some of their Protini Polypeptide Cream. After the first application I was thrilled not to have any irritoation or redness at all (that was a first for me with Retinol) Then I used it a second time that week and had no issues. After my third application I woke up in the morning and just noticed my skin was a little dry after the 4th application dry and flakey so I used a thicker moisturizer and did not have an issue. I did continue to increase the use of the A-Passioni Retinal Cream to about 4 days a week and I had great results. My forehead fine lines had truly diminished and my acne scars were faded which meant I didn't have to use as much concealer. I can finally say that I LOVE a retinol cream and its all thanks to Drunk Elephant A-Passioni Retinol Cream!

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
I waited two months to write this review. I bought this product hoping to resolve some persistent (painfil, ugly, huge) hormonal acne on my jawline that I could never seem to completely vanquish as well as some scarring. Many products I tried improved the situation, but hadn't resolved it.
Enter this retinol. I have not had a major breakout in over a month, the acne spot patches I used to buy 40 of at least once a month are still 1/4 full from January. My skin is finally clearing and I feel like myself again. I still have scarring and had a small breakout around my time of the month, but the results have been wonderful especially considering I've been using very little of this once a week and am just now moving to 2x a week of use mixed in with the Hydra B (included) to help it spread further. I can see this first tube lasting 4  months, though they will run out faster as I up my usage.
The comments about the packaging are fair, a pump would be much better for this product, but for these results I would put up with worse.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I dont have sensitive skin and I am used to putting peels and all that on my face. I’ve been using the glycolic acid by DE for a while and it’s amazing. Well long story short, I thought “hmm let’s use tlc and retinol all together 3 days in a row even tough I’ve never used retinol before because I don’t have sensitive skin I’ll be fine” holy crap! My skin hurts so bad and is peeling so bad! Not DE fault at all. All mine! Just writing this review so that y’all mindful and really start slow!

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
The reason I’m giving it four stars is that I think the company nowadays should state very clearly on the package especially with this strong retinol. Don’t mix it with AHA and BHA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
It completely changed my skin. The firs time I used it. It was wonderful so I decided to buy full size. 
But the second time i accidentally used a serum that contains AHA that I wasn’t aware of. Now my skin is peeling red irritated so badly. 
Please. Don’t mix it with other active ingredients. Or else you will burn your skin like I did.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
I have no skincare routine to speak of (just cleanse during daily shower) and after years of neglect, my skin is in protest. I got samples of the A-Passioni and Protini when I bought the Littles Kit so I could try out Drunk Elephant and start a skincare routine.

First night I used A-Passioni mixed with Lala, Protini and B-Hydra to reduce the possibility of irritation. Had way too much of the mix so rubbed the rest on my arms (with KP). Woke up to soft skin and some of the KP bumps just flaked off. Used it again last night (3 nights later, this time with just Lala and B-Hydra) and I think that may have been too much too soon particularly since there was less buffer this go-around. Skin on my cheeks and around my mouth was flaking and feeling quite sensitive so I had to put an extra slather of moisturizer (Lala B-Hydra) within like 10 minutes. On the upside most of the bumps (milia?) around my neck were gone the next day. I'm laying off retinol until my face becomes less sensitive. I think I'll go back to buffering it with the Lala Protini B-Hydra mix, too, and just using the excess on my arms.

I find A-Passioni to be very effective but it's still a retinol so definitely use it with caution. Knocking off one star 'cause it's also darned pricey. However, I'm definitely buying after my sample runs out. Hmm, wonder if the sample might actually last me until the next VIB sale...

review_text: Have to give it 2 stars for the packaging alone, without even trying the product for more than a week. The tube is so pressurized that when I opened it, SO much of the product came out! name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: Retinol is now a must have in my skincare. I did experience some peeling at first (using once a week) but my skin is finally getting used to it. I mix the B-Hydra Intensive Hydration Serum into this and wake up looking refreshed. Fine lines are slowly but surely disappearing. DO NOT use around your eyes, I made this mistake and it actually made lines form around my eyes - it goes away after a few days of discontinued use. The packaging is awful. It squirts out too much product and no matter what gets clogged up inside of the cap and makes a mess. I want to take away a star but the actual product inside the tube makes it hard to do that.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I have been using this for a month now and the results are not what I was hoping for. I have some milia and a couple small sun spots that I was hoping to get rid of. After this month of using the retinol, my skin is red and peeling, but the milia and sun spots haven’t budged. I thought that I would have seen some results by now. Maybe I am being too impatient?  Maybe it just takes longer than I realized. Again I wasn’t expecting a complete overhaul, just some positive results.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: Drunk Elephant did it again! I have always been hesitant & afraid to try retinol especially bc I have very sensitive skin & reactive skin. The DE line saved my skin last year & I will never look back & am beyond excited for a new product in their line. Luckily I had a gift card from xmas right as this released. I know DE is expensive but after literally trying everything I believe the line is worth every penny. I only used this twice so far in a one week period, I mixed with B hydra, a drop of Marula, and Lala and the pea size amount spread evenly & kept me moisturized. I did notice a slight flakiness but no stinging or burning of the skin. I had a small horizontal line forming on my forehead I assume an expression line from moving my forehead & already the line appears less noticeable & some of my old acne scars look more faded. Im excited to see the long term results. Thank u Tiffany for releasing another great product Im excited to see what else she has in store for 2019! Ladies go get a sample in store & follow instructions, BE PATIENT! Its worth it to get good results with less irritation. Start out slow.

The first night I used it I had a few breakouts before I applied, and the next morning they were smaller! I did also have the same problem frequently mentioned with the packaging. I live in ohio and the product slowly oozes out of the tube when it not pressing on it. But the cap helps seal it, so you won’t open up the cap and a ton will fall out. So just be quick to put the cap back on and you’re golden!

review_text: I love this product and it is now a staple in my night time routine. It does take time though - I had a big purge of pimples by my second week of weaning on to the product, and also experienced dryness as well. From doing a bit of research on Retinol before purchasing i knew that was going to happen so I just powered through it. I'm now at about a year and a half of use because it has truly transformed my skin. Its the antioxidants/other ingredients in it that take it to another level too.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: The product is great but the packaging is dreadful. With just a little press the cream comes out and doesn't stop. As soon as you take off the top the cream starts coming off again. I've had this product for over a year (so a lot of product has been used) and cream still keeps coming out without me pressing on the container. It's frustrating and annoying, and, for the price, it should be packaged better.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: So I was prescribed tretinoin a year ago for my acne and it was crazy drying and made my skin flake and itch all the time for about 2 months before anything got better and part of it was because i was using WAY too much for what my skin could handle so ultimately I stopped using it. Fast forward a year, this product was released but I was scared to try because of my previous experience. I ended up getting a sample with another purchase and decided to wing it and no joke my skin looked better THE NEXT DAY. A majority of the hyperpigmentation I had was GONE. Plus, did not irritate my skin at all or cause any dry/flakey patches. (If you start slow and mix a teeeeny amount with moisturizer you won't have any issues) Safe to say, I am buying the full size ASAP.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I really love this product. I’ve never used a Retinol cream before and I wasn’t sure what to expect but it does just what I was hoping it would. In a little over a week, it smoothed out most of my texture and gotten rid of all of the stubborn little whiteheads on my forehead. I have very sensitive combo skin (oily t-zone and dry cheeks and chin) and almost anything can upset it. I’m usually very hesitant to introduce a new product into my routine but DE has never steered me wrong in the past and I’m happy I took a chance with this one. I haven’t had any issues with breakouts and I use it about 3 times a week mixed with Lala and B-Hydra. If the results continue this way, this will be a staple for me.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text:
This retinol cream is truly amazing. It does everything it says it does. I do get the peeling but use a heavy moisturizer and a gentile cleanser and have had no problems. Pairing with the b hydra really helps too. 

The packaging though, the pressurized tube makes it literally impossible not to waste product. I used wayyyyy too much my first use just to avoid wasting product. Big mistake. Since then I end up throwing more than half of what comes out away. I’m down to about 2/3 of the tube left with only a couple uses.. I didn’t see the safety pin trick until after I had already opened it so I may repurchase one more time to see if that helps. If not, I don’t think I would repurchase based on how much product I am wasting.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: I have been using this product since it was first released, I have put my skin through a lot over the years so I thought I could disregard the usage recommendation and I used this two nights in a row the first week and I did have some drying but I laid off of it for a few days and hydrated my skin and it bounced back quickly. Now that I have been using it consistently for almost two months I am noticing major changes in my skin. Fine lines around my eyes are disappearing, some textured acne scarring that I could not get rid of for the life of my is disappearing, dark spots are fading, pimples I had that I could feel under my skin but hadn’t budged for a year or so have came to head and are long gone, and my skin is smoother and overall healthier looking. I highly recommend this to everyone. Follow the directions, mix this with oil and moisturizer and use only the amount directed every few days and you will be amazed. Patience is virtue with this! Note: I do use the entire drunk elephant line in conjunction with Jordan Samuel skin cleanser and vintners daughter oil.

name: A-Passioni™ Retinol Cream
review_text: This is the only retinol I've ever been able to use long term. My skin is extremely sensitive. The first few tries with this product I peeled like crazy, just like many other reviewers have noted, BUT that is just a sign you're going too fast with application. I've used Avibon (A313) in the past and learned from that product that if you have sensitive skin, you need to apply moisturizer first, let that dry (about 15 mins) and then apply the retinol. A313 works but it made my skin itchy and never absorbs, which is annoying at night. The A-Passioni absorbs well and my skin is noticeably brighter in the morning. It also helps with breakouts, as in it will bring them to the surface for treatment. The people on here complaining about breaking out from the product are clearly not familiar with retinol -- purging is a standard experience and occurs because your skin is shedding. Stick with it, work into it slowly, and you'll see results. I started by applying only once a week for several weeks, and then 2x, and then 3x, and now I'm every other day. I use Cerave lotion for its ceramicides before applying. On my nights off I use Sunday Riley lactic acid, but once that bottle runs out I plan to switch to retinol every single night. The only reason I knocked off a star on this product is because the retinol spills out with even the gentlest pressure. I wish they'd put it in a pump or something. But overall, great product, great for gentle skin, and with steady application over time, you WILL see results.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: Okay so I really do love this serum. It’s very hydrating for my dehydrated oily skin. I mix this with the vitamin c serum and it’s soooo nice. HOWEVER, I don’t find this an absolute NEED. I mean drunk elephant is expensive. And yes you do get what you pay for with these products. However, this isn’t a NEED. If you’re going to spend the money for a good serum, I rather spend my hard earned money on the TLC or vitamin c serum to make a REAL difference in my skin. It hasn’t broken me out or irritated my skin. It’s a good hydrating serum. But you can find something easily replaceable.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: Initially I tried the ordinary HA serum which I found to be very sticky and took forever to dry. I usually don’t splurge on a HA serum since (i thought) most of the formulations were the same. I switched over to this after this came as a sample through my order. I love the consistency and I use this as a moisturizer in the morning (I get pretty oily throughout the day) and then use it as a boost with my nightly moisturizer. My skin loves this and makes me texture so soft. This works beautifully with their retinol as well to prevent irritation. This is a great buy if you have combo/oily skin and or are using a retinol to calm down the harsh effects of it.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: This product saved my acne-prone skin last year. It was my first purchase from DE and I decided to do a strict 2-week skin detox using ONLY this serum and their jelly cleanser every day. My inflamed cystic acne and hormonal acne reduced by at least 75% in those two weeks! I then introduced the protini moisturizer and kept this routine for about 6 months. This is the quickest and most efficient way I’ve ever calmed my skin and got it back under control!! I’m on my 3rd bottle of the B-hydra in about a year and a half. It’s a skin saver. I now use it when I need a boost under my moisturizer or alone on my entire face for the daytime when I’m breaking out or feel that my skin is extra sensitive. LOVE LOVE!

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text:
I have combo/oily skin that became super dehydrated this winter. My skin felt very tight and parched, and was noticeably flaking underneath the oily shine. Moisturizer alone just wasn't enough. The B-Hydra gel has greatly helped hydrate my skin (probably thanks to the Hyaluronic Acid). I mix a couple of pumps B-Hydra with Lala Retro or Protini then apply to damp skin. That seems to have solved my winter skin woes.

B-Hydra doesn't contain occlusives so you still need to use something with oil or silicone otherwise it could actually make skin drier.
ingredients: Coconut Alkanes, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Wheat Amino Acids, Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract, Berberis Vulgaris Root Extract, Citrullus Lanatus Fruit Extract, Lens Esculenta Fruit Extract, Pyrus Malus Fruit Extract, CocoCaprylate, Panthenol, Sodium PCA, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Niacinamide, Cyclodextrin, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sodium Lactate, Phenoxyethanol, Hydroxyproline, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Chlorphenesin, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I've been using DE for a couple of years, and the line has totally transformed my skin. When I first tried B-Hydra, I wasn't that impressed, especially in comparison to TLC, C-Firma, Marula, etc. I felt like it was an unnecessary step in my routine. After repurchasing recently, I fell totally in love. It just amplifies each step of my routine - my face is noticeably more plump, smooth, bright, and hydrated. I didn't give 5 stars because it's not something I can't live without, but it's still a great product. I will repurchase.

review_text: Don’t listen to 90% of the bad reviews, they’re using it wrong. This is not meant to be a moisturizer, it’s a hydrating serum. Use after toner when the face is still damp and follow with your routine as normal. It’s a game changer for hydration and nothing compares. The added ceramides are great for skin health and this plumps like no other.

review_text: This product is weird in that it claims to be a "hydration gel," yet I've actually seen a few people complain that it dries them out. I never used this product on its own, without any other moisturizers, so it never dried me out, but I also didn't feel like it was anywhere near hydrating enough to be worth the price. Basically, it seemed like it just didn't do anything at all.

review_text: I finally took the plunge on purchasing this product and do not regret it at all! I've used other hyaluronic acid serums with minimal results and poor textures (pilling, stickiness, etc.). This product not only provides noticeable hydration, its also cosmetically elegant. It doesn't pill, layers well with other products, and isn't all that sticky. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a hydrating serum for their routine. Its pricey, but I think its worth it.

Please look elsewhere.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I have dry skin on my face and neck, save my very oily forehead. This serum has managed to pull my differing skin types in closer to "normal" all around my face. The serum is lightweight and I only need one pump to cover my entire face. I do need to use this everyday, otherwise my forehead goes back to very oily. I also appreciate the size and especially the price (which is more affordable for the $$$ Drunk Elephant). It also mixes very well with both of their moisturizers.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: Okay, let me preface this by saying that I’m a true skeptic at heart. I don’t buy into drunk elephant’s marketing; however, this serum truly is worth every penny. I apply this serum in the morning and then immediately lock in it’s benefits by applying protini. It is a humectant WITHOUT an eclusive. YOU MUST USE AN ECLUSIVE MOISTURIZER TO LOCK IT IN!! My face feels hydrated and smooth all day. Like ridiculously smooth and hydrated. I will definitely repurchase. I do not think you need to purge your skin care regimen and transition to ONLY drunk elephant products, but if you’ve been on the fence about trying their products, I recommend taking the plunge and buying the B-hydra and using it with either the protini or your favorite moisturizer. You will NOT be disappointed!!

review_text: This serum is great for my skin type! I think if you have extremely dry skin you can’t expect this to clear up the fact your skin needs moisture but if you’re like me with combination skin that’s sensitive this does the trick! My skin gets oily but since it’s a sensitive I tend to go towards really creamy cleansers and moisturizers. Plus I only use clean products on my skin so love that as well!

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: This has been a nice add-on to my routine, but I don't think it does anything beyond boost the moisture I put on when I add it in with my vitamin C so I stopped using it. I probably won't repurchase, it's a good product but not worth the price-point imo. The reason why it gets 4 stars instead of 3 is because it doesn't make my sensitive, acne-prone skin breakout. If I were struggling with finding other moisturizers that don't break me out, I'd probably settle on this one. But the Dermalogica Calm Water Gel that I'm currently using is a great moisturizer for sensitive acne-prone skin, has a similar feel to this product, is more affordable and comes with more product. At this point I'm just using this for a moisture-boost with my Saint Jane cbd oil after intense masks, such as the Ole Henrikson PHAT mask.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I normally mix it with A-Passioni to help dilute it, but I occasionally use it on its own. The nice thing about this is how versatile it is: use it alone and it absorbs quick, mix it with retinol to prevent irritation, or mix it with anything else for a lighter consistency. No matter how I use it, my face likes it.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text:
I use this serum in conjunction with the Drunk Elephant C-Firma Day serum each and every morning. I apply both serums to my face/neck/chest everyday all year round. During colder weather I’ll apply an additional moisturizer on top of them both to seal in my skincare after waiting 5-10 min to let C-Firma and B-Hydra absorb into my skin well. I truly enjoy using them together every morning. I let them absorb and finish off with a facial oil pressed into my skin and finally my SPF. 
I highly recommend Drunk Elephant skincare products!

review_text: I started out using this with the littles set and wasn’t really sure how I felt about it and I couldn’t really tell if it was doing much for my skin. However, when I ran out of the trial size and stopped using it for a few days, I noticed that my skin was starting to dry out half way through the day. I went and repurchased the full size and my skin is back to feeling amazing all day. It really does help your skin retain moisture throughout the day and it is now a permanent staple in my skincare routine!

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I think people may be a little confused on how this product should be used, since I read a few reviews claiming this product is too lightweight and doesn't give them enough hydration as a moisturizer. B-5 is typically applied more like a serum, it should sink right into your skin to give it hydration and replenish water levels in your skin. This product is too lightweight (unless you have extremely oily skin) to be used exclusively as a moisturizer-- it works best for me layered underneath moisturizer. Layering your face products is a really effective practice and tends to give you better results.

review_text: I like this product and this line. If your skin is really dry it would be great for you. It actually does what it promises and does it well. If you already have an excellent moisturizer that hydrates well I don’t really see the need for this additional hydration and would rather use another serum (like one with vitamin C). I am an admitted product junkie who rotates between 25-30 things so maybe it would make a bigger difference on you because I already have a pretty well hydrated face.

review_text: This is a weird one because as far as hydrating serums go, it feels really different. It honestly doesn’t feel that hydrating when you apply it, I still feel the need for moisturizer immediately after. However when using it, I never have any dry patches or flakes. It may just be one of those products that works differently than you’d expect. I will say again though, it doesn’t feel incredibly hydrating on application.

Sometimes I'm not sure if I like it as I feel it makes it look like I have an oily shiny forehead but really its not oily, just shiny.  Love the twist top and container.  Since using this product I've gotten a bunch of compliments on how clear my complexion is. I believe it has helped fade my acne scars and uneven pigmentation and added a glow to my skin.

review_text: A must-have in your skin care routine. I have found it very helpful when applying Retinol as my skin is much calmer when I mix this in. I like having it on hand to add to moisturizers etc which helps makes your products last longer as a small pump of this helps a pea size amount of moisturizer or sreum go a long way. name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: Love this stuff. Many use it as a moisturizer itself and it’s good like that but not the best. After watching Dr.Dray’s review on it, I listened to her explain how this is a “humectant” essentially meaning you should use it with a moisturizer and not necessarily on it’s own in order for it to do what it is supposed to do. I don’t know why that is surprising even as this is a SERUM. Makes sense that it wouldn’t be used on its own. A bonus for me is that it has niacinamide in it as that keeps my skin nice and calm. Doesn’t leave a greasy film and feels very soothing. This serum is wonderful for boosting moisture. I have dry skin with acne and acne scars. Drunk Elephant products have really helped my skin. I fully recommend this serum!
ingredients: Coconut Alkanes, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Wheat Amino Acids, Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract, Berberis Vulgaris Root Extract, Citrullus Lanatus Fruit Extract, Lens Esculenta Fruit Extract, Pyrus Malus Fruit Extract, CocoCaprylate, Panthenol, Sodium PCA, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Niacinamide, Cyclodextrin, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sodium Lactate, Phenoxyethanol, Hydroxyproline, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Chlorphenesin, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I've used this in the past and have recently been trying it again. I am disappointed by it again. The recommended routine was this mixed with c firma, paired with the shaba under eye, and the umbra sheer. This wasn't enough moisturization for my skin in the harsh northeastern winters. I have had better luck with some other products from other skincare lines. I like this, but I don't love it. Its light, the pump is easy to use, and there isn't any piling or residue issues with makeup application. When I've used this in warmer weather, with higher humidity, it's been more enjoyable. Its just not for me during the winter.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text:
Let me first disclose, I have only been using this product for 2 weeks.

Every morning, I religiously mix 1 pump C-Firma with 1 pump B-Hydra and apply to my clean face, neck and décolleté. The first couple of days, I didn't see much of that "glow" everybody was talking about. After almost a week of use, my skin radiates from under my makeup! 

A little about my skin, I am combo in the summer and a little drier in the harsh winter months. So dewy, hydrated skin is very much welcomed! I feel my skin stays hydrated throughout the day, my makeup applies beautifully on top without any issues.  

I have not really detected any sort of scent, at least nothing too potent or bothersome.  I am curious to see how long this bottle will last me when I use it daily. I have not used this product alone, as it was instructed to mix with the Firma-C for best results.  I find these results have come from combining these two in the morning. This is more of a treatment so you still need to apply moisturizer on top. I personally, give it at least 10 minutes to absorb into the skin before I apply my makeup.  

Because it's only been a couple of weeks, I cannot comment yet on the long term results (therefore the 4 star review) since it takes about 6-8 weeks for you skin to adjust to new products. However, the short-term results, I have been very happy thus far!
ingredients: Coconut Alkanes, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Wheat Amino Acids, Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract, Berberis Vulgaris Root Extract, Citrullus Lanatus Fruit Extract, Lens Esculenta Fruit Extract, Pyrus Malus Fruit Extract, CocoCaprylate, Panthenol, Sodium PCA, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Niacinamide, Cyclodextrin, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sodium Lactate, Phenoxyethanol, Hydroxyproline, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Chlorphenesin, Ethylhexylglycerin

review_text: I am very happy with my usual hyaluronic acid product (Hada Labo) but I was very pleasantly surprised by this product. It has a nice thick consistency so it spreads easily but it doesn't feel heavy at all. It mixed very nicely with my moisturizer and didn't clog my pores. It's definitely on the pricier side but I love that you get a ton of product.

So it is good that its not a hydrating product alone. It hydrates and moisturizes. I really enjoyed this. It is pricey but I think it is worth the splurge due to its lovelty packaging and no nonsense ingredients. Would buy it in the future.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text:
Pros:
Silicone free! And “clean,” so it’s free of a lot of the bad stuff. 
Packaging is clever and luxurious
Great texture
Mixes well with vitamin C

Cons:
YOU CANT USE THIS AS A STAND-ALONE MOISTURIZER!
Price, considering that you need to add a moisturizer on top. 

Overall, I would not repurchase. I was previously using Neutrogena’s hydro boost HA fragrance free moisturizer, and I like it a lot. Even though it has silicone, it didn’t break me out or anything. This DE hyalyronic serum would be great for someone more concerned with ingredients lists, or who isn’t as concerned about price and wants something with cuter packaging.

review_text:
got this as a sample and decided to buy the full thing. 

i started using this in the morning because i've been breaking out a lot, and didn't want my skin to be over-dry with my usage of salicylic acid and benz. this stuff has prevented my skin from flaking, especially in the breakout areas, and hasn't broken me out further. i put it on in the morning after cleansing and before my CC cream. the cream i use (IT cosmetics) has a hydrating serum in it so i don't moisturize. maybe in the winter i will use a lotion between the serum and CC, but i dont need it during the summer.

my skin has been super soft because of it. four stars because it is a little expensive. i have not used it in conjunction with vitamin C serum, but feel confident that this won't break me out further and am willing to try that combo.

review_text: I quite like this serum.  At first I thought it was meant to be a moisturizer and i wasn't a fan... it didn't do much.  But once I started using it in conjunction with a moisturizer I was much more impressed.  I don't see this as a necessary step in my routine, but I do enjoy the extra boost of hydration when my skin is hurting from the cold or to a lighter moisturizer in the summer months.  This is a product from DE where I can see how much is left in the pump by twisting and pulling the top off.  The top is connected to the airless pump and the white bottom casing can come away.
