name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text:
Pros:
Silicone free! And “clean,” so it’s free of a lot of the bad stuff. 
Packaging is clever and luxurious
Great texture
Mixes well with vitamin C

Cons:
YOU CANT USE THIS AS A STAND-ALONE MOISTURIZER!
Price, considering that you need to add a moisturizer on top. 

Overall, I would not repurchase. I was previously using Neutrogena’s hydro boost HA fragrance free moisturizer, and I like it a lot. Even though it has silicone, it didn’t break me out or anything. This DE hyalyronic serum would be great for someone more concerned with ingredients lists, or who isn’t as concerned about price and wants something with cuter packaging.

review_text: This product is technically a hydration serum that is meant to be followed by a moisturizer, but since I have combo skin, I just use it as my moisturizer. If you have very very dry skin, you might need to take their advice and apply another product after this one. I like that this serum is fragrance free and that it did not make my skin oily. It also has great ingredients, particularly niacinamide. The only drawback this has is the steep price, but I would still repurchase it. I’ve actually gone through two bottles and will very likely buy another in the future when I’m done with the moisturizers I have.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I've been using the DE skincare line for almost a year now and only have good things to say, but I didn't incorporate B-Hydra into my routine until recently. I never really understood the purpose of this serum since I was using the Marula Oil, Protini and Lala Retro to hydrate, but I've definitely noticed a difference after starting to incorporate this into my routine. To me, it basically just makes your moisturizers work and absorb even better, so I use when I feel that my skin is extra dry (which, right now, is all the time because of this cold winter weather). Definitely worth the buy!

review_text: Not my favorite DE product. I’ve used this in conjunction with the C-Firma as recommended but it just doesn’t give me enough moisture. It feels so soft and smooth and dissolves very quickly, but my face feels very stiff within 2 min of applying. I do have relatively dry skin, so this might work better for oily or combo skin. I love DE so I feel it’s definitely worth a shot and seeing if this works for you, but I would purchase the trial size first!

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text:
I received this product as a free sample.
B-Hydra is a very hydrating Pro-vitamin B serum with ceramides that truly feels amazing to my skin.
The texture is very lightweight and it gets absorbed immediately after application. I truly feel like my skin is begging for it since it gets absorbed right away. I normally apply it at night time after I double cleanse and follow it with a moisturizer for extra hydration during dry/cold days, however I use it by itself most days since I have combination/oily skin and I don’t need to wear a moisturizer everyday.
I enjoy the fact that Drunk Elephant formulates their products free of parabens, essentials oils and fragrances. They are perfect for people with sensitive skin like myself. They are very safe for everyone!
B-Hydra is a product that I truly enjoy and I will continue to use. My skin just feel healthier and it seems more radiant, brighter and even after continuos use of this product. 
I wake up with plumped healthy looking skin every morning thanks to this product :) 
The packaging is as perfect and cool as all the other DE products. 
I would recommend Drunk Elephant B-Hydra for anyone looking for a serum to help replenish nutrients while delivering complete hydration for a young healthy looking skin.
ingredients: Coconut Alkanes, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Wheat Amino Acids, Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract, Berberis Vulgaris Root Extract, Citrullus Lanatus Fruit Extract, Lens Esculenta Fruit Extract, Pyrus Malus Fruit Extract, CocoCaprylate, Panthenol, Sodium PCA, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Niacinamide, Cyclodextrin, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sodium Lactate, Phenoxyethanol, Hydroxyproline, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Chlorphenesin, Ethylhexylglycerin

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I'm always telling whoever will listen: when it comes to your skin (and hair), there is a difference between hydration and conditioning. Some products condition the skin by only sitting on the outer surface. Others like the Drunk Elephant B-Hydra serum hydrate from within, and that's very important! So not only does this serum give your skin the true hydration it needs, but it has some wonderful ingredients included that leave my skin looking so healthy and like it's glowing from the inside.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I started using this a few weeks ago, and I can honestly see a difference in my skin'a hydration. I have combination oily/dry skin, and it can be difficult to find a good balance. This serum is my first step after cleansing morning and night, and it gives a nice boost to the products I layer on top (Caudalie radiance serum AM and DE TLC serum PM). When I'm lazy, I do a pump or two mixed in with my moisturizer, and it quenches my skin all day long. My skin is plump and radiant, even after a full day's wear of matte makeup. I stopped using it for a few days and noticed my skin went right back to its dull, tight, lifeless state immediately. This is a must have for me. I'll be buying it again and again. Picking up a back up very soon!
ingredients: Coconut Alkanes, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Wheat Amino Acids, Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract, Berberis Vulgaris Root Extract, Citrullus Lanatus Fruit Extract, Lens Esculenta Fruit Extract, Pyrus Malus Fruit Extract, CocoCaprylate, Panthenol, Sodium PCA, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Niacinamide, Cyclodextrin, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sodium Lactate, Phenoxyethanol, Hydroxyproline, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Chlorphenesin, Ethylhexylglycerin

It's really similar to clinique's moisture surge serum. It pairs well with the a passioni retinol from DE, too, and made it very smooth and non-irritating going on my skin.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I wish I had longer to test this product before having to review it. Have been using it for close to a month in conjunction with many other DE products and thayers toner and have only seen slight differences in the overall appearance of my skin. Perhaps this is because of abnormal eating and drinking (sugar and alcohol) around the holidays, I’m just not sure. I love the airtight twist top pump this gel serum comes in. I mix a pump of the bhydra with C-firma in the morning and with Framboos at night for added hydration. I’ve also used it with a drop of the marula oil on days I think my skin could do without the actives of the other serums - that’s quite soothing and calming. This product seems to be a good addition to my routine. We’ll see about repurchasing based on my longer term results.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I wanted to love this product. I definitely felt the hydration and noticed that my skin was plump throughout the day. UNFORTUNATELY, being acne prone, this product BROKE ME OUT. Cystic bumps around the side of my face, chin, and forehead. If you’re not acne prone, this is a great product to try. Just didn’t work for me.

name: B-Hydra™ Intensive Hydration Serum
review_text: I received this as a free sample, and have since purchased the full-sized product. It works really well for hydrating dry patches, I had some flaking skin and it was gone the next day once I used this serum. Also, because my skin is annoyingly super oily and patchy dry at the same time, I don’t like heavy-feeling moisturizers because it makes my pores feel clogged and I can’t wear them with makeup. This one almost instantly is absorbed into the skin, and while it may not feel as hydrating as a cream, it definitely does hydrate your skin the same (if not more) than a cream-based moisturizer. It’s also makeup-friendly. The packaging is cool too, love the twist top. My only con is the price, but I definitely will splurge on skincare that actually works.

name: Caffeine Solution 5% + EGCG
review_text:
This product is great! I feel like its definitely tightened and brightened my face along with taking away my dark spots!
I love to mix a few drops of this along with 2 Good sized drops of hyaluronic acid ( even  though your putting more drops of caffeine in your hand there should be more hyaluronic acid in your hand overall since the texture of the products drop out differently.) Lather this into your hands and slather it on a VERY damp face. 
Yes its amazing for the whole face not just the eyes!
I've used this product alone just under my eyes and that's a big NO. It was way to drying.
MIX AND APPLY ALL OVER.

review_text:
It was merely "OK". iDidn't do as much as other caffeine products did for my dark undereyes, HORRENDOUSLY uncomfortable texture for the area caffeine is usually intended for (sticky), however i'm giving it a few stars as, it does sink in somewhat quickly (i've had other stuff sink in the same area more quickly) and it's a good choice due to the very low price if you want to see how caffeine works for you. But, only 3 stars because other products with less caffeine have been more effective! Additionally, after a while it got this incredibly texturally gross buildup on the threading of the bottle (where you screw on the top).

You'll definitely want to look in to other products if you find this does anything for you.

name: Caffeine Solution 5% + EGCG
review_text: I don’t have a before photo and I regret not taking one but just trust me on this one.. I suffer from hereditary dark circles without puffiness. The medication that I take makes the blood vessels around my eyes dilate which makes them even worse and I get VERY little sleep. I’ve tried every cream/serum/solution on the market including high end brands and I’ve finally found my holy grail. It’s not perfect, but the difference is unreal. According to my research it’s not a long term solution but more of a temporary daily fix and I’m okay with that cause like I said I have struggled with this forever and it is hereditary. For this price and the results definitely give it a try. You’ll see a difference within 10 minutes although it will not last forever.

However, I bought it anyway because it didn't cost a lot of money and I was kind of depressed. And wow! I like this strange golden liquid. I have no idea how it works, but I now look a lot more human at a much earlier time in the day than I used to. Also, it does have some lactic acid in it, which I think is helping a lot since I don't usually out my high concentration of LA around my eyes. Also, have you see in it is like 5 dollars??? Like what do you have to lose??

Under eye filler may help, but caffeine is the key ingredient - so don’t be fooled by pricey products! Do your research! name: Caffeine Solution 5% + EGCG
review_text:
I'm almost completely finished with my bottle of this product after using it once a day for the past few months. Honestly? I can't say I've noticed any difference to the area surrounding my eyes. At the same time, I'm not the greatest at closely observing the effects of my skincare products — usually the results have to be very noticeable for me to register a difference. At best, though, this means that this product has had a subtle impact that I haven't appreciated. It definitely hasn't made a drastic change.

For that reason, I give it three stars. It's an easy-to-use serum sold at a very affordable price. From what I understand, there's also actual scientific evidence proving that topical application of caffeine can improve blood circulation in the immediate area it's placed, which can lead to improvement in dark circles. This is only a temporary effect, though, so you have to continue using it if dark circles are an issue you struggle with on a daily basis.

I can see myself repurchasing this in the future, but I'm not rushing out to get a new bottle either. I've actually purchased an eye gel by a different brand that I'll be starting after I'm through with this.
ingredients: Caffeine, Maltodextrin, Glycerin, Propanediol, Epigallocatechin Gallatyl Glucoside, Gallyl Glucoside, Hyaluronic Acid, Oxidized Glutathione, Melanin, Glycine Soja Seed Extract, Urea, Pentylene Glycol, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer6, Xanthan gum, Lactic Acid, Dehydroacetic Acid, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Propyl Gallate, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ethoxydiglycol, Benzyl Alcohol, 12Hexanediol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Caffeine Solution 5% + EGCG
review_text:
This stuff is amazing and the ordinary is making a believer out of me.  I’ve been using this for a little over a week and have seen drastic improvements in my puffy dark circles.  I’m Italian so I have the genetic factor, but Im also 39 and have been dealing w fine lines and wrinkles.  Some other reviewers noted that it wasn’t moisturizing.  Well, that’s cuz it’s not a moisturizer.  So you still something on top of this if you have dry skin, etc...Also, as some others mentioned it is fantastic for spot acne treatment.  Works wonders overnight for acne. I’ve been using twice a day under eyes and this is a 
keeper. Since buying this I’ve bought other ordinary products and I’m pretty sure they’ve won me over.

name: Caffeine Solution 5% + EGCG
review_text: After reading other reviews, I noticed something, everyone was complaining about dryness under the eyes. That's because their using waaaaay too much product. One to two drops is all you need for both eyes and they most likely don't really need this product. This is for people with chronic puffy under eye bags and dark circles. This serum is incredibly strong so if you misuse it either by using too much or using it when you don't need it, of course it will dry your skin out! That being said, I only use it every other day and have noticed a huge reduction is under eye darkness in less than a week of use.

name: Caffeine Solution 5% + EGCG
review_text: I added this eye product morning and evening to my regular eye cream (Algenist Firm am, First Aid Beauty Balm pm). A very little goes a very long way, which is great. Mind you, I am exhausted, but I do feel a slight lessening of my eye bags has occurred. However, at night it travels a little up - due to pillow movements I’m sure - which makes my eyelids a little itchy, and in the daytime it makes my concealer, (Nars, which I have been using for years without issue), suddenly settle into creases. I will continue to use at night to see if the itchiness improves but I will only use in the daytime on no make-up days. So I am 50-50 on recommending this product.
ingredients: Caffeine, Maltodextrin, Glycerin, Propanediol, Epigallocatechin Gallatyl Glucoside, Gallyl Glucoside, Hyaluronic Acid, Oxidized Glutathione, Melanin, Glycine Soja Seed Extract, Urea, Pentylene Glycol, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer6, Xanthan gum, Lactic Acid, Dehydroacetic Acid, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Propyl Gallate, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Ethoxydiglycol, Benzyl Alcohol, 12Hexanediol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Caffeine Solution 5% + EGCG
review_text: Woah, this is so f*ing effective. Like, woah. Puffiness all gone and skin lifted tremendously, right away. It did something about the darkness of the dark circles, too, which I hadn’t really counted on considering that my purple undereyes are such a consistent part of my face. It makes my face FEEL more awake, too, if that makes sense..? I hope the caffeine doesn’t end up keeping me awake (it didn’t after my first use yesterday, so that’s a good sign). The efficacy of this product is unnerving me a little bit right now, but I guess that’s a good thing.

Its magical I swear- I bought this during the original launch & the results just keep getting more impressive as time goes by. Dark circles are so hard to lighten and I cannot stand concealer under my eyes because it looks so unnatural. I use it morning and night and at night I use just a touch of Algenist Eye Balm over it. I’m so glad for The Ordinary, what geniuses. I’m excited to have the toner about to be delivered and am praying they soon come out with a micellar water. Don’t pass The Ordinary by guys!!!

review_text: Where the heck has this been my whole life?! Three days later my skin is so clear and even-toned that I went without foundation and concealer, which rarely happens. My sensitive skin has had no issues with it, and I love the way it is matte on my skin so when I sleep with it on at night my face doesn't stick to my pillow. I'm impressed with the results after just a few days so will continue to be a faithful user. It appears to be fading some freckles and sun spots too--is there anything this stuff can't do? I love it!

name: Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%
review_text: I'm giving this product five stars mostly for the price and because it works. It's not something that works well under makeup (it tends to peel up). So I'd advice using it at night. I bought this item because I suffer from cystic acne and sometimes my face looks a bit red. It's one of the only affordable azelaic acid options out there. I had the opportunity recently to put it on a cystic acne zit that was starting to swell up and made my face feel like I had just been stung by a bee. Within an hour the swelling went down....it was crazy!! I had also one other products on the zit, but one that I had used before and never seen such results from. I don't use this daily, but I will keep it in my cystic acne arsenal. I've heard that some derms are starting to perscribe Azelaic acid to cystic acne sufferers with some positive results so it makes sense that it worked!!!

name: Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%
review_text: This has noticeably reduced redness in my sensitive skin after about a week! I have combo skin with peri-oral dermatitis (type of rosacea). The area under my bottom lip and around my nose is quite red, which is noticeable on my fair skin, but this has made a dramatic difference. I’ve been using it every night. It doesn’t break me out, or irritate the dry skin around my mouth. Others say it pills but I haven’t experienced that, I put it on clean skin then top with The Ordinary’s Natural Moisturizing Factors (another miracle). And others complain about the silicones; ‘cones usually break me out but no problems here. Truly a miracle.

With the weird smell and lackluster results in mind, I do suggest trying it. It is a great priced product that might work for other people's skin.
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%
review_text: I purchased this product from Deciem before Sephora carried it and I love it. I also use a retinoid 3% by PTR and love that this product can be used in the same routine however on different days. For the days I'm not using the retinol the Azelaic acid zaps zits and sucks up sebum resulting in clearer skin with far less oil. I apply this at night and wake up with skin that doesn't look oily and feels very soft because the Azelaic acid exfoliates the skin. Fun fact: our skin naturally produces azelaic acid but some skin more than others. For acne sufferers like me, the boost in azelaic acid really seems to make a difference and even brightens the skin.
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%
review_text: I purchased this to help with mild acne and hyperpigmentation. I applied it for the first time tonight, and I had a totally bizarre, unexpected reaction to it. When I first applied it (approx a pea size amount), I noticed that it left a matte finish and almost instantly reduced some redness on my cheeks. Fast forward 30 mins, my face started to tingle... not sting or burn, but a strange tingle. 10 minutes later, the area around my mouth and nose had gone completely NUMB! My lips and and part of my gums were a numb as if they were numbed by a dentist. I rinsed with water, careful not to add any other potentially aggravating ingredients to the mix, and the numbness is finally just now subsiding a bit, 2.5 hours after I applied it. My skin is accustomed to strong products (regularly use acids in my skincare routine), and I have never in my life had a reaction like this to any product. I’m not sure if I am allergic to this product or if this is considered a normal side affect, but it’s terrifying! Since The Ordinary didn’t provide a disclaimer, I thought I should share my experience. All of that said, the product otherwise seems... good?

review_text:
My skin is noticeably more even and my acne has decreased is size and frequency. The lightweight cream formulation is actually quite moisturizing (for combo skin at least).
Beauty Hack: When used in conjunction with The Ordinary’s Granactive Retinoid; the texture of the product and overall results are  incredibly similar, even though the formulations and active ingredients are entirely different. Also, The Ordinary’s products are a fraction of the price!

name: Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA
review_text: I’ve been using this morning and evening for about a month and so far I have seen improvement in my dark spots, but it has not been as dramatic as I would like. I will continue to use it for at least another month and will update my review if the results become more dramatic. Some of the positives though are that it is not a big investment so it’s definitely worth the small amount of money to see if it works for you. I also have no trouble working it into my morning and evening skincare routines. It doesn’t cause any pilling or disrupt my makeup in any way. It also hasn’t caused any breakouts or aggravated my dry patches. So overall I’d say it’s worth a shot, and I’m hoping over the next month my results will get even better.
ingredients: AlphaArbutin, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer6, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Propanediol, PPG26Buteth26, PEG40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Lactic Acid, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA
review_text: It is unknown if alpha arbutin is safe during pregnancy so I wouldn't use it if pregnant or trying to conceive but otherwise this is the perfect product for dehydrated skin with acne "scars" and hyperpigmentation from acne lesion inflammation. It won't treat active acne but helps the pigment fade faster if you're prone to pinkish purple marks during the skin's healing process. The hyaluronic acid makes this formula comfortable and hydrating. No sting or burn on my sensitive skin. Perfect serum under moisturizer. I use sunscreen during the day with this product because no fading product will work successfully to fade the pigment if you aren't using sunscreen. Sunscreen prevents the very inflammation that causes acne and it prevents acne "scars" aka hyperpigmentation and therefore allows this product to work properly.
ingredients: AlphaArbutin, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer6, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Propanediol, PPG26Buteth26, PEG40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Lactic Acid, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA
review_text: This works! I get dark spots on my inner-thigh from little ingrown hairs caused by my thighs rubbing together. The lovely chub chafe or chub rub. The dark spots take forever (like months) to go away even after the ingrown hair is gone. This makes those dark spots (PIH or post-inflammation hyperpigmentation) go away in just a couple of days!!

My skin does look brighter and I believe my dark spots have faded (not sure if I should thank the niacinamide or this). I have not had any reactions to it. Between the two I definitely prefer the niacinamide one more (since I got that first, i found it did regulate my oiliness and also it is available in a bigger bottle which I prefer).

review_text: I was excited to add this to my skincare routine but unfortunately it didn't work well with my moisturizer. No matter how long I waited between steps, the two just didn't mesh. It made my moisturizer drag and not apply smoothly at all. I consulted with a Sephora staffer and they said it was likely because my moisturizer is oil free and all natural. For a couple of days I tried a different facial lotion and had no issues at all. This serum seems to work, but just be aware it doesn't mesh well with certain kinds of products.

name: Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA
review_text: I have been using this for a month now. I get Whiteheads all the time and pick them, leaving behind dark red spots that usually take at least a month to fade. This serum works amazing, it decreases those dark spots by 50% within 2-3 days of using it. It does not break me out and gives good hydration in the winter. Absolutely love this! Can’t beat the price too.

name: Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA
review_text:
This product has been great for lightening my post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation. It works over time, so I didn't see immediate results. I use this in the morning after Vitamin C and before applying a more occlusive moisturizer to seal in the hyaluronic acid. I use about four drops and spread it over my face and neck.
The first few times I used this, my skin felt a little damp (not to the touch, just a feeling on my face when I wrinkled my forehead). I got used to it pretty quickly but if you are sensitive to feeling slimy, this may not be the best AA formulation for you. I've grown to like this feeling! 
I also find that makeup applies more smoothly after using this product. It doesn't sting, itch, or burn, and doesn't pill up when other actives are layered on top.

review_text: okay so I’m a huge fan of The Ordinary products and I use majority of them. with that being said, I normally used to use their Hyaluronic acid + b5 serum every single day and would never used another serum. I loved it and still do. HOWEVER, when I came across Alpha Arbutin I was nothing but happy with the results. This stuff is absolutely amazing. I use it in the AM and PM. I love what it’s done to my skin. It’s helped scars, hyperpigmentation and the overall texture of my skin. I’ll use this forever and ever I swear.

name: Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA
review_text:
I have been using a bottle of this, on and off, for about 6 months and can honestly say that it does work to help improve the look of hyperpigmentation from breakouts.

The texture is a thick, liquid-gel like consistency, and while it applies a tiny bit sticky, the stickiness subsides as soon as skin absorbs it. I usually apply after toner and any acids, before moisturizing serums, moisturizer and face oil. It does not make makeup pill or anything (unlike a couple of other The Ordinary products).

With any skincare product, you do have to be patient. Time is the best thing for waiting for hyperpigmentation (for me the issue is post-breakout ones) but this product will help it along. If you can give the time it takes to use up the entire bottle (probably a few months with consistent AM and PM daily use) you will probably see results.

I also had an inflamed pore/papule that was lagging in healing, and applying this made a noticeable difference overnight. It wasn't all gone, but it at least improved somewhat. 

I think this is a decent product, can't be beat with the price. Give it a shot!
ingredients: AlphaArbutin, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer6, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Propanediol, PPG26Buteth26, PEG40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Lactic Acid, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA
review_text: I bought this to help reduce the hyperpigmentation and acne marks/scars on my face but all this did was hydrate my skin due to the hyaluronic acid. It felt nice to apply - it was a little runny but not too thin/thick, spreads evenly, dries quickly - but I would have liked to see more visible benefits to my skin like I had hoped for. If you are just looking for a hydrating serum, this is worth a shot for its price.

I struggled with acne earlier in my 20s and now that it’s under control I have some dark spots & uneven texture. This serum has been amazing in helping lighten my dark spots. For people saying it’s sticky - use less! I find that one pump covers my whole face, sometimes even less than a full pump. However I only use this at night so not sure about how this looks under makeup

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: I was on the fence about this Serum when I discovered Ole Henriksen & bought literally almost all of his products.  I bought the small $20 bottle just to try it out.  I wasn’t used to the consistency of the Serum.  I was used to serums being more cream like not watery.  I have been using it for 4-5 months & I have fallen in love!  I use it in the day with Ole’s sheer transformation moisturizer.  Both products together or either alone make the perfect smooth canvas for your make up.  Seriously, my make up has never looked this flawless.  It’s a watery serum that adsorbs instantly into skin.  I use 2 pumps & pat it on my face & neck & rub in.  You have to do it quickly bc this stuff absorbs FAST.  I let it soak in for 7-10 min then apply the Transform Sheer moisturizer.  Give it time to soak in!  Can’t stress this enough.  This serums makes my skin soft, smooth, tight & helps with acne scars.  I’m 36 with combo oily acne prone skin & this didn’t make me break out, which is a miracle.  None of Ole’s products make me break out or congest my pores - it’s amazing!

So I stopped using it. I then decided to use it sparingly as I didn’t want to throw it away. I used it again several weeks later for one night only and the next day I had three new pimples.  And they weren’t just red dots, they were full on pimples with white centers. Being dumb, I used it again last week with same results. Needless to say it went in the trash that next day. For reference I have combo skin that is super oily on my inner cheeks and nose but dry in my forehead and sides of my face. I had bad acne growing up but has cleared in the last ten years.

It helps even out uneven skin tone and keeps my skin looking bright and healthy. That being said, this product is a little pricey though the product lasts a long time if you only use a little everyday. I would recommend to anyone who wants a bit of fine tuning in their skin appearance, but i'm sure there is also a cheaper alternative that has similar effects.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: Provides plenty of hydration but no noticeable results on hyperpigmentation or brightening of the skin. The texture is like a very thin liquidy gel, and it feels nice and cool when applied. The serum absorbs quickly, but leaves a slight tacky feeling. The scent is refreshing and citrusy, but I can imagine that it might be a little too artificial or strong for some. My skin feels plump and hydrated, and looks dewy after using it. However, my skin coloration looks about the same, and my acne scars (old and new) have not faded much. I like how my skin feels after using it, which is why I gave it 4 stars, but I don’t think I will repurchase because I’m mainly looking for a vit C to help with hyperpigmentation.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: Wow, I’m shocked! I kinda hoped this wouldn’t work so I wouldn’t have to pay so much money, but I’ve had this for a couple days and my texture is practically gone! My skin is so glowy and radiant and I love this product! Definitely can’t wait to see the long term results of this product!

This product truly brightens and refreshes the skin, I’ll even wear this on no makeup days and it just gives a natural glow

name: Truth Serum®
review_text:
I really disliked this serum for two reasons: first of all, it irritated my skin quite a bit!! It also did absolutely nothing for my acne dark spots which generally tend to be decreased much faster by any other vitamin C serum that I have tried. My skin is generally very resilient and I've never experienced sensitivity with any active ingredient. 

second reason: the smell is sooo strong and awful, it smells just like vitamin C tablets, this is just my preference I hate that smell. However, the smell lingers for so long and it makes me wonder how much fragrance is in this product?? It's probably the Limonene, Linalool and/ or other fragrance that also created my irritation. Fragrance obviously has no benefit for your skin and I am usually not against fragrance in my skincare but with this product I feel like it has WAY TOOO MUCH! 

I generally finish up products even if I'm not a big fan of them just for the sake of not wasting them but I could not finish this product. This didn't work for me so I wouldn't recommend, specially if you have sensitive skin.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Truth Serum®
review_text:
This is the first vitamin c product I used and it is a good product overall. The first ingredients (Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate, Calcium Ascorbate, Sorbitol, Glycerin, Tocopheryl Acetate, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice) are all really good for skin. I did notice a generally positive effect in my skin from using it. 

However, it also has bitter orange extract, grapefruit extract, limonene, linalool and fragrance. These are all sensitizing ingredients that can create adverse effects and harm your skin over time.

I think this is a good product for young people with resilient skin or those that don't have any sensitivity concerns.

Also, pro tip --> to prevent the vitamin c from destabilizing and turning brown, remember to always close the pump and keep the bottle in the original box.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: I’ve spent months researching and speaking with others on a Vitamin C serum and I finally purchased this one with high hopes. 4 months and 2 bottles in, while I do feel like my skin’s elasticity and bounce are looking good I see no difference in the dullness and uneven texture of my skin. I am debating a longer trial or using a new product. The product does dry on the skin nicely, not too sticky, but like many other Vitamin C serums there is a smell associated with the product.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: It has a nice gel texture that absorbs than others serums and makes for convenient application in the morning. It has a Vitamin C derivative (SAP) in a large quantity, and a few other ingredients are good too - namely vitamin E, aloe, green tea extract, and hyaluronic acid. This gets stars knocked off though because it includes heavy fragrance and artificial color. Neither is needed for a good vitamin C serum.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: i recieved this for free. my skin was already in good condition when i first tried it from a new skincare product i was using but i used it everyday for weeks my skin did not have one bad day. I wasnt sure which one was keeping my skin clear. I forgot to use it a couple of days in a row after that and i started to wonder why my skin wasnt as clear i didnt realize that my skin was missing the truth serum. So i used the serum again that day and i immediately saw a difference my skin cleared up that day. it makes my skin feel clean and keeps it clear throught the day and it  isnt oily, it also smells really good. I have very oily skin and very sensitive i break out extremely easily and also some slight rosacea on my cheeks and this stuff somehow cancels out all of my problems. I will definitely be buying the full size once im done its worth it for me.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: I definitely didn't expect to like this product as much ad I do. I ordered the mini size being that i was hesitant but I'm so glad this exists. I wanted something to give my skin some glow back. And to feel like I wasn't drowning in full, irritated, dead skin. This serum is so lightweight but has a nice gel texture with decent viscosity. I really like the smell, and if spreads and sinks in effortlessly. After a few weeks I definitely see a difference in the appearance of my skin. Overall I feel much more confident not wearing makeup because my skin appears healthy and radiant, and dare I say even some of my redness has simmered down. A little bit goes a long way, so I think this has it's cost benefit ratio in order. Works fine with any moisturizer over it that I've used! And hasn't made me break out :)
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: I've been using this one consistently daily for a month now. It's just so-so? I haven't noticed a huge difference in my skin. A little brighter maybe? This leaves a greasy film on my face and hands after application. The feeling of this serum feels syrup-y and for some reason feels like I'm adding rubber chemicals and oils to my face, which doesn't really absorb very well either. I'm not sure how much vitamin C is in the Truth Serum, but I suppose it's a nice beginner's serum. I saw the new Banana Bright though and I'm interested to try it. I think that might be a higher percentage of vitamin C than the Truth Serum, and it's nice that they've added PHAs to it too. For a stronger vitamin C product I'm working on building my skin up for The Ordinary Vitamin C suspension 30%, but because of its strength it tingles a bit, so for now I need an intermediate vitamin C product between this and that.

Just put lemon on your face tbh.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text:
This is my first foray into a Vitamin C serum. I bought the mini because I wasn't sure if I would like it, but I will be repurchasing the largest size when I run out. I have hormonal acne-prone, combination skin with a few acne scars. I was hesitant to try this, as it wasn't specifically targeted for oily/acne problems, but I'm so glad I trusted the few reviews I saw from people struggling with the same problems as I do. 

This is my favorite part of my skincare routine. I use it twice a day, but I took off a star because (maybe it's just the mini version) but the pump is very erratic and the serum shoots out and sometimes even misses my hand (don't even ask, I don't understand either). You can't do a half pump, only a whole, so I sometimes have to use more than I wanted or needed. Keep that in mind if you try the mini; not sure if the regular size is the same.

It has noticeably brightened my skin after little over a week, and my skin feels more supple. It has already started working on my existing acne scars, and can be applied over existing zits without fear of making them worse or clogging more pores. 

I'm excited to find an anti-aging, brightening serum for oily/acne-prone skin, because I previously could only find ones for normal/dry skin.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: Someone got me this as a gift. I really wanted to like it, but it's really in the middle for me. I can't actually tell if it is doing much. I've been using it for about three months now and I have only noticed a slight difference in my skin. There are two things I actually hate about this product. The first is the smell, as with most vitamin c products, is very strong and acidic, almost like vinegar. My main issue, another common issue among high end vitamin c products, they add dye to it. I assume this is so customers don't realize that it oxidizes quickly (which it does, really really quickly). I will say it oxidizes a lot slower than the Drunk Elephant vitamin c serum, but it's still a little too quick for me. I'm glad this was a gift because I would have been mad at myself if I spent actual money on this.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text: I got a sample of this since im trying to find the right vitamin c for my skin. Im going more for anti aging than the brightening. First off i really like how it soaks into the skin. A lot of vitamin c serums take forever to soak in but this one was very fast. The smell reminded me of oranges which was nice. Also my skin just looked good when i used it. It wasnt drastic but it looked soft and plump. I was worried that it would be a cheap vitamin c that wouldnt work well but i actually like it a lot and may end up purchasing a full size bottle.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text:
This is very moisturizing and I do like it. It absorbs nicely, smells great, plays nicely with moisturizers, sunscreens, primers, and foundations.

But it didn’t do anything to improve my dark spots. I used it twice a day for 3 months while also reducing sun exposure and using SPF 30+ every day.

I’m going to keep looking for a serum with a higher concentration of vitamin C.

name: Truth Serum®
review_text:
This is my holy grail serum. My skin LOVES this product. It helps control my acne and fade PIH. I can definitely tell when I haven't been using it, as my skin starts breaking out again. 

Only potential con is that is can pill up under foundation if you use too much product, do not let it dry for quite some time, or apply foundation too vigorously. I've adapted to that, although I'm now using the gel creme over the serum and it seems to be helping that problem.

name: Clearly Corrective™ Dark Spot Solution
review_text: This product really helped fade post-acne breakout dark spots. I usually get dark spots any time I have breakouts, so I’ve tried some other products such as the sticker spots from Peace Out and Dr. Jart, Murad’s rapid age spot lightening treatment and the inviscar treatment, as well as this product. For me, this was my favorite overall product. I love the lightweight texture because it’s not thick, sticky or greasy. It sunk into my skin pretty quickly (and has this really nice gin and tonic scent to it) and I could use this both morning and night as a spot treatment. It helped fade my dark spots within a week, and after about a month I would say that it took away some dark spots completely and left other dark spots lighter and less apparent. I received a trial size so it only lasted about a month, but I still saw great results so if I needed to buy another treatment in the future, this would be my top pick!
ingredients: Cetearyl Isononanoate, Glycerin, Isononyl Isononanoate, Caprylic, Pentylene Glycol, Ppg3 Myristyl Ether, Ethylene, Butylene Glycol, Parfum, Phenoxyethanol, Propanediol, Tromethamine Silybum Marianum Seed Oil, Carbomer, Tocopheryl Acetate, Escin, Cheno Podium Quinoa Seed Extract, Ethylhexylglycerin, Squalane, Avena Sativa Kernel Extract, Theobroma Cacao Extract, Butylene, Leontopodium Alpinum Extract, Xanthan Gum, Persea Gratissima Oil Unsaponifiables, Caramel, Curcuma Longa Root Extract, Salicyloyl Phytosphingosine, Musa Sapientum Fruit Extract, Salicornia Herbacea Extract, Actinidia Chinensis Fruit Extract, Kalanchoe Pinnata Leaf Extract, Sodium Benzoate, Citric Acid, Myrothamnus Flabellifolia Leaf, Disodium Edta, Tocopherol, Lycium Barbarum Fruit Extract, Maltodextrin, Orthosiphon Stamineus Extract, Hedychium Coronarium Root Extract, Mangifera Indica Leaf Extract, PotassiumSorbate, Pentaerythrityl TetraDiTButyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate Jania Rubens Extract, Ascorbic Acid, Sodium Citrate, Engelhardtia Chrysolepis Leaf Extract, Ci 14700, Callicarpa Japonica Fruit Extract

name: Clearly Corrective™ Dark Spot Solution
review_text:
I do have mixed feelings about this product.
I used this every night for about three months (that's how long it took me to get through it). For the first month, I really didn't see a huge difference. Discouraged, I purchased and used other products that targeted dark spots as well, while still using this daily. In the second and third month, I noticed a tremendous difference. I don't know if this was a synergistic combination effect but still I'm sure it did help a little, I just don't know how much. Don't think I will be repurchasing.

name: Clearly Corrective™ Dark Spot Solution
review_text: This product is one that you HAVE to continuously use. If you don’t hear a physical exfoliants or a chemical exfoliate into your routine while using this this will not work. If you don’t use SPF at least 30+ this will not work. If you do not use a moisturizer that is made for dry skin this will not work. If you don’t take care of your skin and truly keep it hydrated and moisturized all the time this will not work. This product does work if you take all the precautions and use exactly what is recommended to you. If you use this and the clearly corrective brightening and smoothening moister treatment with The culture of the short deep moisture balm this will work. It does take eight months of using it morning and night and never forgetting SPF to have this work and your skin will transform the smell of it is very light very synthetic lavender. The texture of it is kind of like an essence or the type of liquid that comes with in sheet masks it’s a little GUI but it absorbs quickly.

name: The Treatment Lotion
review_text: So I caved and bought two La Mer products to see if the line is worth the hype: the treatment lotion and creme de la mer. Both products used together certainly gave me healthy-looking, radiant, hydrated skin. If I could only repurchase one, I would choose the treatment lotion. The effects are IMMEDIATE. My dry skin instantly feels quenched and soothed. I bought the smaller size for $95 and it's actually quite large and has lasted me a long time. A little goes a long way - just a couple drops onto my hand, rub it in, and pat it into my face. It feels so luxurious. THAT BEING SAID.... I will not be repurchasing. It is just way too expensive and still not worth it to me. I think a hyaluronic acid and a good facial oil is all I need. If this was half the price, I would go back to it.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text:
This product does exactly what it states, however it's just super overpriced. This mask isn't terrible, and didn't break me out. In fact in detoxed my skin, and firmed my skin as well. However, I just know products that are exactly the same and give me the same results for a fraction of the cost. Especially the laneige waterclay mask and the origins charcoal mask, is exactly the same.

Pros:
- Makes my skin feel fresh and detoxed
- Firms your skin after using
- Does make your skin feel different

Cons:
- Expensive
- Similar products I already own, for cheaper
- Very watery for a charcoal mask, easy to use too much

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: I think this is a decent mud mask. You can smell the charcoal distinctly when you open the jar. The formula is pretty thick and doesn’t spread really easily, so it is hard to get an even layer. However, once it is on, it is a fairly easy process — wait until dry and rinse off. The mask took around 5-7minutes to dry. Once dry, the mask changes to a lighter color and cracks if you move your face too much. After rinsing, my skin felt soft, but very tight. I have not had any new breakouts in the past couple of days, which is a good sign, but it did not clear or dry up the two spots I already have. I wish there was a small .5oz travel size so I could test a couple more times before making the commitment.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: Overall great mask to use for detoxing pores and mattifying skin. The clay sets and dries pretty quick, and when it does, your skin feels tight (as with any clay mask). There’s a subtle minty scent from the eucalyptus. Rinsing off the mask does require a bit of work (again, as with any clay mask), but it leaves your skin feeling really clean. My pores are tight and my skin is shine-feee. It does leave my skin a little dry, but nothing a little serum and moisturizer can’t fix. I did knock off a star because I always find chunks of dried clay pieces in the jar, which isn’t so pleasant when you’re trying to apply the mask evenly.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text:
I have sensitive combination skin, so me loving a mask means a lot. now I know this is expensive, but it is well worth it. This is way less drying than the amazonian clay mask, but just as, if not more effective. I makes sure to use this bad boy once a week at least and I leave it on for 30 min to an hour to really suck the gunk out of my pores. It won't remove large black heads, that is what pore strips are for, but it does soak out the sebaceous filaments (the grey dots on your T zone that are actually regular oil sitting in the pore doing their job of moisturizing your face). 
my pores are large on my nose, but mostly active just above the brows. I love using this mask to clear out my sebaceous filaments and preventing blackheads from forming.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: This mud mask is a well engineered product and seems to reap most all benefits. This mask has a pleasant scent, is charcoal colored, and has a gritty and chunky texture. I have acne prone and slightly sensitive skin and this product does not break me out, however, it does sting/ burn for a minute after application, it was a bit much but it’s not too much for my sightly sensitive skin. This sting/ burn might cause irritation if you have super sensitive skin tho. This product is a heavier mask with lots of nutrients in it therefore I would not recommend it for younger skin. I would recommend this for more mature and nonsensitive skin.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: Glamglow has mastered the art of branding in the age of Instagram. I first bought this when I saw others online using this and I read amazing reviews. I bought it and used it and can tell you it definitely worked. I don't have a lot of breakouts, I have more blackheads/whiteheads and a lot of bumps around my face. I love the smell of this and it feels great on my face, especially after either a long night out or a really long day at work. It does a great job of making you feel clean and making your face look brighter and clearer. I've bought this product three times now and I always keep it around incase of a bad breakout, because I slap that on, and then I'm usually pretty good.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: I was so excited to try a Glam Glow mask, I’m prone to breakouts so I went for the clearing treatment and it did not disappoint! My face felt clear and smooth, I saw some reduction in redness around acne spots and I overall enjoyed the mask. It didn’t do everything I wanted it to do, I still had new breakouts that weren’t helped and the price point is pretty high which set my expectations for it to be the holy grail of masks, which is why I only gave it 4 stars. I think with continued use it would really clear up my skin up a lot more, but I’d rather use a sephora clay mask for consistent use because the results were achieved more quickly and the price is way more affordable.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: Im pretty sure this would be amazing for people with oily skin, but I was recommended this product by a worker in hopes to clear up my skin. I used this during the winter, and I guess my skin was just too sensitive for this. When I washed it off my skin was dry and irritated. I wish I would have done a patch test before hand because this was not fun for me.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: I know it's pricy but this is the third tub I've bought. This is a magical fix-all for my combination skin. If I have breakouts, texture, large pores, you name it, this max gives me instant results. It's fast (15-20 minutes) and you can literally see it pulling the gunk out of your pores as it drys! I use this a few times a week and LOVE to follow it with the Too Cool For School hydrating egg cream sheet mask for clear, hydrated skin since this can be a little drying on its own. (Also, I tend to get 20-25 masks out of this so it's really only about $3 per mask!)

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: So i got this mask as part of the sephora birthday gift. i always wanted to try it because i’ve got acne prone skin but the price always seemed too high, it didn’t seem worth, but let me tell you, now that i’ve tried it, i am already running out to but the full size. i put this mask on my t-zone and my chin for about 15-20 minutes and as i was taking it off my skin immediately looked cleaner and my pores we’re nonexistent. i have oily mexican girl skin and i’ve got black heads galore on my nose and it literally vacuumed them out. i didn’t experience the redness like some reviews that i saw but i have pretty tough skin so i would recommend this to someone who has tougher skin like myself.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: One of my favorite masks hands down!! I always use this mask when I feel like my face is just feels gross from wearing makeup all week..I love how clean my face feels afterwards..it’s a pretty intense mask so I wouldn’t recommend putting it on daily. I used it once a week or once every 2 weeks depending on my skin.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: I was so impressed by this mask! I left it on for 35 minutes (15 minutes longer than recommended) and it completely erased the blackheads I had on my nose and chin! Some cystic acne on my cheek was still a little inflamed but dramatically reduced in size, especially the morning after. It dries really fast and it’s not the cheapest mask, but I would definitely repurchase the smaller size again. I can easily get 3+ uses out of it with a brush to control the amount used. Overall, 9/10 rating for me. -1 only because of the price point.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: Absolutely love this mask! It helped clear up my chin that just kept breaking out no matter what I did! It definitely helps clean my pores and minimizes them as well! It does sting a bit upon initial application but very quickly fades. I also quite like the liquorice smell. The only downside is the PRICE!!.... so crazy but unfortunately we will pay it because it’s so great.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: warning: do a patch test first to see if you can handle this, it IS potent. i started using this as a spot-treatment and then a blackhead treatment on my nose and finally i use it as a full face mask. as mentioned, it is potent so i avoid applying it to my forehead which is already dry as is. for added exfoliation, i use my foreo to wash the mask off. i make sure to apply some moisturizer after. personally, i ise this at night, remove with my foreo, and then apply the sunday riley luna sleeping oil and wake up with my skin feeling like a million bucks.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: I love this mask, and have had it in my regular rotation for years. I have combination oily skin and this does such a great job of clearing out all the gunk in my pores and reducing oiliness and breakouts. I was glad when they increased the size a year or two ago because it used to be quite expensive. There are so many masks of this type out there, but this one truly worked for me despite all the hype making it seem to good to be true. I always follow up this mask with something more hydrating like a sheet mask or sleeping mask to balance out the dryness. I typically use it once a week and that’s a good frequency for me, the 1.7 oz size lasts around 6 months for me.

The sample size was large enough for at least four applications, and I could see noticeable improvement in the condition of my skin.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: 4 Stars. 4 Stars simply because though this is a great clarifying mud mask, it may not be the best in that category for all skin types. I like using this but not more than once a week, or even better, used on affected areas only. This mask can dry out your skin so make sure you do your regular skincare routine and make sure you moisturize after you’ve washed it off. I find that applying it with a brush allows for more even application and makes the mess easier to clean up, whilst keeping you from putting your fingers in the pot as well!

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text:
I have been breaking out horribly lately (adult acne, amirite?), and this, paired with Sunday Riley's UFO Oil, have been a life saver! Ill put this mask on as a spot treatment for an hour or two (I know it says 15 minutes, but I like to dry those suckers out...I sometimes even sleep with it on), and then after I wash it off, I will put on the UFO Oil. When I wake up the next morning, all of the acne spots have healed or GREATLY diminished. 

I do have sensitive skin, and yes, this leaves my face a little red after I wash it off, but I use this at night, and the redness is gone by morning.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text:
I don’t usually like clay masks but this one didn’t dry out my face and it cleaned my face really well. I had a small sample and tried it by accident and was surprised by the results. 

However the eucalyptus and peppermint are a bit much, my face was burning for 5 mins .. and the price is pretty crazy for a clay based mask.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: I bought this once years ago and not sure why i didn’t repurchase until now! I love how you can see the gunk being pulled out of your skin. The blackheads on my nose and chin looked much smaller after taking the mask off! It is a little drying, so i would only use it on necessary areas. I’ve also used it as a spot treatment overnight on a cystic pimple on my jaw line and it definitely helped. Make sure you moisturize after washing off!

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text:
There’s several things that are must knows about this mask. 
1. It tingles while it’s drying and can be a little intense on the skin.
2. The mask is very thin and runny, it also has small clumps in it that feel like a little scrub. Since the consistency is so thin, it dries on surfaces within minutes, especially if it’s in a thin layer. 
3. It will be drying if left on for longer then 20 minutes. (I have combination skin)
The mask is very easy to apply,but for best application I’d recommend using a foundation brush to spread it evenly. As the mask dries you are able to see where your pores are, and the longer you leave it on the more you can see them because the mask continues to pull oil none-stop. When it’s completely done it’ll be a light gray with of course darker areas where the oil is being pulled from. While washing it off you can gradually add water to your skin and slowly rinse it off in a circular motion to get a great exfoliation. I saw instant results with pore visibility and skin clarity. Felt very fresh and smooth afterwards and I noticed my pores weren’t as visible throughout the day. Something I would like to touch on is that it’s going to brighten your skin due to the stimulation from the tingling, it’s not going to correct color pigmentation from sunspots or acne scaring.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: I have been buying this mask for years and don’t see it going leaving from my weekly routine anytime soon. I don’t get acne super often, but it does make even my worst breakouts almost complete disappear after only one use. I do get a slight tingling sensation the first minute or so after I apply it but it goes away pretty quick and has never really bothered me. End up with baby smooth skin every time!

I also refuse to use it on my upper lip or within 2 inches of my lower eye line.  But it does great things for my forehead and nose.

name: SUPERMUD® Charcoal Instant Treatment Mask
review_text: I’ve been struggling with cystic acne for most of my adult life, mostly on my chin. I tried lots of products, and nothing really worked. I finally broke down and tried this and it killed a lump I’d had on my chin for a whole month after just two uses. I would only recommend using this on your problem areas since it is so strong and you want the product to last as long as possible. Watching the mask dry and get dark where it’s extracting the gunk is also very satisfying lol

name: Retinol Anti-Aging Serum
review_text:
If you have used other serums before, this one is different as it has a yellow tint and is less translucent. This is the 2nd retinol serum I've tried and I don't find it overly strong or irritating, so it seems good for beginners (esp if you're easing into it). I do notice my skin gets a bit drier using this at night (as it should with retinol), so please moisturize well or use it after your moisturizer if your skin gets irritated. I don't see a huge difference in my fine lines but my skin feels smoother - all in all worth trying, esp for $10.

I saw some reviews saying it's tiny - FYI, 1 oz / 30 ml is standard for serums. Only cult favorite ones produce bigger in volumes
ingredients: Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Propanediol, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Dimethicone, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Caprylyl Glycol, Phospholipids, Caprylic, Squalane, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Glycine Soja Extract, Carbomer, Sodium Ascorbate, Tocopherol, Polysorbate 60, Tocopheryl Acetate, Glycolipids, Sodium Hydroxide, Disodium Edta, Hydroxypinacolone Retinoate, Retinol, Glycine Soja Sterol, Leuconostoc, Peg40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Hyaluronic Acid, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Retinol Anti-Aging Serum
review_text: I've been using this for about a month and I can see why it's so popular and always out of stock. It's non-irritating and non-drying, but still effective. I use this in conjunction with the Inkey Bakuchiol in the morning, with the Retinol at night daily. Before applying the Inkey Retinol I also use the Ordinary Niacinamide for a little extra hydration and other good benefits. In the morning, my skin feels so soft and smooth like a baby's butt. I keep wanting to touch it. The texture is slightly creamy but light. The smell is, let's say interesting, but not bothersome. I'm happy with what it's doing so far with my skin's texture. And for the price, I would definitely repurchase this once I finish the current one.
ingredients: Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Propanediol, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Dimethicone, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Caprylyl Glycol, Phospholipids, Caprylic, Squalane, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Glycine Soja Extract, Carbomer, Sodium Ascorbate, Tocopherol, Polysorbate 60, Tocopheryl Acetate, Glycolipids, Sodium Hydroxide, Disodium Edta, Hydroxypinacolone Retinoate, Retinol, Glycine Soja Sterol, Leuconostoc, Peg40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Hyaluronic Acid, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Retinol Anti-Aging Serum
review_text: This product is nice.  It goes on smoothly and sinks into the skin nicely without leaving a thick layer of residue on the skin.  My esthetician recommended a retinol cream as needed so receiving this complimentary from PinchMe for testing purposes was perfect!  I do enjoy that this is a "Clean At Sephora" product which is very attractive.  It helped a lot with dullness and enhancing radiance/brightness.  I would recommend to those looking for something of good quality and at a decent price.

name: Retinol Anti-Aging Serum
review_text: Amazing Retinol product, I used Sunday Riley A  Retinoid before and definitely consider this as a dupe for that; I think Sunday Riley one is much milder for sensitive skin, but you can't beat the price. Saying that, I also loved The Ordinary one in Winter/Spring time, but that one is in oil so might be too heavy for Summer. I personally won't use this serum directly on the skin cuz it is irritating, I have to layer it with a moisturizer, when it's settled, layer another moisturizer before I go to bed. Especially when you just start using Retinol product, use it once weekly see how it goes, then increase the use times if your face not mad about it. ;)

name: Lactic Acid 10% + HA
review_text:
If you have KP, that rough and bumpy chicken skin on your arms or legs (or really anywhere), you NEED this in your life. I’ve tried SO many KP specific products with little to no results. I bought this off of a review where a girl said she added some drops of this to her moisturizer, and it helped clear her KP.

IT FREAKING WORKS!!!

I add 4-5 drops mixed into my moisturizer for my arms, and a dropper full mixed in for my legs. It’s only been a week, and my KP is SO MUCH BETTER! 10/10 would recommend.
ingredients: Lactic Acid, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Potassium Citrate, Arginine, Triethanolamine, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Tasmannia Lanceolata Fruit, Acacia Senegal Gum, Xanthan Gum, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, PPG26Buteth26, Ethyl 2, 2Dimethylhydrocinnamal, PEG40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Ethylhexylglycerin, 12Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Lactic Acid 10% + HA
review_text: Can’t live without this product!!  I’m 37 with combo acne prone skin with congested pores & horrible texture on my forehead.  I was using Good Genes (for the lactic acid) but the silicones broke me out & the price wasn’t in my budget.  Save your money & buy this!  Works even better than GG.  My acne is under control, my skin is smooth & my pores are clear.  I only use this at night.  After cleansing & toning I put on YTTP Superberry Oil then this lactic acid then The Ordinary’s Rosehip Seed Oil & lock it all in with YTTP air whip moisturizer.  Seriously, YTTP Superberry Oil + Ordinary’s Lactic Acid = the same glow GG’s provides without the harmful ingredients.  Thank you so much to The Ordinary!

name: Lactic Acid 10% + HA
review_text:
I was hesitant about this at first because it definitely broke me out, particularly on my forehead. Because it had such good reviews, I did some research in order to be able to continue use. It turns out, my skin is definitely purging. I'm about a 2 weeks in, and things seemed to have calmed down now. What's weird is that when it did break me out, it seemed to happen almost immediately at night after application and then be fine by morning? Very strange. 

I find that this works best for me in the evening when combined with my night serum. I wake up with a smooth, glowy (for the most part...I have sensitive skin so probably not as miraculous as someone who doesn't) face. I can also see a difference in texture too. I'm hopeful this will continue to work for me!

name: Lactic Acid 10% + HA
review_text:
Impressive price point, and beautiful glass dropper bottle.

I will have this on my shelf forever. I tried a lotion sample recently that broke out my chin. In the evening I washed my face, dabbed The Ordinary lactic acid onto my skin, then applied my trusted calming moisturizer. I woke up to smooth skin with virtually no blemishes, reduced dark spots, and noticeably shrunken pores. It makes me feel like I have a little more control over my unpredictable skin!

You just have to be very careful in the sun for at least a week after using! Lots of sunscreen, and bring a hat- your skin will thank you!

Just try this stuff if it sounds right for you!!!

name: Lactic Acid 10% + HA
review_text: I was debating btw getting this one and the 5% one since I do have sensitive skin, but I went for this one since I am used to acids and I figured I’d use it on my body if it was too much. It’s not harsh at all!!! It’s amazing, I haven’t had break outs since I started using it, which is a miracle, especially during the time of the month. Doesn’t disturb my make up or other skincare products I put on top or underneath, doesn’t dry me out, need I say more? Run and buy it. So many overpriced aha acid skincare in my opinion do the exact same thing and their Ph are not correct, which makes my skin burn, this is perfect. Also, some lactic acid products smell bad, this has no smell, the liquidy texture is great. I use it every day or every other day, depending on what other products I use, but I could use it everyday. I can also use it right after using the glycolic toner, not too harsh at all. Another HG product.  Amazing Canadian brand!!!

name: Lactic Acid 10% + HA
review_text: I am used to heavier acids, but lactic is gem at keeping the need for those big guys away. The purging with this happens almost immediately on some white / blackheads. My chin acne doesn't flare but seems to calm if applied right.  However (on me) it has to be put on top of a moisturizer & still washed off within hours. More than a mild irritation, not in a refreshing "it's working" way. The ingredients may be all you need, I dig this brand just can't make the switch to this.

No lie, I loved my Good Genes, however I so much more love the way my skin looks with this duo! If you are not used to AHA start slowly and sparingly. Trying out other products from this brand.

review_text: Everything I've used from this brand so far has wowed me but this is my favorite! I use it maybe 3-4 times a week at night before my moisturizer and my hyper pigmentation has improved so much and the rest of my skin is glowing too. On nights where I use the ordinary AHA peeling mask I don't use this because i don't want to stress out my skin thats the only reason I don't use it every night. My skin is super sensitive and prone to scaring and dark marks and this has worked great for me.

name: Lactic Acid 10% + HA
review_text: Okay so I love this brand! Good stuff! I bought this product because I really want my skin to feel softer and less dry. Now for some reason my skin was diggin it. After a week of using this product my skin felt very reptile like. Not smooth and soft to the touch. My skin was very red and I would be sweating like crazy from my face even if wasn’t moving at all. I did however see the small tiny lines on my face diminish. I gave this product 4 stars because I love the brand and maybe it works on other people just fine but on me, not so great! Still a great brand tho!

Also, I find the liquid formulation with dropper dispenser annoying. However, given how ridiculously cheaper this product is, the results exceed expectations. It’s worth having a little patience to save that much money.

review_text: This product worked wonders to my skin! Even though it emphasizes as an anti-aging serum, it’s actually an all around serum for your skin. I have combination skin that’s dull, uneven skin tone with some sun damage. But after using this serum for a week, I can visibly see a noticeable improvement on my skin. name: Double Serum Complete Age Control Concentrate
review_text:
I've been using this product for many years now, on and off. I do notice a nice difference when I use this consistently (aka months)- my fine lines fade and my skin is just more soft/bouncy/hydrated. I actually do love this scent. One pump is enough to apply to my entire face and neck. I like to do the one pump in my hand, warm it up by rubbing my palms together, and then slowly pressing it onto my face. Sometimes a little pressure to move any congestion. Devine!! 

I really enjoy that it keeps the folks guessing on what my actual age is ;) Skin care is definitely a must and a worthwhile investment.

name: "Buffet" + Copper Peptides 1%
review_text: I’ve been using this for well over a year now and I’m here to tell you that you don’t need to pay a ton for a high quality serum. Take a chance and buy a bottle, use it all then make your own decision. I use this in the morning without any acid-containing products. It has a vinegar scent which will dissipate almost immediately upon application. It is blue but do not worry, it will not stain your skin. What it will do is improve the overall health of your skin. Don’t look for results right away, it takes time. Don’t use more than 2-3 drops because that will be a waste of product. This is a great serum for almost anyone. I’m 45 and it’s helped keep me looking my best- plump and clear skin and decreasing fine lines.

name: "Buffet" + Copper Peptides 1%
review_text: I've been on the market for a good peptide for a long time and have tried a bunch. I use it to layer with my retinol at night and vitamin C during the day because they play well with others. Peptides are easy to layer and stable to combine with others. There are not so many peptide products out there that's stable and well formulated for super sensitive skin like mine, so I was super excited when I see ordinary upgraded their "buffet" and "matrixyl", both of with I had and loved. I really like this, and I think it's nicer than the matrixyl. On the downside, it's a little texturized, and not so fast absorbing as some of my other peptide serums. I think it's a very nice formula, it's just the delivery I found to be a little less elegant, which I can over look because of the low price tag.

name: "Buffet" + Copper Peptides 1%
review_text: I bought seriously 10-13 of this brands serums to replace my previous arsenal of more expensive Sephora products. I really don’t get why they get such excellent reviews. I found them to absorb too fast onto my fingers and by the time I applied it I had used a lot more than expected. I’m 37 and have had cosmetic injections done so what’s left of my wrinkles are very slight so it’s hard to tell in that respect. I felt my skin looked worse from trying various mixes of these serums. It looked saggier, dryer, kind of grey not bright, and immediately started to LOSE more elasticity. I don’t think I’ll touch this brand again. Sorry to all of you who are ride or die for it but I’d you ever used the good stuff you’d notice a much bigger difference.

name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text: I began using Peace Out products when I was going through a horrible breakout after pregnancy. I contribute a lot of my clearer skin to their products. I love the Peace Out Pore Strips to treat bigger areas of the face, compared to their Acne Healing Dots. As always, I love that you can see the gunk pulled out of your pores. I don't care for the blackhead strips because I don't care for any nose strips. I wish they made a pack of just the Pore Strips. Even though their products are pricey, I always have a stash.

name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text: These worked better than expected.  I've used small hydrocolloid patches on my acne for a while now and it's worked really well at relieving my blemishes and I've been wanting to try larger patches over larger areas to remove even more gunk from clogged pores.  These did not disappoint!  They worked wonderfully at drawing all the deep down gunk from my pores to the surface like a vacuum, from there my facial brush and cleanser made short work of the now accessible dirt and sebum and when I was done my pores looked smaller and more clear than I've ever seen them in the areas where I applied the patches, no joke.  I'm definitely going to buy these again!

name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text:
Just so you know, this thing doesn't unclog a physical plug because the mechanism of these strips is that they emulsify oil and absorb it. In that regards I give it a shining 5/5. I work as a nurse and we use hydrocolloids for multiple reasons when dressing wounds or stabilizing external tubes/drains. These are stickier so they really stay well on the skin and they actually have grabbed a blackhead or two when I've pulled them off. 
I find that if I use these once to twice a week in conjunction with my glam glow facemask, my skin does really well. 

when using these I wash my face for the night, put on toner, and then put these bad guys wherever I get visible pores the most (forehead, nose, and below my cheekbones). I then follow the rest of my routine on exposed skin and sleep with the strips on. I find the longer the sit the better they work.

because hydrocolloids are meant for wounds, I love using these on broken skin for those pimples I couldn't keep my stupid mitts off of. it get the drainage out, helps remove the infection, and promotes healing. just remember to take it off an hour before makeup so a scan can form so you're not putting makeup in an open wound.

name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text: By FAR the best pore strips I've ever used. I usually only need/use them for my sebum plugs on and around my nose (gross I know) but they are AMAZING for anyone with oily skin. I love that it's gentle, you can actually see the absorption of all of the pore clogging oils and that it actually makes my pores look SMALLER afterward (as opposed to the rip out kind that actually enlarge...).

name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text: WOW. This product works better than advertised. It's the love child of nose strips and hydrocolloid patches, with added bonus of skincare. First it really sticks to your face, no need to worry it'll move or fall while you sleep. Then it pulls out all those pesky sebum filaments, deeply too, without any kind of trauma to the skin. The more oily areas will make the patch white, but even if it's not white it will be cleared, when you remove it you'll see the blackheads and filaments attached to the patch. The only downside is that the box was only good for two full face applications (nose, chin, cheeks, forehead). Like many people, I have a real problem with the pores on my cheeks. If they added 4 larger oval or round patches for the cheeks, it would be perfect.
