name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text: I was hoping this would be the sort of strip that just pulled everything out and leaves you with cleaned out pores. This got pretty darn close! It pulled out most of the smaller clogged pores on my nose and pulled the bigger stuff to the surface, making it SUPER easy to get out with just a little pressure. I wish you got more than just 4 per pack! (I've only used the blackhead strips, not the pore strips as of yet.) Still, love this!

name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text: Growing up with Bioré strips, this was not what I expected.  The strips are thick (like the acne dots - which are amazing), and it wasn’t entirely comfortable but I managed to wear one all night.  Instead of seeing gunk extracted “like a porcupine,” the strip had absorbed excess oil from all of my pores.  It resulted in hundreds of little bumps (think Michael B. Jordan’s torso in Black Panther, lol).  I wanted to see more dirt pulled out, but I haven’t had the usual noticeable blackheads for weeks since.  So they really make a difference.

name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text:
These strips seem a lot more effective than paper strips, though you wear them longer (4 to 6 hours). These strips are made of a hydrocolloid, which is a stretchy rubbery material that sucks pus out of your pores. Sounds gross, but it really works. 

I’ve used the smaller dots for individual breakouts, having a larger strip is less comfortable but seem more effective. I use the straight strip on my chin, since I break out there more than my forehead. The most noticeable breakouts are smoothed down and the strip shows white pus where they were.  Again, not a pleasant sight, but it definitely makes my skin feel better. 

I definitely think these strips are worth it, I’ve gotten used to having blackheads on my nose almost all the time. The nose strips eliminate those and even reduces the pores. It’s like a dream come true not to have blackheads on my nose!

name: Pore Treatment Strips
review_text: I like these pore strips! I get super oily and my pores get clogged so easily.  These worked great for me!  I was a little thrown off at first, I didn't realize that you have to leave them for several hours, unlike other faster versions.  I move a lot in my sleep, so some areas did pull up a little or loosened up, but overall they did a good job and stayed on.  I cut the larger forehead strips and I use them on my chin and cheeks too.

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: I have combo - dry/acne prone skin. I got a deluxe sample of this and used a pea sized amount every morning for a month. During the past month my skin has been breaking out. Might be a coincidence, but my skin has not been good while using this. I've not seen any lightening of my dark spots. It is a good moisturizing product I will say and it feels good on the skin, but I personally haven't seen any results.

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: I really enjoy using the product, but because of the price point it’s usually a “splurge” purchase. The smell is so luxurious, and the pump on the bottle is really nice. However, the biggest con to this product is how it applies. I struggle with managing to spread one pump over my entire face. It soaks in REALLY quick. So I have to speed to apply it everywhere. Like within 3 seconds of rubbing it in it disappears. It’s disappointing because since it’s so expensive, I hesitate to use more than one pump at a time. I suppose you could mix it in with a moisturizer. Even though it’s white- it doesn’t leave a cast. Definitely recommend this if you have purple area around your eyes like me. See the before and after pics!

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text:
Vitamin C serum/cream is tricky, but thaere are many good Vitmin C skincare products. I tried many, and I know a few good Vitamin C products, but this C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum stands out not only for the effectiveness but also for the texture and feel of the product. 

It looks beautiful on my skin by itself but also works great with most of the liquid foundations I have (Marc Jacobs, Fenty, tarte, Revlon, and M.A.C) .

When applied on my face, it has a little sticky, gummy, syrup like texture, which I liked. I think this texture helped a little to keep the makeup in place?

It is moisturizing, so for example, Korres Vitamin C Oil is very drying by itself and always has to be paid with additional moisturizing product. With C.E.O. Vitamin C serum, you can just wear this after washing face and wear makeup right after if you want to. 



PROS:
- Effective
- Delivers Vitamin C into a deeper layer of skin than water soluble Vitamin C
- Nice subtle sent
- Very Stable
- Skin looks pretty after application
- Works great with liquid foundation
- Doesn’t exaggerate wrinkles and pores after applying makeup (great for mature skin)
- Wonderful feel and texture

CON:
- Price (very expensive!)
ingredients: Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Squalane, PEG8 Beeswax, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Polyglyceryl6 Distearate, PPG12, Phenoxyethanol, Acetamidoethoxyethanol, Jojoba Esters, Sodium Acrylate, Glycine Soja Sterols, Tocopherol, Glycolic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sodium Phytate, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis Oil, Chlorphenesin, Cera Alba, Glycerin, Isosqualane, C30 Hydrocarbons, Saccharide Isomerate

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: Great for night time use, otherwise a little heavy for me to wear under makeup (I have oily skin). I have been using a sample I picked up with my points and even with the small bottle you get so many uses out of it. I’ve used it a few times and the next day my skin feels and looks smooth and clear! I suffer from acne scars as I had very bad skin when I was younger. I hope overtime to see a lot of reduction in the appearance of it, but as for making skin look great it does instantly.

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text:
Miracle in a bottle! This is a game changer for me. I don't say that lightly. I’m in my mid-30s and have combination (oily t-zone and dry patches) and very sensitive skin. I’m very careful on what I put on my skin and this does not irritate me. I also get hormonal breakouts every month during my menstrual cycle and stress breakouts. 

I’ve tried many high end “clean” products but nothing like Sunday Riley C.E.O. I use this with Tidal water cream also from Sunday Riley and together the results are amazing. I noticed a difference overnight. Dead skin was gently peeling off my face on the 2nd day. This really works on exfoliating your dead skin, unclogging your pores and revealing a brighter more even toned skin. I started using this during my menstrual cycle and it made a huge difference. My current breakouts dried out within 1-2 days. The tiny bumps (a lot of them) of blackhead/whiteheads all over my forehead

I stopped using it for a while and things went back to normal, but after 3 days back in my skincare routine my face was horribly dry. Huge bummer. Love the smell though--like fresh oranges.

This stuff is TERRIBLE! I used it for almost a week. I broke out so badly, even in places that I normally never have acne! And it took over a month for my skin to recover.

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text:
I am pretty disappointed in SR after reading the reports about them getting in trouble for having their employees write a bunch of fake “glowing” reviews and getting negative ones removed. I don’t think I can trust any reviews written before 2018. Most of their products are okay, not great. You are basically paying their high prices so they can advertise everywhere, not because the products are that amazing. The only products of theirs I really like is UFO

This Vitamin C serum is expensive, greasy and does not sink in, it’s more like a light oily moisturizer than a serum. I tried using it for a month because of all the great reviews (turns out half are fake), I didn’t notice any real positive effects and it doesn’t play well with a lot of other products. It does smell nice but that is not something that I care about in skin care products, I want results. I did give 2 stars because I do like their packaging, the pump keeps products fresh and sanitary.

I highly recommend Kehils or Dr. Gross if you want a great effective C serums. I am in no way affiliated with any company, just a rouge member who likes skin care and wants us all to write honest reviews for each other.
ingredients: Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Squalane, PEG8 Beeswax, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Polyglyceryl6 Distearate, PPG12, Phenoxyethanol, Acetamidoethoxyethanol, Jojoba Esters, Sodium Acrylate, Glycine Soja Sterols, Tocopherol, Glycolic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sodium Phytate, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis Oil, Chlorphenesin, Cera Alba, Glycerin, Isosqualane, C30 Hydrocarbons, Saccharide Isomerate

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: I’ve been trying this for a few months now and the only reason I didn’t review earlier was because I wasn’t sure wether my breakouts were cause by it or not. Either way, because I loved this product so much as it left my skin super soft I was stubborn and after a few uses my breakouts stopped. I can’t tell you wether or not it will work out the same for you if you’re prone to acne but I really do love this product and am planning to buy more when it runs out.

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: This C.E.O. Vitamin C Serum leaves my skin extremely sticky despite my many attempts to change every variable I could think of.  It says to apply 1-2 pumps, morning and night.  I can't use it in the morning because my hair gets stuck in this on my face all day long with this.  I tried to only use it at night a couple times a week, without any other products so that nothing else could possibly be contributing to the stickiness, but my hair gets stuck to my face all night long when I do use this.  I think this serum's consistency is like a lightweight lotion, not a liquid consistency.  I barely use 1/4 of a single pump for my entire face and neck and it still seems to just sit on top of my skin without absorbing.  I usually don't bother returning products but at $85, I'm definitely going to return this instead of just throwing out the entire bottle.
ingredients: Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Squalane, PEG8 Beeswax, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Polyglyceryl6 Distearate, PPG12, Phenoxyethanol, Acetamidoethoxyethanol, Jojoba Esters, Sodium Acrylate, Glycine Soja Sterols, Tocopherol, Glycolic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sodium Phytate, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis Oil, Chlorphenesin, Cera Alba, Glycerin, Isosqualane, C30 Hydrocarbons, Saccharide Isomerate

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: This serum as the best texture of any vitamin c aerum that I’ve tried, and I’ve tried a lot. I am surprised it’s not more popular since more vitamin serums are sightly oily. This is a lightweigt cream-fluid. It absorbed super fast. It’s a vitamin c derivative so it stays stable and the percentage is good too. People are really sleeping on this. Great formula. You should use vitamin c in the morning, but I used it at night after cleansing and before all other serums and moisturizers. Layering was easy and skin was nice and plump the next day. This is something to stock up on at Sephora’s next sale.
ingredients: Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Squalane, PEG8 Beeswax, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Polyglyceryl6 Distearate, PPG12, Phenoxyethanol, Acetamidoethoxyethanol, Jojoba Esters, Sodium Acrylate, Glycine Soja Sterols, Tocopherol, Glycolic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sodium Phytate, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis Oil, Chlorphenesin, Cera Alba, Glycerin, Isosqualane, C30 Hydrocarbons, Saccharide Isomerate

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: I’ve used quite a bit of different type of vitamin C over the years because my skin seems to react well to it. Out of all of them this one smoothed out the discoloration in my skin the fastest. I like using an essence first so I use less of the serum and I use an oil on top. Holy grail.

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: I truly hoped I wouldn’t love this product as it’s pricey, but after using Ole Henriksen Truth Serum for many months and being disappointed with the results(or lack thereof), I decided to try out some other Vitamin C treatments. I have very mild acne scarring, and occasional bouts of rosacea, so I needed something not only effective but gentle. After using samples of this for about a week, I was shocked at the results: scarring had visibly faded by about half, and other random complexion redness had all but disappeared. Coupled with the Sunday Riley C.E.O. Moisturizer, my skin has become brighter and more even. Also, the combo of the two works beautifully under my makeup, no pilling whatsoever (even with powders or high silicone primers). Definitely a new skincare routine staple.

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: I received this in a subscription box and was skeptical given that I was essentially receiving an $85 product less than half that amount. I have naturally tan skin and always found it difficult to fade my dark spots left behind from acne. I have tried MANY products before but nothing worked. Within a WEEK I saw them start to fade and my overall complexion evened out. This product is more of a cream texture which provides some hydration but it absorbs well like a serum which is excellent. I am going to repurchase this without hesitation. The price tag is a bit high but I do not mind investing in skincare, especially one that is so effective so quickly. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!

name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
review_text: I love this. My face is actually brighter after using this, and I've used a ton of vitamin C products in my life. My only trouble with this (notwithstanding the price point) is the consistency! It's much more a lightweight lotion than what I like to see in my serums. Layering a moisturizer   spf over this is a bit thick, and I don't feel comfortable using a photosensitive Vitamin c as a solo moisturizer. Sigh, perhaps this will just have to be a Winter-only staple. Also, the orange fragrance is definitely a bit of a burst when you apply it. It goes away, but with those with sensitive nose I'd stay away. Not sure why companies are so adamant on making their Vitamin C products smell like citrus.

review_text: Ok I was a little Leary about a small patch to help reduce the appearance of wrinkles but to my surprise I was very happy with them!! I put them on right before bed and took them off when I woke up. They didn’t bother me while I was sleeping and there wasn’t any discomfort. I will be buying these all the time!!

name: Microneedling Anti-Wrinkle Retinol Patches
review_text: I originally bought this to help with fine lines on my forehead.  I'm a pretty big fan of the Peace Out line (their serum, acne, and dark spot patches) so I was excited to try it out. I bought 2 packs in total and used this over a span of a few weeks.  I would notice a slight improvement the following morning after using it overnight, but that wouldn't last very long.  Maybe it takes several months of consistent use to notice a difference, but I think that for the money you would end up spending, there are more effective products out there.

I bet these would be particularly great of special events and/or for people prior to their wedding.

name: Microneedling Anti-Wrinkle Retinol Patches
review_text:
The patches do work, I’m 25 and thanks to both my parent’s genes I don’t have prominent wrinkles. I do have the usual small smile lines, the expression wrinkles on the forehead, & under-eye lines which are allll v normal and apart of being human. 

The first pack, I used two on my smile lines and I cut the third patch in half to use on my under eyes. That turned out to be a bad call because 1) the needles didn’t dissolve 2) I think they lost pressure under my eyes . The ones I placed on my smile lines definitely made my skin look fuller and more plump. 

Tonight I am using my last three by my nose and my forehead lines! I would definitely purchase this item now and then to maintain smooth looking skin.
ingredients: Sodium Hyaluronate, Cellulose Gum, Trehalose, Glycerin, Propanediol, Butylene Glycol, Caprylyl Glycol, 12Hexanediol, Adenosine, Madecassoside, Polysorbate 80, Ethylhexylglycerin, Heptasodium Hexacarboxymethyl Dipeptide12, Acetyl Octapeptide3, Carnosine, Acetyl Hexapeptide8, Palmitoyl Pentapeptide4, Biotinoyl Hexapeptide2 Amide, Ascorbic Acid, Melatonin, Retinol, Carbomer, Polysorbate20, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Water

name: Microneedling Anti-Wrinkle Retinol Patches
review_text: These strips are good. I noticed a subtle difference in the fine lines around and between my eyes. The hydration is great, but the effects don't last more than a day or two. Also, the micro needles definitely don't hurt, but I found them a bit annoying to wear while sleeping. It's a little pricey overall. There aren't a lot of strips per package.

name: Microneedling Anti-Wrinkle Retinol Patches
review_text: I think these wrinkle patches are pretty neat! I use micro needling on my face and these patches really got that aspect down.  I like that they came in pretty big size patches.  I am disappointed that the instructions say you need to use it for 2 weeks to see best results and the pack only comes with 6, enough for a week and a half if you only use one patch twice a week.  Because of this, I tried cutting them.  I cut it vertical for my 11 lines to make 2 patches and you can cut them horizontal for fine lines.  It works okay. Some times the cut side doesn't stay flat on the skin to fully absorb so I have to hold it down, but its not too bad and they still work.  Overall, I do really like them, and they helped slightly reduce my lines but well see more with time.  I wish they came with a full 2 weeks worth so you can get the full effect without having to buy 2 when you don't even know fully if it will work for you.
ingredients: Sodium Hyaluronate, Cellulose Gum, Trehalose, Glycerin, Propanediol, Butylene Glycol, Caprylyl Glycol, 12Hexanediol, Adenosine, Madecassoside, Polysorbate 80, Ethylhexylglycerin, Heptasodium Hexacarboxymethyl Dipeptide12, Acetyl Octapeptide3, Carnosine, Acetyl Hexapeptide8, Palmitoyl Pentapeptide4, Biotinoyl Hexapeptide2 Amide, Ascorbic Acid, Melatonin, Retinol, Carbomer, Polysorbate20, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Water

review_text: I feel a bit mixed about this product. I did notice a difference. But it may have just been from the sticker immobilizing that part of my face. However after using the stickers 3 times in one area there was more of an improvement. They are a bit expensive if you're using them all over your face. I decided to focus on one fine line/wrinkle that really stands out and that makes the price feel a lot more reasonable. I liked it enough to buy another box. So all in all I think it's worth the try if you have the extra money and aren't planning on using it all over your face. It also didn't cause any breakouts! So a big plus!

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: This is great! I wanted something highly effective for my skin as I’m reaching my 30’s and this is it. I‘ve tried a lot of other Tatcha creams and they didn’t really suit my skin concerns. I have oily-combo and hormonal acne skin that is starting to show fine lines and loss of firmness (yikes). I’ve already noticed instant brightening and a plumping effect from this serum. This is a more affordable version of those high end medical and designer serums and I love that Tatcha is cruelty free and “clean”. Two pumps cover my entire face and neck and it doesn’t leave any sticky residue or build up pieces like other serums do. It has a light citrus scent but it doesn’t linger or irritate my acne either. I’m loving the results already and I’ve only been using it for about two weeks so far. I can already see some minimization of my acne scars and fine lines. I highly recommend this product and all of the Violet-C line.
ingredients: BisGlyceryl Ascorbate, Saccharomyces, Propanediol, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Ascorbyl Tetraisopalmitate, Angelica Acutiloba Root Extract, Callicarpa Japonica Fruit Extract, Prunus Mume Fruit Extract, Crataegus Cuneata Fruit Extract, Pyrus Malus Fruit Extract, Citrus Paradisi Fruit Extract, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis Juice, Citrus Limon Juice, Citrus Aurantifolia Juice, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Scutellaria Baicalensis Root Extract, Artemisia Capillaris Flower Extract, Morus Alba Root Extract, Ziziphus Jujuba Fruit Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate, Lactic Acid, Sodium Citrate, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Disodium Edta, Ppg6Decyltetradeceth30, Ethylhexylglycerin, Phenoxyethanol Hadasei3

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: It's expensive but worth every penny. This is definitely in my top 3 most favorite facial products that I own. I have combination sensitive skin and this vitamin c serum makes my skin feel so good and hydrated. It smells amazing too! I get really bad acne scars, and not only is my face clearing up from years of acne scars. I notice I have not gotten any new acne scars since using this every night! A little for me goes a long way, this serum is light and I only use just a dot on my finger and that spreads to my entire face. I think some people might be using too much, you literally only need a dot of it. So yes it is expensive but if you are using correctly it should last you.

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: I've been using this product every night for two months now. I have combo oily skin and my main issue is my dark spots an uneven skin texture. I don’t have sensitive skin and I didn’t experience any dryness or sensitivity with using this serum. With Vit c and AHA, it takes at least a few weeks to a couple months of every day use to see results. You won’t see any within a few days or the first week. I will say that it has helped to even texture and make my dark spots smaller, but I don’t think I’d spend so much money on it again. There are plenty of other more affordable Vit c serums and products out there. Like all of tatcha’s other products though, it is so beautiful and sits pretty on my vanity.

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: Wow. I decided to splurge on this after reading all the raving reviews and have been incredibly disappointed. Although I have sensitive, breakout prone skin, it usually reacts really well to AHA’s so I did not think it would be a problem. Now I’m not sure if my skin is “purging” or what but my face has been consistently breaking out with both normal pimples and tiny bumps, especially on my forehead since I started using this about two weeks ago. Now I know some products make your skin purge but end up being great but I just can’t foresee that. My skin just doesn’t even feel healthy, it’s oily in places it’s usually not.and I cannot believe I spent $88 on this. It has almost perfect reviews on here so maybe for some people it works or since it’s such a new product maybe all the reviews are just people who were sent It for free. All I know is my skin hates it. For reference I have combination skin and hormonal acne and I usually use a glycolic acid toner to heal my acne.

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: The only reason I’m giving this four stars is because for an $88 product the packaging is very cheap. But other than that I love this product. I substituted this in the place of my obagi vitamin c serum to see if I would like it and I love it. I’ve been using it for about three weeks now and I started using my obagi during the day and use this one at night. My skin is so soft. Almost all my texture is gone. I have combo skin that is normally oily but during the winter gets very dry. This has not dried my skin out even more which I like. Would definitely recommend. Not sure if I would repurchase for the price though. I’m glad I received this product complimentary from influenster for testing purposes.

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: I am extremely happy with this serum. It's a bit pricy but would say that it is worth it. The serum absorbed very quickly into my skin, and I noticed after just a few uses that my skin was brighter and smoother. I have sensitive skin and did not experience any irritation or redness. I will be adding this serum to my daily routine! I received this product complimentary from Influenster

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: I have tried this several times in the past few weeks. First I just got a sample and I loved it. I would apply it at night after with the dewy skin cream and loved how my skin looked on the morning so I went and bought the full size. I really like the liquidy consistency of it and it doesn’t leave my skin tacky at all like other vitamin c serums I have tried. Plus, a little goes a long way. However, I usually take my showers at night and when I put it on after, my skin feels hot and gets red so I took off one star. I don’t really have sensitive skin and the Herbivore Emerald+CBD oil does help calm the redness/burning, but that’s something to consider. Otherwise, it is really nice! I would just try a sample first if you have more sensitive skin.
ingredients: BisGlyceryl Ascorbate, Saccharomyces, Propanediol, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Ascorbyl Tetraisopalmitate, Angelica Acutiloba Root Extract, Callicarpa Japonica Fruit Extract, Prunus Mume Fruit Extract, Crataegus Cuneata Fruit Extract, Pyrus Malus Fruit Extract, Citrus Paradisi Fruit Extract, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis Juice, Citrus Limon Juice, Citrus Aurantifolia Juice, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Scutellaria Baicalensis Root Extract, Artemisia Capillaris Flower Extract, Morus Alba Root Extract, Ziziphus Jujuba Fruit Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate, Lactic Acid, Sodium Citrate, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Disodium Edta, Ppg6Decyltetradeceth30, Ethylhexylglycerin, Phenoxyethanol Hadasei3

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: I received this product complimentary from Influenster. After using it for several days, I am really pleasantly surprised. I have sensitive combination skin that gets very dry with most toners and serums - NOT this one! It did not cause any dry spots or blackheads, which I usually see in my very dry (nose) and very oily (cheeks, forehead) areas after using a serum. Instead, I saw visible improvement in the tone and texture of my skin - it really does work to smooth out small blemishes and issues with skin texture! Overall, I would definitely recommend this to someone who has had issues with toners in the past - it is very gentle, subtle smelling, and best of all: WORKS.
ingredients: BisGlyceryl Ascorbate, Saccharomyces, Propanediol, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Ascorbyl Tetraisopalmitate, Angelica Acutiloba Root Extract, Callicarpa Japonica Fruit Extract, Prunus Mume Fruit Extract, Crataegus Cuneata Fruit Extract, Pyrus Malus Fruit Extract, Citrus Paradisi Fruit Extract, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis Juice, Citrus Limon Juice, Citrus Aurantifolia Juice, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Scutellaria Baicalensis Root Extract, Artemisia Capillaris Flower Extract, Morus Alba Root Extract, Ziziphus Jujuba Fruit Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate, Lactic Acid, Sodium Citrate, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Disodium Edta, Ppg6Decyltetradeceth30, Ethylhexylglycerin, Phenoxyethanol Hadasei3

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: This serum is super thin, so be careful when dispensing. Having said that, one pump is enough for my whole face! It lives up to its hype as far as keeping skin smooth and reducing the little bumps on my face. However, I don’t notice my skin being any brighter and I’ve been using it for a couple months now. Overall great product, it will last practically forever, so I’ll use it until it’s gone!

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text:
I was actually really surprised by how much I liked this serum!  I'm really lazy with skincare sometimes so I love that I can get the brightening benefits of a Vitamin C and an AHA in one serum!  I definitely noticed a visible difference when I remember to apply it regularly.  I apply it after an essence but before my moisturizer and it absorbs quickly.  Taking off one star for price, and also the pump on the packaging squirts out too much product at a time.  

I received this product for free for testing purposes from Influenster.

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: It’s great derivative vitamin c serum that also has 10% AHA exfoliants in it to help it combat even more texture in my skins I have noticed my hyperpigmentation has lightened up drastically. I can’t use the pure form of vitamin c which is l-ascorbic acid because my skin does not react to it well. The THD serum does exactly what it’s suppose to do and does not irritate my skin at all. I directly apply the serum on my face and then press it into my skin.

name: Violet-C Brightening Serum 20% Vitamin C + 10% AHA
review_text: I was using the OleHenriksen Truth Serum, and decided to try this by Tatcha, and I think it's the best decision I've made in 2019 lol. This serum gives your skin the most beautiful glow, and such a smooth canvas. I have noticed my acne scars diminishing and I've only been using this for two weeks. I have some hyperpigmentation around my mouth, and I've already noticed it vanishing. I use two-three pumps because I have a larger face, but I think the average face would only need two. It smells great, feels beautiful while putting it on the face, and absorbs very quickly for a Vitamin C product. I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend this!!

review_text: I actually bought this w my money. Didn’t get it for free or through Influenster. I love Tatcha...But for $88 and for the amount and feel of the product...the ingredient list I didn’t feel like it was worth the price tag. I got a sample of this before I bought it and it came open while sitting on the shelf. I got home and i thought someone had knocked it over bc it was full but when I saw it it was almost gone. The water in it had evaporated just left the oils. For a good bit of this is just water. Thats why it’s in a metal container...to keep the water from evaporating. It just didnt sit well w me so I exchanged it for something I’ve used completely and enjoyed.

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: Nice affordable hyaluronic serum. It doesn’t feel sticky and it absorbs nicely.
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: This is a really great hyaluronic acid serum! It’s tiny and perfect for traveling! The ingredients are great and safe for the skin. If you are new to HA, this is a great start. It’s hydrating and does have a stickiness to it. As someone who is well acquainted to HA, I however would not call this my favorite, but I do enjoy this product. I would say this is a nice middle of the road option. It’s thick but not heavy. It’s hydrating and nice to use. I’ve used less hydrating serums and I’ve used WAY better (mostly in the Korean skincare realm). If you have super dry skin, I don’t know if this will be enough. It’s nice for layering and good for the 7 skin method, if that’s something you do. If you’re oily, I think you would like this as your hydrator/moisturizer step because it won’t make you greasy whatsoever. Great for daytime and under makeup- no pilling. Overall an awesome affordable product!
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: I was excited to try this product after trying the one from The Ordinary since I was new to hyaluronic acid and wanted to test different products. I was unimpressed by this because it didn’t make any difference in my skin (feel or look) vs the ordinary which seemed to transform my skin. That said, the one huge positive for this is that it doesn’t pill under makeup at all. Once you put moisturizer on, there’s not residue or trace of the product. It really depends on what you’re looking for but my skin is dry but overproduces oil to compensate because it doesn’t get sufficient hydration. That’s why I was looking for hyaluronic acid but it’s not suitable for my skin; however, for someone with normal or oily skin, this could probably work fine.
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: This one is okay. I mean the package itself is so tiny, it’s smaller than The Ordinary bottles. It didn’t do much for my skin but I still use it, maybe it does hydrate it a little bit. It didn’t give me the hydration I wanted, I ordered The Ordinary Marine Hyaluronic instead.
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: There’s a lot of buzz about this serum in esthetician community. I wanted to love it. The price was great so I decided to try it out. I don’t feel like it hydrates well. I’ve been using it for a few days and I’m not noticing any difference. Also, I knew the bottle was going to be small, but I took the lid off to peek and it wasn’t even all the way full. I’ll be going back to the Murad sensitive skin soothing serum even though it’s like 7 times the price.
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: This doesn’t drastically change my skin. But it adds the extra hydration I need in my skin care routine. I have sensitive, dry but acne prone skin; so heavy moisturizers and oils break me out. Layering this under my moisturizer hydrates my skin more versus my moisturizer alone. The bottle is small, and I would say it comes out quickly so it’s easy to use too much. But I’ve been using this once in the morning and once at night for over a month now and I still have plenty of product left. I would compare this to DE’s B-hydra in the fact it does it’s job by hydrating the skin. I do wish it had the same container though, I love DE for that, I just prefer the cost of this guy :)
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: I bought this one hoping it would be similar to the Hyaluronic serum from The Ordinary which is in the same price category. It has the same light texture and it wears well underneath other products including makeup. I am not sure if I am noticing any difference when using it or not, and I think the one from The Ordinary “plumps” up the skin a bit more. It does feel nice on the skin, but I wish it was a little more hydrating.
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: this has helped my skin soooo much, it’s so soft now and it looks great in the morning, super fresh, my skin absorbs it quick and i use a moisturizer after it. don’t have that much acne anymore, i did receive this as a sample from Influenster but my opinion is unbiased
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: I love a good hyaluronic acid serum! I received this complimentary through influenster but it’s very light weight and hydrating! Perfect for summer weather.
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: The Inkey List Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum beyond impressed me. My skin was feeling dry and dull and I have been looking for that something extra this winter that would help with hydration and with fine lines. Thankfully this came into my life because it has hydrated and plumped my skin. I saw results in just two days and after two weeks I had a reduction of fine lines and wrinkles. I followed this serum with moisturizer and I never looked back. The price point is beyond impressive! My only negative is the packaging is odd and can cause you to use too much but you get used to it after a few uses so its not a deal breaker.
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: Hyaluronic acid is used to moisturize the skin, combining with other skincare products. One drop of a clear liquid is applied to the cleaned problem areas and after soaking, you can apply day/night cream on top. When I apply more, I noticed that the liquid is not absorbed immediately, after 5-10 minutes, but the result is visible and the skin feels refreshed, gives a light lifting effect, when applied in sufficient quantity, moisturizes the skin. Now  I can't imagine my skincare routine without Hyaluronic Acid. Love
ingredients: Propanediol, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate, Leuconostoc, Hyaluronic Acid, Carbomer, Polysorbate 20, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Phenoxyethanol

name: Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Serum
review_text: I have acne prone sensitive skin that gets flaky in the winter. I used this with no breakouts. It’s not greasy and absorbs into the skin nicely. By no means a miracle product but does nice light moisture. I use at night I’m not sure this would be good underneath foundation thou. I think for the price it’s worth a try. I got this free and was glad to try the line prob would not have thought to even buy this but I would consider this line for other skin care items

name: Acne Solutions™ Clinical Clearing Gel
review_text:
Overall: there are better acne fighting products on the market but this one will help a bit
Pros: didn’t make me breakout, somewhat reduced inflammation of acne / rash on chin, didn’t burn on skin, easy application, no smell
Cons: very drying, didn’t do enough to clear acne, skin tone was very dull compared to other similar products
ingredients: Alcohol Denat, Acrylates, Hamamelis Virginiana, Laminaria Saccharina Extract, Sea Whip Extract, Butylene Glycol, Benzalkonium Chloride

name: Acne Solutions™ Clinical Clearing Gel
review_text: I really love this product, been using it for years. If your a “pimple-popper” like me but suffer from acne-scarring/hyperpigmentation afterwards, this is a Godsend! I apply it nightly (on breakouts only) and in 2-3 days no more pimple! You won’t regret buying it.
ingredients: Alcohol Denat, Acrylates, Hamamelis Virginiana, Laminaria Saccharina Extract, Sea Whip Extract, Butylene Glycol, Benzalkonium Chloride

name: Acne Solutions™ Clinical Clearing Gel
review_text: I was not at all impressed with this. I had been using it for almost 3 months (every other night) and my skin was breaking out MORE. I looked up the ingredients (not the smartest move looking them up after I’d been using the product instead of before buying it), and the first ingredient is an alcohol that is regarded as “bad” by most of the skincare community. Bad alcohols can be very irritating and worsen acne. I was thankful to figure out why I’d been breaking out more but still annoyed.
ingredients: Alcohol Denat, Acrylates, Hamamelis Virginiana, Laminaria Saccharina Extract, Sea Whip Extract, Butylene Glycol, Benzalkonium Chloride

name: Acne Solutions™ Clinical Clearing Gel
review_text: I've used this for a few weeks now and I like it. I do feel like it is effective, although it's definitely not a miracle worker. I like that a little bit of this goes a long way--the bottle is small but I think it will last a long time.
ingredients: Alcohol Denat, Acrylates, Hamamelis Virginiana, Laminaria Saccharina Extract, Sea Whip Extract, Butylene Glycol, Benzalkonium Chloride

name: Acne Solutions™ Clinical Clearing Gel
review_text: I used just as a spot treatment and I wasn't a fan. It's very very itchy when it gets on your skin and it makes it peel pretty bad. Also I saw maybe the slightest reduction in my pimple, not by much by any means.
ingredients: Alcohol Denat, Acrylates, Hamamelis Virginiana, Laminaria Saccharina Extract, Sea Whip Extract, Butylene Glycol, Benzalkonium Chloride

name: Acne Solutions™ Clinical Clearing Gel
review_text:
This is hands down my go-to product when it comes to my hormonal acne....

Product description:
This ultra-powerful daily treatment gel is powered by Clinique’s four-in-one clearing complex with salicylic acid to start clearing blemishes instantly and help prevent new ones from forming. You can make visibly clearer skin a way of life. This product is allergy tested, non-acnegenic, and free of oil and fragrance. 

I can say that this Acne Gel lives up to its claims 100%!!!!!!!! This is an AMAZING spot treatment that is ALWAYS in my cabinet because it works so well! It’s the most effective acne treatment I’ve ever used, oftentimes making my pimples go away overnight... The gel is a pretty thin consistency, dries quickly, and doesn’t make your skin flaky. You only need a little bit, and I do recommend moisturizing afterwards because the ingredients can be a tad drying. One bottle lasts me a very long time, so it’s an amazing value on top of how wonderful it is! 

5 / 5 stars, DEFINITELY recommend!
ingredients: Alcohol Denat, Acrylates, Hamamelis Virginiana, Laminaria Saccharina Extract, Sea Whip Extract, Butylene Glycol, Benzalkonium Chloride

name: Acne Solutions™ Clinical Clearing Gel
review_text: This is the only thing that works for me. If I am having a really bad time, I put it all over my face. If I just need it on one spot, then I do that. It works literally within a couple of hours.  My skin is very sensitive and this does not irritate it.
ingredients: Alcohol Denat, Acrylates, Hamamelis Virginiana, Laminaria Saccharina Extract, Sea Whip Extract, Butylene Glycol, Benzalkonium Chloride

name: Acne Solutions™ Clinical Clearing Gel
review_text: I have been using this for a few years & there’s not much more to say than IT WORKS!  You will NOT regret this purchase.  Lasts a long time; you just need a drop.  It will make the area around the pimple very dry & skin will peel around it but I use Tarte’s maracuja oil to solve that beautifully.  Once the pimple is dried out, use your favorite facial oil & just dab the area for a few days.  Helps with scarring too.  The min you see or feel a pimple coming on put this clearing gel on immediately & it will be gone in a flash.  It’s a life saver for out of control hormonal acne.
ingredients: Alcohol Denat, Acrylates, Hamamelis Virginiana, Laminaria Saccharina Extract, Sea Whip Extract, Butylene Glycol, Benzalkonium Chloride

name: Strawberry-C Brightening Serum
review_text: I wanted to love this, the bottle is pretty, the ingredients listed are clean. but overall, it just didn't do anything. I could not see any improvement in my skin after using for several weeks. I did end up returning it. Also it leaves a tacky feeling, and smells like lettuce, not strawberries. I would have been ok with all that, if the product had made my skin look and/or feel better.
ingredients: Water, Squalane, Glycerin, Propanediol, Plukenetia Volubilis Seed Oil, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Bakuchiol, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Caproyl Prolinate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Polysorbate 60, Phytic Acid, Glyceryl Polyacrylate, Sorbitan Isostearate, Tocopherol

name: Strawberry-C Brightening Serum
review_text: An essential part of my nighttime skincare routine. I use this with my Estée Lauder advanced night serum, and it’s magic. Skin is super hydrated, bright, glowing, soft, plump in the morning. I feel a significant difference in texture from when I don’t use it. My face just feels smoother and looks healthier. It’s also helps calm any irritation and redness. Will keep purchasing this until forever.
ingredients: Water, Squalane, Glycerin, Propanediol, Plukenetia Volubilis Seed Oil, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Bakuchiol, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Caproyl Prolinate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Polysorbate 60, Phytic Acid, Glyceryl Polyacrylate, Sorbitan Isostearate, Tocopherol

name: Strawberry-C Brightening Serum
review_text: I’ve been taking a medication to help w my adult-onset acne for almost two years and while it’s been great, about a year ago my four year old cousin drew a picture of me with red dots all over my face (thank u acne hyperpigmentation). I was tired of waiting and trying to cover up with makeup so I spent tons looking for the right serum/treatment/anything to even my skin tone. Enter this product. Better results in a month than I saw in a YEAR with other products claiming to combat hyperpigmentation and I get compliments on my makeup-free skin daily. The formula is a bit tacky, and idk how much it really hydrates, but I follow w moisturizer and SUNSCREEN (an absolute must, I use the one from volition) and am totally happy w the way it layers.

name: Strawberry-C Brightening Serum
review_text: Tried this on a whim and I'm thrilled with this purchase. The serum itself is thick but incredibly lightweight. It gives my skins an amazing glow and hydration that lasts. I bought this especially for my uneven skin tone and this does seem to have helped; nothing crazy but I've only been using for about 2 weeks. A pea-sized amount truly covers my entire face, neck, and chest, as well as a little leftover for my hands. My biggest problem is that the serum is so thick in the bottle that it's hard to get any up into the little dropper, luckily you only need a little. Definitely recommend and love this!

name: Strawberry-C Brightening Serum
review_text: I received a mini sized sample of this serum and have been testing it out for a little over a week now. This is a lovely serum with a light consistency. It's fragrance-free and applies so smoothly onto the skin. Once applied, I find it to be super hydrating and soothing and a little bit of product definitely goes a long way. Overall, I'm very pleased with this serum and would recommend it to others looking for a Vitamin C product!
ingredients: Water, Squalane, Glycerin, Propanediol, Plukenetia Volubilis Seed Oil, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Bakuchiol, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Caproyl Prolinate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Polysorbate 60, Phytic Acid, Glyceryl Polyacrylate, Sorbitan Isostearate, Tocopherol

name: Strawberry-C Brightening Serum
review_text:
What an impressive serum!
Light liquid gel texture.
Very subtle strawberry scent coming from the strawberry seed and not from added fragrance.
Seems to keep my skin clear of breakouts while being hydrating enough for my normal-dry skin.
My skin is radiant and glowing.
For now my skin is brighter but I don’t necessarily see my sun spots disappear. That takes time and consistency but I think it has great potential and I am really loving this!
My skin is also sensitive and this is gentle enough!
I recommend this without doubt!
ingredients: Water, Squalane, Glycerin, Propanediol, Plukenetia Volubilis Seed Oil, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Bakuchiol, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Caproyl Prolinate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Polysorbate 60, Phytic Acid, Glyceryl Polyacrylate, Sorbitan Isostearate, Tocopherol

name: Strawberry-C Brightening Serum
review_text: Awful. It breaks me out. And I do not feel like it is doing anything aside from that for my skin. Disappointed

name: Strawberry-C Brightening Serum
review_text: I love strawberry and had wanted to try this serum from the moment I first saw it online. Strawberries are a very strong and under-used source of Vitamin C! The ingredient list alone makes my love this product; aside from the antioxidant and brightening Vitamin C, it also includes hyaluronic acid and water which are a powerhouse combination on their own! This serum has no fragrance and absorbs beautifully, while leaving my skin extra soft. I would definitely recommend!
ingredients: Water, Squalane, Glycerin, Propanediol, Plukenetia Volubilis Seed Oil, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Bakuchiol, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Caproyl Prolinate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Polysorbate 60, Phytic Acid, Glyceryl Polyacrylate, Sorbitan Isostearate, Tocopherol

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I tend to break out a lot before my period and these lightening dots are great to help reduce the dark spots left behind. The microneedling treatments are not painful and ideal for overnight usage.
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I think I have fairly nice skin and with my skincare routine I’m able to lighten most of my acne scars. From time to time I do get stubborn scars and pigmentation that won’t go away as quickly... so when I saw I could review these I hopped on! I’ve used the patches twice and I did notice the scars look lighter but they are still definitely there. For the price I’d rather wait it out and use my serums to do their job

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: Not effective at lightening a scar left after a pimple. In fact, it only left a visible light circle around the scar but no change to the scar itself. Not worth the price for only 12 dots.

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I hace been using these and my dark spots are MUCH lighter! First, lemme say, my 2 dark spots I've been working on have been there for 3-4 yrs and were caused my acne, not aging. Also, I have used a patch on each spot 8 times so far. The one that showed up about 3 yrs ago is mcuh better and the one that's about 4 yrs old is taking a bit longer, but they're SO much lighter now that I can cover them completely with make up. I know the lighting is different in these 2 pics, but the spots WERE in fact as dark as they look, and now they're barely noticable! I don't have any age spots to try them on, but if you have dark spots from acne scars, you NEED to try these! Also, there was another spot on the right side of my face that I didn't take a pic of, but it was only a yr old, and after using 3-4 dots, it's totally gone. I just bought my 3rd pack of these and I'm going to continue using them until the spots are totally gone. Stick with them and give them a chance, cuz they really help!
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I have so many dark spots from previous acne scars and they can really lower your confidence. I'm so glad I tried this product. Over time, the discoloration from dark spots fade by applying these patches. I love the final result.

review_text: Absolutely amazed by this product, I have a lot of dark spots and acne scars and after 2 uses (the pack had 12 and I used 6 each time) most of the spots are very faded and a couple are completely disappeared. I am very excited to see such a change. My only complaint is that I wish the packs were bigger, so I could get more from it and keep using it before reordering! But overall definitely goes beyond the effectiveness I thought it would.

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text:
I was very surprised by how well this product worked! I received this product for free from Influenster and definitely has my doubts, however I am in awe of how much better my skin looks!!
I have some dark spots, acne scars and an overall uneven skintone. I put these on before bed and when I woke up in the morning, I could not believe how good my skin looked!  The dark spots were actually faded. Still using consistently! 
My only complaint is that the dots are so small and you only get 12 in a pack.  I use half the package in one night!  Please make these in a bulk size!

review_text: I have a few dark spots on the left side of my face due to driving. I've tried many different creams and no luck at lightening them. After one use, I noticed one of my spots has lightened. I'm excited about continuing to use this product to further lighten my spots.

review_text: These are really great for acne scars.  I love that they are micro needling dots too! The ingredients are very beneficial.  It took me multiple dots to see a difference in one of my acne scars.  I feel like they are good for brightening red spots or colored pigmentation, not really sun spots. review_text: These worked really well!  I was pretty shocked in fact.  I got them to use on my friend whom is darker complected and gets dark spots after nearly any blemish.  After just two 6 hour applications his dark spots are already noticeably lighter and less visible.  He's definitely going to keep using these!  Very happy!

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: THIS PRODUCT WORKS! My concern is post pimple marks and this product lightened it drastically within a few uses. The only reason why I’m giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is bc of the price and there’s not many. I’m only saying it’s not enough bc I have a lot of dark spots. Suggestion: Make it into the shapes of the Peace Out Pores one just so that it’s bigger. I’m sure a lot of us have more than one dark spot and sometimes they’re next to each other. HOWEVER, the product itself is really 5 stars. I can’t emphasize enough how effective it is and I already tried many serums, toners, etc. If they just put more in one package, it would be perfect.
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: Why are these dots so expensive? I'm so addicted now. I have a very dark spot under my eye, and I've been trying to get laser treatment for it for a year now, but putting off because of my fear of scaring(they told me I would have a scar for a week or so after). I think this product is the only thing that's been helpful. I also use it on a dark acne mark on my chin and I think it's been lightening. the only problem is the pricing could be a little high for only a few dots, but I guess it's still cheaper than laser.
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text:
These stickers were more effective on newer scars (2 weeks old or less) than older dark spots. I placed a sticker on a day old spot before bed, and in the morning, it was 90% faded and completely resolved by the end of the day! For a different dark spot that was a few weeks old, I noticed it took me about 3-4 stickers to get the dark spot to start fading. Still, they didn't entirely disappear even after using additional stickers. This was the same for other dark spots around this age or older as well. 

I think these stickers are helpful to have on hand and worth the price when you start to notice a dark spot forming and apply the sticker as soon as you see it. However, if you're using these on older or darker scars, set aside the recommended amount of 4 stickers to address it, and use additional creams/serums on that area.
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text:
I was really skeptical of these and would never have bought them if not for the"exchange 500points for $10" promotion. 

The application was easy. They stick on super well and stay put all night. They're pretty clear so you can't really see them on which is also nice. You can feel the little needle things go into your skin so it's satisfying and it's not painful at all! 

I have tan skin and I have a lot of acne scarring. I used these on a few consecutive days on a couple of my scars to see what would happen. It only comes with 12 dots, so they run out really fast depending on how many scars you have. 

I will say, they did help to lighten my more recent scars overnight, but didn't do anything on the older/darker scars which was disappointing.

Do you NEED these and are they the most amazing product ever? No. But I think I would say that these are worth trying to see if they work for your skin! If they do work, I think they are worth it!

Personally, due to the high price tag, I would only repurchase if I have a special occasion and need some treatment beforehand
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I really wanted to love this and wish I had the same results as everyone else. I have tan olive skin so I’m thinking that’s why I probably didn’t have the same results. Tan skin is just not the same when it comes to dark spots. If you have skin like mine I’d hesitate with shelling out money for this. I saw no change after the recommended twice a week for two weeks. I also have quite a few post acne spots which makes this quite expensive
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text:
First off, I’m already a huge fan of Peace Out products. If you want effective and fast results, then try any of their products and you won’t be disappointed.

Now let’s get to THIS specific product. This is the most innovative skin care product I’ve seen on the market (and I’ve seen and tried thousands of products) I tried these and I have deep hyperpigmentation left from having severe acne. I’ve used them two nights so far, but it’s definitely lifted the pigmentation. 

This is another must have product from them! They continue to amaze me with their product! This is a much more affordable and comfortable alternative to microneedling. It definitely has improved my pigmentation already and can’t wait to see my results within a few weeks!
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I use their acne patches and I love them they work like magic and I had high hopes for this but it didnt do it for me. Maybe because dark spots are so hard to fight and it takes a while to fade them especially on tan skin tones like mine but I didn't even notice a slight difference after using the box. I did use it on a darker than usual spot so it might have required another couple of boxes but it could work on lighter spots!
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: These dots are like magic. I had a giant hormonal pimple on my cheek that was very painful. Sounds gross but after it popped I gave it a day or two to go down before I used the dots. Normally I will get a dark spot that will linger for weeks. I used the dots twice so far skipping a day in between and I’m left with a lighter scar. I’m confident that with a few more uses it will def improve. This is not a miracle product but as someone who has used almost all products under the sun for acne scars I think this is def worth it.
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I got these for my significant other that gets post acne hyperpigmentation on his face. I feel like these little dots may have made a slight difference, however I cannot make the claim that these are in any way a game changer, as I feel there are other products out there at lower price points that produce better results. For as few as there are that come in this package, I expected to see a bit more in terms of efficacy. The only person I might recommend these to are individuals with ultra-sensitive skin that cannot handle using stronger products with a more proven track record of results.
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I am not one to write reviews although I do try a ton of products at Sephora. I have to write this one because this product blew me away! I struggle with acne in my 30s and even when I clear up blemishes, I have persistent acne scars that last several months that are difficult to cover with makeup. I tried these last night and was shocked at the difference they made after only one use! I can’t wait to see how they work over the recommended course of twice weekly for two weeks. Also, if you’re like me and look at this product and worry it is going to be “pokey” while sleeping, don’t. I couldn’t even feel them once they were on and they stayed on all night. If you struggle with acne scars please try this it will change your life!
ingredients: Isodecyl Neopentanoate, Dimethicone, Azelaic Acid, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate, Polysilicone11, Isohexadecane, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Isoceteth20, Polysorbate 60, Triethanolamine, Ethoxydiglycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: I am familiar with this technology being a big fan of Acropass (different company). This product by this company fails on a couple fronts: 1 - unless you have very dry skin, the patches do not stay on. The adhesive ring on these are ridiculously small so if you tend to be oily, they have very little hold. 2 - the needles on these are too small. 3 - They’re really more effective on new acne scars and not older ones.

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text: It is $28 for essentially three spot treatments. You get 12 dots but need at least 4 for one spot. The clinical trials say subjects noticed a difference after using 2x a wk for 2 wks. That’s at LEAST 4 dots IF it works after two weeks. For someone who is acne prone and aging 3 dark spots for $28 is expensive. It would be more cost effective over time to address the whole face with a serum or cream. Also...they didn’t work. So there’s that.

review_text: Amazing product but lil bit on the pricey side though! If it came with more of the patches and was under $20 it would be more in my budget range. I was so excited to receive these to test out for my hobby opinions as I struggle with adult hormonal acne and been looking for a great product to help with my hyper pigmentation and scarring. I've used these 2x a week for about a month now and can already see a HUGE difference in my spots. There way smaller and lighter after short amount of time. I feel that if I continue with this for 2-3 more months my spots will be pretty much gone and I can't wait. It'll be nice to not have to pile on the concealer everyday.

name: Microneedling Dark Spot Brightening Dots
review_text:
It's expensive, and just one box does not erase a brown spot. However, I still give 4 stars because this is the only brown spot product that actually, visibly lightened my spot. 

I did a lot of research and tried many skin-lightening products/methods, including pure botanical extracts like peony or licorice. I tried ultrasonic massager, light therapy, ion machine, but nothing lightened my spots. 

The result: 4 stars
The cost: 3 stars

The fact that these patches visibly lightened a brown spot, I might be going to try micro-needling wand.

review_text: So I used these peace out dots for a few weeks and I only used two of them for these dark spots on the side of my nose that I got from wearing glasses too frequently and I have to say it improved the complexion very slightly. However I decided to use a couple on some dark spots from acne that I had and those have no changes at all. And if you follow the instructions which is to use it at least a couple times weekly, you’re going to run out of dots before the end of the week if you have lots of dark spots. This is probably good for people who have a couple dark spots here or there and whose bruises/spots take too long to heal. Otherwise I would just recommend a vitamin C face mask or something similar to that that to help with hyperpigmentation but please, do not get these dots they are not worth the price.

name: A+ High-Dose Retinol Serum
review_text: I used points to get a deluxe sample of this serum. At first I was very impressed by the results, especially on my most problematic area of skin (between my eyes on the bridge of my nose). My skin is quite resistant to new products, so first-time results are rare and welcome. Only one situation causes me to break out: wearing sunglasses while sweating heavily. That happens maybe once a year when I forget to remove my glasses. Aside from that, acne has never been an issue throughout my 40 years of life. Unfortunately, after three weeks of using as directed, my skin dried out badly. I began to see strange little bumps in my problem area, which initially responded very well to this serum. So I did some digging. This product, like so many others, contains dimethicone. It’s one of the first ingredients. I somehow missed that the first time I read the ingredients list. Dimethicone is FDA-approved but it’s a manmade silicone. That means it fills your pores and sits there. That can make you look gorgeous...for a while. But eventually, it catches up with you. Dimethicone blocks your pores and disables your skin from performing its natural, self-cleansing process. In the long run you’ll end up looking more wrinkled and dried out. It could take longer than three weeks for you; maybe it happened quickly for me because I’m older. All my other skincare products are 100% natural and organic (not sold by Sephora), and I have no issues with anxiety or hormonal imbalance. My skin’s reaction during this trial use was caused by this serum, no question. Now I know...I can’t stray from my high-quality products again.

I'm 30yo and have normal skin.

review_text: This is the first retinol I ever tried, and I could immediately tell a difference in my skin the next day. I started using at age 30, so I really didn't have wrinkles, but I could immediately tell that my skin was smoother and more clear - to the point that others even commented on it in the first week. The smell isn't great, but it doesn't bother me at all like some other products.  This will for sure remain a staple in my routine!

name: A+ High-Dose Retinol Serum
review_text:
I have normal to combo skin. The only retinol I’ve ever used is in the Luna oil & Kate Somerville Vit C serum, which I love. I don’t have any problem using it with Good Genes or other acids; I’ve built up a tolerance, so I used this every day for 4 days (sample). I was hoping it would be stronger than Luna, perhaps a comparable product to the DE Passioni, but I think this is just more hydrating than Luna. I didn’t notice any brightening or evenness comparable to when I use Luna alone, and when I combined it with an acid serum it also didn’t add anything. In fact I woke on day 2 with added texture and redness on my nose (which happens when serums and oils are too oily/ moisturizing) and by day 4 it hadn’t gone away. If you know anything about retinoids they should have a pretty immediate effect, it’s not like most skincare that could take 2 months to see effects.

If you use Luna and enjoy it, stick with it. I think Luna does way more for redness (maybe it’s the blue dye?), and my skin felt plump rather than just moisturized. This serum made me wake up feeling oily/ shiny moisturized whereas Luna I wake and my skin is dry (absorbed the oil) and it’s glowing and plump and soft.  However if you hate the Luna smell (which I think is great, though noticed it being a bit sweeter last time I bought it in Nov), this doesn’t really have a fragrance nor is there a dye. Perhaps if you didn’t find Luna moisturizing enough this would do it for you, but I’m not sure you’ll see any retinol results with this product alone. It seems a lot of people used it in conjunction with 2 other new products from the SR web and got better results, so if you like to stack your skincare...

name: Ultimune Power Infusing Serum Concentrate
review_text: I initially received this as a sample and I ended up liking it so much that I have purchased the full size. From my research, it sounds like this is supposed to be more like a “pre-serum” product that is designed to help your serum work more effectively. Great, another product to add to my million step routine! In the morning, I use this as my serum (it sinks in almost immediately which is great because I still need to add moisturizer and sunscreen!) and at night, I use this pre-serum and add a serum afterwards. I have eczema so I occasionally have flare ups and dry patches but since I have added this to my routine, my dry spots have significantly decreased. It also doesn’t break me out which is a huge plus for me. It does have a fragrance that I enjoy, but if you need something unscented, this is not for you. All in all, this is something I will repurchase.
ingredients: Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Hydroxyethyl Ethylcellulose, Glycerin, Glyceryl Caprylate, Salix Nigra Bark Extract, Tanacetum Annuum Flower Oil, Jasminum Sambac Flower Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract, Carica Papaya Fruit Extract, Carica Papaya Leaf Extract, Leucidal

name: Ultimune Power Infusing Serum Concentrate
review_text: I keep getting free samples of this stuff with my other Sephora purchases, so I’ve been using it for quite a while without actually having to buy it and I can’t say that I will when my samples finally run out. I did not notice any firming or strengthening of my skin nor any improvement in texture. In fact, my skin has looked duller and rougher than with my previous serum. It does absorb fast and does not cause breakouts, so that is a plus. However if you need a light moisturizer or a winter boost for your regular moisturizer, there are cheaper, better options than this serum. Was kind of surprised that this wasn’t a winner since I’ve had good luck with some of their other products. Bummer.

review_text: Fast absorb, light weight, smell nice, add moisture to my face adequately. Quite like this.
ingredients: Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Hydroxyethyl Ethylcellulose, Glycerin, Glyceryl Caprylate, Salix Nigra Bark Extract, Tanacetum Annuum Flower Oil, Jasminum Sambac Flower Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract, Carica Papaya Fruit Extract, Carica Papaya Leaf Extract, Leucidal

name: Ultimune Power Infusing Serum Concentrate
review_text: I've used this for a week now and it seems to be working out very well for my skin. I only use serums at night and it seems to instantly replenish the moisture I lose to my makeup and primer. Feels very soothing and I like the smell. (WARNING: scented product!) Despite this technically being a "pre-serum" I just use it as a serum. I don't need to add any extra steps to my routine, especially since layering on multiple products can cause unintended reactions. Ultimately my face is radiant and bright using this consistently. Don't need a lot either. Glides on effortlessly.
ingredients: Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Hydroxyethyl Ethylcellulose, Glycerin, Glyceryl Caprylate, Salix Nigra Bark Extract, Tanacetum Annuum Flower Oil, Jasminum Sambac Flower Ananas Sativus Fruit Extract, Carica Papaya Fruit Extract, Carica Papaya Leaf Extract, Leucidal

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: FYI-I waited until I finished the entire bottle to write a proper review. I'm kind of upset I spent $80 on this serum. When I first started using it, I developed these small, red bumps around my nose and mouth. I thought my skin was just reacting to a new product and thought it would get used to it-but it didn't. I kept using it anyways because I thought for sure my skin would eventually improve-definitely did not improve. It's been about 2 weeks since I ran out of it and my skin is free of those bumps. I honestly should have just returned it after the first month of using it but the reviews were so good that I thought my skin would turn around. overall I wouldn't recommend this item and I won't be giving it a 2nd chance.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I used this every single day until I finished the bottle, it took me 2-3 months. I did like half a dropper full or less for my entire face. Just a thin layer is needed. First- the SMELL is absolutely amazing. The texture is heavenly, it goes on like silk and makes your skin feel extra smooth and plump and just healthy. I definitely noticed an improvement in tone and general evenness of the skin, however, the change to spots was very slow and this isn’t a magic overnight potion, you would have to get a chemical peel for those kinds of results, people! Based on the ingredients, though, this is a great anti-aging investment.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: This has been the best serum I have ever used.  I am on my second bottle! Little goes long way. You see the difference in a couple of weeks if you are constant with it. It lightern my acne scars and still working on one dark spot and my hyperpigmentation! I noticed a difference in my overall complexion and tone within a week or two. Its hydrating and smooth, not sticky, smells great, goes great under makeup.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: This is a very delicate serum that will nourish and hydrate the skin, improve texture and help fade dark spots and hyperpigmentation. It doesnt break me our or clog my pores, feels very light and refreshing on my face, smell is very fresh. With all that said it definitely takes time to work, it will not fade spots overnight or even in a month. Give it a good 2-3 months of daily use to see a difference but a good thing that it also hydrates and helps with texture. The only con is that it runs our very fast, I use a full dropper on my cheeks every day at night and the 30ml bottle lasts me only 2 months so ends up being quite pricey. I achieved maximum results using this serum in combination with TO niacinamide and Paula's Choice azelaic acid booster, bye bye dark spots.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate
