name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I got a free sample of this product and totally forgot I had it until today. I’ve suffered from severe cystic acne over the last few years. My skin is clear now but I have some pretty severe scarring and dark spots. I have tried absolutely everything and I truly thought that there was nothing else I could do to improve my skin. I used this today and am already seeing a huge difference! I have never seen anything work so quickly and effectively in my life! I’m absolutely amazed right now! I’ll definitely be purchasing a full size bottle ASAP. This might just be my favorite beauty product that I’ve ever used.

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I love this product. It works well for me. I tend to get dark spots after i've had a breakout and this has helped diminish or eliminate them. Even some older spots. It feels really great on too. I've been using it for over a year. It's my go to.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text:
Re-purchase of a product I used before. This works better than Vit C for acne and sun damage and can be used in conjunction with other products (like Vit C) to attack dark spots on many fronts.  This works on the deep layers with grape vine sap and that not only gets rid of the spots there but also tells the skin to slow production of the melanin, so less spots are waiting under the surface. So light-weight, like a milk and absorbs totally.  Easy to wear make-up over it.  
Tip/Trick:  If you have bad under-eye dark circles, pat the residual from your finger tips, under your eyes after applying to your face. Do not direct apply as that may be too strong on the eye area but a small amount of the the grape sap, will increases blood flow to that area and reduce the darkness.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I have only been using this 2 weeks. I am very fair and have redness issues also a few hyperpigmentation spots from tanning in my 20s. This has diminished my redness almost completely. So amazed! Nothing seemed to help with redness. I have been using with the pink moisturizer with the vinosource name. Will continue to purchase both even though they r pricey. It's worth it, hardly have to use foundation anymore.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: Disclaimer- I have very sensitive skin. I break out with vitamin c products and am bummed to miss out on it's brightening effects and antioxidant skin protection. I was hoping this could be my vit c alternative. Sadly I also broke out immediately. My skin also can't tolerate alpha-arbutin. I don't think it is a problem with the product, just my skin. I thought this review might help someone with similarly sensitive skin.

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: This is one of my must have skincare products! I love Caudalie and the grape technology. I also love that its clean skincare. I got this in a sample vial when I cashed in points and then immediately cashed in for 8 more! This is a thicker serum, it brightens the skin and makes it feel firm and tight. Its a great base for moisturizer. I love everything about it. I saw a review that said it lasts two weeks, girl your using it wrong then. It should last 6 months or more! I would say maybe it would be better in a pump. I dont know if opening it twice a day affects its potency or stability but its been around long enough and the company is successful so really no complaints here. I think everyone could benefit from this. Theres light glycolic but so light you can us this twice a day!

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I have VERY sensitive, acne prone skin.  This product is not thick and oily like most serums.  It has a milky consistency that absorbs easily into my skin without leaving a sticky feeling behind.  I have ended up using this serum every single day and love it!  It has not irritated my skin in the slightest.  Even my cheeks, which are the most sensitive part of my face but where I needed to lighten my dark sun spots, have tolerated daily use of this just fine.  I have used this for a couple months now and my dark spots are no longer visible unless you're within an inch of my face.  I've even started using this on the backs of my hands where I have awful sun spots as well.  One week of using it on my hands and  I already see improvement!  This one jar is lasting months, so I consider the price well worth it!
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I bought this some time ago and used it for awhile, then got lazy and stopped. Recently, in an effort to clear out half-used products in my bathroom, I started using it regularly again and after 2-3 days of using it 2x a day, I noticed a very significant difference in the texture of my skin. It was so smooth and soft, some of the bumps and roughness that had been there had smoothed out, and my face just looked and felt brighter and younger. Using a serum can feel like an unnecessary step, like you're just putting a lot of junk on your face, but this one is worth the extra step, worth the extra few bucks. Give it a minute or two to absorb before putting on your moisturizer and it won't feel so sticky. My 36-yr-old mildly sensitive combination skin loves this stuff, and I will definitely keep using it!!
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

I do think this product is high-quality; building a good skincare regimen involves finding the product that works best for you, and I suspect this would work well for others.

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I bought this some time ago and used it for awhile, then got lazy and stopped. Recently, in an effort to clear out half-used products in my bathroom, I started using it regularly again and after 2-3 days of using it 2x a day, I noticed a very significant difference in the texture of my skin. It was so smooth and soft, some of the bumps and roughness that had been there had smoothed out, and my face just looked and felt brighter and younger. Using a serum can feel like an unnecessary step, like you're just putting a lot of junk on your face, but this one is worth the extra step, worth the extra few bucks. Give it a minute or two to absorb before putting on your moisturizer and it won't feel so sticky. My 36-yr-old mildly sensitive combination skin loves this stuff, and I will definitely keep using it!!
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: This is a great serum, and I have noticed that using it has made my skin improve significantly. My skin is more even, vibrant, and radiant, which is incredible considering my high stress levels.

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: This is a total game changer! When used daily it has helped lighten up my dark spots and brighten up my entire complexion! It has a nice consistency and sink into the skin quickly! I found that it works best when I use a light moisturizer on top to lock in all the key ingredients in this serum! I’m reviewing as part of a contest

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I love this - it’s the only brightening serum, like a vit C, that my skin likes. I tried the PTR, it was too strong and I broke out in little bumps on my cheeks. I’ve been using this for a month and it gives me a great glow during the day and absorbs quickly. Loving it. I took off one star because I haven’t seen fading of spots, but I don’t have many to start with so I’m unsure. I will for sure keep using!

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: Okay, so let me tell you about this freakin' serum! I got it as my birthday present and I was kind of disappointed. It didn't seem like a "fun" birthday product. But I decided to try it and... wow. I noticed results INSTANTLY. This moisturized my skin, and really made it more radiant... glowy... without being oily. And I'm a combo-to-oily skin girl! But this is proof that you want to be adding moisture to keep your skin healthy, instead of taking it away. The little size lasted for about a month. I'm dying to buy the full size but the price is keeping me at bay. I DO think it's worth the price, but this isn't one of those one-time purchases. The moment I commit, I'm going to want to keep this in my routine forever... gulp.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: Really amazing product that has helped me with my post acne struggles. I had a couple of months where my face was randomly full of pimples and once my dermatologist helped me get that in check, I was left with discoloration. I’ve had this serum for almost two months now and I’ve noticed a significant improvement! They aren’t totally gone but I’m at the point now where I can put a little concealer on and walk out to start the day, I don’t need a full face of makeup to hide them. I use it AM and PM and the bottle is a little more than halfway gone, so it doesn’t last as long as I’d like it to, especially for the price point;  but hey it works. I also started to use it in tandem with their brightening essence so fingers crossed these spots go away by the end of the year!
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ceteareth20, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Bisabolol, Parfum, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates, Potassium Sorbate, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Phytate

review_text: I received this serum along with the sorbet in 2017 as birth gift. I started using it when I moved from a rainy and mild climate to a cold and dry one. It leaves my skin soft and hydrated, helps managing flaky dry skin, and I do notice that my skin has this radiance. I'm on my second bottle now, continuing using with the sorbet.

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: Got several deluxe samples of this along with quite a few others. This seems to be the winner. Goes on very milky and absorbs very quickly. Doesn't seem to make moisturizers greasy. Lasts a long time too. Doing a great job keeping my skin tone even and radiant. I only use this at night to keep from piling on product during the day. Seems to help with skin cell turnover. Very pricey however.

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: I got this for my Sephora VIB Birthday present and have used it in the past, as well.  I love Caudalie, especially the Vinoperfect Serum.  I have used it in rotation in my skin care regimen for quite some time and love the brightening results that I get from it.  I can't say anything for line improvement, but definitely overall brightening.  Plus, a big bonus (which some do not like) is that their entire line smells amazing, which makes it so much more fun to use.  I highly recommend this!

name: Vinoperfect Anti Dark Spot Serum
review_text: Honestly, I can’t say enough about this serum. I always get breakouts on my cheeks, I have large pores, and red patches on my face. After using this daily along with their Sorbet moisturizer, my skin is AMAZING! No zits, redness has been reduced by more than half, and my pores are starting to fade. One bottle lasts me 6 months. But it now!! You won’t regret it!!!

review_text: I enjoyed using these, they feel nice and cool on the skin, but I don't think there is enough AHAs in here for what I'm looking for to help with dark spots and texture. name: Facial Radiance Pads
review_text:
Lovely, gentle daily exfoliating pads that contain low levels of lactic/glycolic acids and lemon/licorice root extracts to help brighten the skin. The presence of aloe and cucumber water help keep the pads gentle and sensitive skin-friendly. 

I would recommend these pads to those who are looking to start out exfoliating with acids, especially those with very sensitive skin. The pads have a textured side that will help pick up whatever gunk is left on your skin if you did not cleanse your skin properly.

name: Facial Radiance Pads
review_text: I’m sad. I’m sad because this is $32 and my skin won’t let me not use it. So. I got this in a kit the first time, so I just used it because I had it. Whenever I ran out I got pimples. I was like wut. So I bought this again and the pimples went away and my skin got clear. I was still in denial so I ran out again and bam. Hi pimples welcum back again. So I must continue to repurchase this product. I have extremely sensitive (the irritated, burning type of sensitive) skin and this doesn’t irritate or burn my skin. It actually works.

name: Facial Radiance Pads
review_text:
I must admit to being less than thrilled with this product. Heck I’m not even that content with it, still debating if I should return it. I bought these pads on a whim while picking up some of my usual skin care items. They were recommended to me by a Sephora corporate employee that just happened to be in the store doing some work. He swept me away by rubbing these pads on the back of my hand and showing me all this nasty grey stuff they picked up, claiming it was dead skin. 

Flash forward to me at home. I am a regular with exfoliation, so I should not have expected to see as much come off my face as I did in store from my hand... but I never see much of anything on the pads after use, nor do I see much of a difference in my skin after using them. They almost feel like the stridex pads that were sold to clean the face, but not as much alcohol in them. I don’t like the residue these pads leave behind, I often feel the need to wash my face (again) or at least rinse it off. Overall, I just don’t think these are worth the buy, they seem more of a gimmick, in my opinion.

name: Facial Radiance Pads
review_text: These pads just make you feel so fresh and clean! After I take my makeup off and use my face wash, I just wipe a pad all over and it just wakes up your skin. I then apply my serum and moisturizer after. I only use them about 2-3 times per week. I do have pretty sensitive skin, so I don't need to use these every single day. As well, I am prone to getting acne (especially hormonal acne) and these haven't caused that to worsen or irritate my skin.

name: Facial Radiance Pads
review_text:
I had received a 10-day supply as a trial. In the past, I have found other peel/glycolic products to often be too harsh, but I was willing to give them a try. I was pleasantly surprised by positive results and found this product to be much less harsh than other acids.

These pads really worked! They were not too harsh, either. I found that existing breakouts calmed down, plus I did not develop any new ones during the 10 days that I used these once a day at night. I also found that my skin looked brighter and older acne scars seemed slightly less obvious. I will repurchase the full size!

name: Lactic Acid 5% + HA
review_text:
I love this product.
I can leave it on for a few hours to overnight and it leaves my skin feeling super smooth.
If you have sensitive skin, you need to skin test this product first. 
Start with leaving it on for 15-20 min and then washing it off.
ingredients: Aqua, Lactic Acid, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Propanediol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Tasmannia Lanceolata Fruit, Acacia Senegal Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Sodium Hydroxide, Ethylhexylglycerin, 12Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Lactic Acid 5% + HA
review_text:
I don’t usually give things a 5 star because despite how good they are I can normally find better. But I’ve used this all of 2 days and I’m already noticing a great difference. I get hormonal acne and it’s very difficult to control, and my skin will very easily act out with new products and it takes a few weeks for my skin to adjust, but this has been really amazing for me. I used the lactic acid treatment by Sunday Riley and I can say this one is much better, and it’s 20x cheaper!
I will warn tho, if you have dry skin, maybe use every other day, or blend with a moisturizer, or even use one lower than 5%, but other than that it works amazingly.
ingredients: Aqua, Lactic Acid, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Propanediol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Tasmannia Lanceolata Fruit, Acacia Senegal Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Sodium Hydroxide, Ethylhexylglycerin, 12Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Lactic Acid 5% + HA
review_text: I used to struggle really badly with cystic acne on my jaw line and cheeks. Took me a while to find products that worked for me since my skin is combination, sensitive and eczema prone. I found what worked best for me is the less is more approach with my skin care. This product changed my life. Any time I find myself breaking out I use this product in combination with the Niacinamide + Zinc serum and within a day or two my acne is visibly reduced. Do a patch test before you mix any serums or use a product as what works for me might not work for you! I wish someone gave me that advice years ago. Definitely would recommend using this 3 times a week but no more than that. This caused a bit of an itchy feeling on my skin when I first tried it but I no longer have that feeling. This also did not cause my eczema to flare up but If you do have eczema or dry sensitive skin just be careful not to overdue it because I find this to be drying! I also follow this up with a facial oil and moisturizer. hope this helps anyone.
ingredients: Aqua, Lactic Acid, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Propanediol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Tasmannia Lanceolata Fruit, Acacia Senegal Gum, Xanthan Gum, Isoceteth20, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Sodium Hydroxide, Ethylhexylglycerin, 12Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol

name: Lactic Acid 5% + HA

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text:
Folks, My pores are so big you could plant a tree inside of them.  This serum has made a significant difference in keeping them clean on a daily basis even with layers of skincare and makeup.  A clean pore is a smaller looking pore.  

I apply this 2x/day after toner and essence, but before other serums, moisturizer and sunscreen.  

My Tips...
1). It potentially can be drying if you don’t use a moisturizer.  
2). Sunscreen is a must when using this during the day.
3). The pump dispenses too much.  You only need a half-pump to cover your entire t-zone.  Therefore this bottle will last a very long time!!!
4) Before buying this listing, see if Sephora has it available as a gift set as that will save you money and/or score you additional products at the same price.  Just search Caudalie in Sephora search bar to look for value gift sets.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Potassium Sorbate, Leuconostoc

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text: This smells really great and I like the clean ingredients. However, I must be sensitive to something in it because it broke me out bad! I even stopped for a couple of weeks and then tried again but the results were the same.

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text:
Skin Type: Combination (Oily T-zone, dry rest of face), Acne Prone and Sensitive, Age: 30.

The serum has a lightweight, watery consistency.  It goes on smooth and melts into skin very quickly.  It does a very good job of clearing out the pores and healing acne.  When first using it, I would recommend once a day, every other day - then increase usage.  It isn't irritating, but it can be a bit drying.  So I would recommend using a good moisturizer - otherwise your skin will overcompensate and produce more oil = more acne.  A small bit goes a long way.  Would highly recommend!
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Potassium Sorbate, Leuconostoc

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text: I saw an influencer day she hadn’t tried this, which had been sent to her, and wouldn’t because she didn’t have blemishes. Well neither do I and it’s amazing! My skin was in pretty much its best shape ever, but this stuff sinks in well (especially with the essence) and has helped shrink my pores and just keep me balanced (I’m normal skin). It does have a slight, very slight, medicinal spa smell.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Potassium Sorbate, Leuconostoc

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text:
Disclaimer: I got this as a sample three times  and I liked it so much, I bought the full size. 

I have acne prone skin and my work life does really take a toll on my skin when working under adverse conditions or strict deadlines. So this serum is a true blessing and my holy grail!  I use a salicylic acid based cleanser by first aid beauty, tone my skin with oil control toner by ole henriksen n then this serum from caudalie. Finally I top with my favorite moisturizer. Using this skincare regiment, I have noticed my face feels tighter, pores closed and instantly hydrated. 
When I feel my skin is behaving (no more acne break outs) I switch to a more vitamin c regiment. So I don’t really stick to a salicylic acid regiment all the time. I give my skin opportunity to feel supple n nourished more on my non-acne days
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Potassium Sorbate, Leuconostoc

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text: It doesn’t work overnight but if you’re a regular user of the serum your acne will disappear. It works wonders and worked beautifully for my brother who has both white heads and cystic acne.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Potassium Sorbate, Leuconostoc

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text: ***Holy grail alert***!!!! Obsessed with this product for combination, oily, or acneic skin. I first got this as a sample and after using it on my t-zone for one night added it to my cart first thing in the morning. First of all, the bottle is large. It’s about 75% bigger than I expected. A little bit goes a longgg way too so it’s a great value for the price. It has a lot of slip, absorbs in about one minute, and doesn’t burn or irritate my skin. It smells like something familiar I can’t quite identify... maybe a Ricola? After one night of using this under my Epicuren enzyme moisturizer, the inflammation on my t-zone was significant reduced. After the second night, the majority of my pimples and comedones were ready to extract. After the third night, my active breakout is completely gone! It didn’t dry me out like many acne serums do. It cleared my breakout without stripping my skin’s natural barrier. Be sure to use an SPF the next day. The obsession runs deep, seriously just get it!
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Potassium Sorbate, Leuconostoc

It's just not strong enough.

I like Caudalie products a lot in general and this seems like a gentle, non-irritating serum for people who are not experiencing an active breakout and just want a bit of salicylic to gently treat their pores.

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text: I use a few Caudalie products regularly, but this one is not my favorite. I was surprised to see Alcohol as one of the first ingredients—it was so drying on my skin, and it dried up before I could even finish rubbing it in. I used it for a couple days but my skin broke out so I stopped using it. It also has a VERY strong smell that is not exactly pleasant. It smells a bit like ginger and it’s kind of a masculine scent. I couldn’t take it because I have a sensitive nose. I’m bummed because I have really loved the other Caudalie products I’ve tried and I have been wanting to try this one out for awhile because I suffer from adult acne; Caudalie products are typically more natural and nourishing but the alcohol in this one is too much for my sensitive skin. I received this product free in my #IGlitterallyCantVoxBox from Influenster.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Potassium Sorbate, Leuconostoc

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text: After trying a sample of this product I am quite certain I will repurchase this! I have combination and oily skin and have breakouts occasionally especially along my jawline. This serum cleared up my breakouts and helped reduce the amount of oil I produced which helped make my makeup wear longer! I received this product complimentary from Influenster to try out for review purposes, and I think I may have found a new skincare fave. Highly recommend for oily/ combination skin.
ingredients: Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Potassium Sorbate, Leuconostoc

name: Vinopure Natural Salicylic Acid Pore Minimizing Serum
review_text: This is amazing! I had problematic areas on my nose and chin with small white/ blackheads. My pores also were very visible especially when I had make up on. I would exfoliate frequently but that didn’t seem to be enough. Using this has been the best decision I’ve made. My skin is smooth and I have noticed much less white/ blackheads and I’ve only been using it for 2 weeks. My pores have also minimized greatly! You will not be disappointed, it’s a must try !

review_text: The packaging looks very attractive, the bottle of green glass, a dispenser with a pump, which is very convenient, thanks to it, the serum are squeezed out exactly as much as needed, this helps a lot to economically use the product. I absolutely love the smell of this serum - the essential oils combine to give it an amazing scent! The serum is easy to apply and spread, literally absorbed in a few seconds. In just a couple of minutes after applying the serum, inflammations noticeably fade, the skin structure itself is also leveled, it can even be used separately as a day serum with a matting effect, the face really becomes matte, noticeably reduces the number of problem areas, narrows pores and improves skin texture. This is what you need for problem/combination skin.

review_text: I was gifted the Algenist Genius Liquid Collagen, and I am a fan! It is an anti-aging serum that hydrates, and helps with dullness and uneven skin tone. The product is lightweight, despite it having a gel-like formula with collagen micro-beads. All in all, I like this product, but not so much the price. Also, I can't say I notice my fine lines and wrinkles are diminishing, but I feel like this product is helping in preventing it from getting worse.

review_text: This product is one of a kind. I started using this over the cold winter months bc AHA and retinol were too intense as a nightly treatment when it’s colder (skin tends to get drier). review_text: I would give this product zero star if I could. I bought this because of good reviews. I have three white heads acne after using it for 3 days. Then I gave it to my mom. She used it for 2 days and returned it to me because it wrinkled her face up. It did the opposite what it was supposed to do. The scent is very light. It is not as strong as reviews. name: GENIUS Liquid Collagen
review_text: I don’t consider my skin sensitive and I rarely get pimples because I take really good care of it. However, after less than one week of using this product, it quickly clogged my pores and caused my face to break out. It was so bad that even my boyfriend (and you know most boyfriends don’t notice these small details) noticed and asked me why my skin was so bumpy. I immediately stopped using it and after one week of the purge, my skin was back to normal again!

review_text: I had the sleeping collagen cream from Algenist, and I personally did not like it.  I have combination skin, so it felt really heavy on my skin.  It left some sort of film on my skin that stayed there throughout the night.  I ended up giving it to my mom who has dry skin and she loves it. name: GENIUS Liquid Collagen
review_text:
PROS:
- Packing was different, and easy to use.
- Get plenty of product for the price.

CONS:
- The smell. Period.
- The texture was a little thin for my liking, but that's still manageable.
- Didn't notice a difference in my skin after using it twice a day until product ran out.

name: GENIUS Liquid Collagen
review_text: I got this as a sample and was excited to use it.  It came in this neat looking vial and the product is so different. I was first turned off by the scent.  I have a very poor sense of smell so when a scent smells strong to me I know its strong!  I'm also not a fan of floral scents, I prefer "food" smells like vanilla, caramel, coconut, citrus, berry scents, etc.  This smelled like very strong floral perfume.  Fragrance is listed in the products ingredients so this smell is not from the anti-aging ingredients added in the serum.  I heard fragrance is aging, so to have an ingredient that ages you in an antiaging product seems self defeating?   My biggest area of concern is fine lines around my nose and mouth. So I only applied this product along my smile lines to see if it would minimize them.  I ended up with a bunch of small zits all over this area the next day and where I didn't apply this product I had none.  I continued using the sample just to see if it minimized my fine line but had to stop, I didn't like the strong floral perfume scent. Not for me.
ingredients: Collagen, Water, Propanediol, Isononyl Isononanoate, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Betaine, Pentylene Glycol, Dextrin Palmitate, Collagen Amino Acids, Parachlorella Beijerinckii Exopolysaccharides, Chlorella Protothecoides Oil, Helichrysum Stoechas Flower Extract, Cylindrotheca Fusiformis Extract, Niacinamide, Tocopherol, Palmitoyl Tripeptide1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide7, Adenosine, Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil, Leuconostoc, Caprylic, Palmitic Acid, Disodium EDTA, Carbomer, Sodium Lactate, Amodimethicone, Homosalate, Polysorbate 20, Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, 12Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol, Octocrylene, Sodium Hydroxide, Phenoxyethanol, Fragrance, Limonene, BetaCarotene

review_text: I've purchased a lot of products from Sephora and I never give a review. This is the first time I decided to write a review for a product. It really surprised me and it works. I have the worst skin ever that it is dry combination and acne prone in winter and turns more oily combination acne prone in summer. It is never easy for me to have a good serum or cream.This LIQUID COLLAGEN helps my skin more dewy and hydrated. Furthermore, it goes well with other products skincare and good under makeup as well. It doesn;t turn peeling when you use other cream or products on top of it. I have so many product when you combine together and it peels, but this goes well with all of them. It is expensive but I think it worth money.

name: Ascorbic Acid 8% + Alpha Arbutin 2%
review_text: I have occasional acne and get scars/dark spots very easily with my skin tone. This product has been working really well to help keep my skin healthy. It did cause some irritation and redness at first but I just had to be mindful of how much I was using at a time, a little goes a long way.
ingredients: Propanediol, Ascorbic Acid, AlphaArbutin

name: Ascorbic Acid 8% + Alpha Arbutin 2%
review_text: I love this product and will definitely be ordering again. The peel was very subtle, it is tacky to the touch and you will get used to it over the time. I used this product for just about a month and I had really good results. In about 2 weeks, my skin was already changing, my blemishes were fading and you can tell that my skin was in transition. I strongly recommend taking a break with this product as well. Give your skin some time to get back to normal. Its been 2 weeks since I've used it and my skin still looks flawless.
ingredients: Propanediol, Ascorbic Acid, AlphaArbutin

name: Ascorbic Acid 8% + Alpha Arbutin 2%
review_text: Hear me out: Yes this product can be super irritating and cause breakouts if u use it incorrectly. I have super sensitive skin and this worked wonders for me when applied on top of a moisturizer. After a week of using this my acne scars have lightened tremendously. I would recommend easing into how much you apply just to see how u react to it.
ingredients: Propanediol, Ascorbic Acid, AlphaArbutin

name: Ascorbic Acid 8% + Alpha Arbutin 2%
review_text:
I have been using this for a while, about to finish one whole bottle. I have brown spots on my cheeks and I apply this just around the problem area, so a little goes a long way, 

What I did not like about this product:
1. The texture. It’s sticky and feels like pure glycerin. It sits on the surface of my skin and never gets absorbed. 
2. It did not lightened my brown spots. 

What I like about this product:
1. The company discloses the percentage of arbutin. 
2. The price is very affordable. 

CONCLUSION:
It might be good for slightly lightening your overall skin tone, but not powerful enough to lighten already-darkened brown spots in a short time (1-2 months). 

It might be going to lighted brown spots if I continue using this product for a long time, sat for more than 6 months, but I really don’t like the texture of this product and don’t feel like continuing using it till I start seeing the result. 

Overall I love The Ordinary products, but not this one.
ingredients: Propanediol, Ascorbic Acid, AlphaArbutin

name: Ascorbic Acid 8% + Alpha Arbutin 2%
review_text: I use it in my morning routine as the last step before sunscreen. It is a good product especially for hyperpigmentation. The problem I have with this is it doesn’t sink into my skin. Every time I put on sunscreen after this I feel like I am just moving the product around. I have tried waiting 5-10 mins before putting the sunscreen but it still feels like it’s sitting on top of my skin. I guess for the price it is a good product but I think I will go with a vit c serum after this is over.
ingredients: Propanediol, Ascorbic Acid, AlphaArbutin

name: Ascorbic Acid 8% + Alpha Arbutin 2%
review_text: The smell is really bothersome. It smells exactly like peanut oil and makes it very off putting to want to use. To be fair, I've only used it for 1 week so I can't really speak to results as of yet. However, I definitely cannot relate to some of the other stellar reviews that claimed to see results within the first few uses. I have pretty unpredictable acne/blemishes and uneven skin tone, so I was hoping to see some improvement based on what I read about it. But the smell makes me not want to use it! Grosses me out :(  At least it was cheap...
ingredients: Propanediol, Ascorbic Acid, AlphaArbutin

name: Ascorbic Acid 8% + Alpha Arbutin 2%
review_text: If I could give as many Stars ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ as this line deserves I would. It changed my skin instantly from the pm to the am I saw the difference in my skin texture and brightness. I can literally post this in general for all the products I bought. What a brilliant line of chemist. I will try everything they have according to my needs. Brilliant!!!
ingredients: Propanediol, Ascorbic Acid, AlphaArbutin

name: Ascorbic Acid 8% + Alpha Arbutin 2%
review_text:
I’m sure it works great because the ingredients are good, but I can’t get past the smell. It’s super fishy smelling, so much so that I can’t put it on without holding my breath until it dries. 

For reference, I usually go towards products that have little to no fragrance. In this case, it’s not “fragrance” that’s irritating at all, it just stinks.

review_text: This is a great, inexpensive vitamin c serum to use. I have combo skin (dry, mostly normal but oily in T zone sometimes, and acne prone) and I have had no issues with this. I have used it every other day for 2 months. A little goes a long way. My skin has been the healthiest and glowiest it's ever been.

name: CC Me Vitamin C Serum
review_text: This is the most essential part of my skin care routine. I have used other vitamin C serums and this is hands down my favorite. I have a lot of acne scarring/hyperpigmentation and after 2-3 weeks of use I already see a huge difference! Plus my skin is GLOWING! Seriously give this a try! My skin has not looked this healthy in years!

review_text: Let me start by saying I was REALLY excited to try this product. My skin has been great lately but I wanted something to help get rid of the last of my dark spots. I've only used it twice and my skin looks awful again - red bumps, clogged pores, etc. Not to say that it won't work for you, but it certainly isn't for me!

name: CC Me Vitamin C Serum
review_text: This product lasted 2.5 months of everyday use. I saw an improvement in brightness fairly quickly. I did not notice that it improved any dark spots or hyper pigmentation. I like the scent of the product and that it is slightly tacky. I usually use this after my toner and before my serums. I let this sit on my skin for a minute or so before going in with serums to let it soak in. I just emptied this product and I will not be repurchasing at this time.

name: CC Me Vitamin C Serum
review_text: I bought this because it basically had 5 stars, and sounded wonderful. but I have sensitive skin... after a week of using this I started to break out on my chin and on my cheekbones (where I was concentrating the product because I have pigment issues there). I was getting multiple blackhead/whiteheads on my cheekbones, and red painful pimples on my chin. As soon as I stopped using this, my skin cleared up (changed NOTHING else). There is something that is no bueno in the formula—possibly the concentration of vitamin C? No idea. I’ll be returning this.

I had to return them. This serum not only brightens my hyperpigmentation but leaves me with the softest feeling ever! It really does prevent more breakouts from appearing. I use this with the Jet Lag mask as well and I am very pleased. The actually product is a 5 star!! The only reason I removed a star was because of the price, I want to repurchase but it’s so pricey to keep buying :(

One of my favourite products that I now consider a staple in my daily routine.

name: 100% Plant-Derived Squalane
review_text: Squalane oil is such a simple ingredient, but my skin seems to like and tolerate it very well. Having a combination skin, prone to both breakouts and dryness, it's hard to find an oil that sufficiently hydrates my skin without clogging my pores; but squalene oil does it! Squalane oil for me it's not only hydrating, but very soothing. The squalane oil from The Ordinary worked great for me, I have nothing to complain about the quality. When I suffer from severe dryness I just finish my nighttime skincare routine with a generous amount of the oil and in the morning my skin is soft and supple. It's quite a `thin` oil, with a silicone like feeling, not thick as castor or almond oil, so the texture has something elegant in it. I personally like to have squalane as a one note ingredient, to add it as I need in my routine. I also used the oil on my body and hair, it's a multipurpose item.

review_text:
This clogged my pores. I’m pretty sure that it’s because the company derives their squalane from olive oil. I think that most peoples skin tolerates olive oil and it’s derivatives well, but unfortunately mine doesn’t. Olive oil derivatives seem to be in a lot of products now.
I do like their rosehip seed oil. That does moisturize my skin and it doesn’t cause breakouts for me. So if you do want to use an oil and this one doesn’t work well for you, I’d give that a try.

review_text: This first thing I notice about this is the scent. Since it's a clean product, there are no added fragrances. I immediately smell a heavy medicinal herbal scent. The scent definitely lingers and takes a long time to wear off. It's rather off putting. otherwise it's white and comes in a nice pump. Easy to put on, thin enough to spread. I appreciate it has a low pH. This is the first time I've used Lactic acid as an active and I don't think my skin likes it. I've reacted well to differin, but this one breaks me out and is really drying. Definitely slowly introduce this product into your routine. I can only hope in I'm a purging phase.  I received this complimentary.

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I took a while to convince myself to buy this after seeing all the before and afters. I have texture on my forehead, larger pores on parts of my cheeks, and some uneven skin tone. So after like 3-4 days I noticed my pores getting smaller. It took maybe 2 weeks to see my skin tone even out. It’s now been over 4 weeks of nightly use and my forehead still has some uneven texture but the pores are much smaller there. It’s not a miracle product in my book but it has improved my skin so much that I would consider repurchasing again. The only thing that makes this product tricky is layering moisturizer over it, a lot of mine would pill despite waiting 20-30 minutes after applying this serum to layer anything over it.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I’ve tried numerous different products for my skin including DE’s Framboos nighttime serum, retinol (both prescription and DE’s), Herbivore’s retinol alternative, etc and NOTHING WORKED QUITE LIKE THIS! I suffer from acne scars, texture, occasional breakouts, and redness. And within just a few weeks I’ve seen a drastic difference in my skin. I actually feel comfortable wearing just concealer without foundation now (the bags under my eyes aren’t cute). I highly recommend! I’m not even fully out yet and already ordered a back up.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I had horrible cystic acne when I was younger, which left me with scarring in the forms of dark spots and uneven skin texture. I started using this product about 2 months ago and the results are incredible! See before/after picture after daily usage for 2 months! One of the claims by Biossance is noticeable results after one usage. I did find this to be slightly true, my face was well moisturized and felt supple the next day. After 1 month of usage, my dark spots were fading and my skin texture was more even. Additionally, my skin tone also evened out. Before, I had redness and blotchiness from the acne scarring, but now my skin is more calm and the color is even. It wasn’t until after 2 months that I started to notice my pores decreasing in size. I saw a few reviews commented on the smell of the product, which I did not find that horrible. A few other reviews commented on the greasy feel of the product, which I would agree with. However since this product is for night-use, I did not mind at all. Overall I highly recommend this product and it is well worth the price. It’s been 2 months and I still have plenty of product left.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I got a sample at first I thought “ok this is great” ...so I ended up purchasing the full size. After a couple uses I started to break out w whiteheads on my forehead, chin and upper lip. There is something in there that my skin doesn’t agree with. As far as the lactic acid it is quite strong bc it does burn, which is not bad. But once I stopped using this my skin started to clear up. Then I decided to try it again just to see if that was indeed breaking me out and I did the next day. This is quite expensive and the bottle is super light. Can’t tell how much is in the bottle.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: A warning for anyone with acne prone skin like me, this broke me out so bad. I really wanted to love this product but I woke up with bumps all over my forehead and chin. I thought maybe I was just sensitive to it so tried not doing it for the next night then tried applying again the night after. Nope. Still those little bumps all over my forehead and chin. It’s taken my face a week to calm down so sadly I had to return it. I’m not dissing the product though, it could be amazing for other skin types! So I recommend trying a sample first.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: Wow, I'm not sure who this product was targeted for, but it's not for me. I was sure to use it every night for at least a week prior to concluding my thoughts, and it did break me out while using this as some other reviewers have mentioned as well. The product was a bit greasy and I woke up still feeling a little greasy as well. It didn't seem to sink in well. The scent is seriously terribly off-putting, it's hard to describe, but really takes away from my evening routine experience. I definitely did not see glowing results or improvement in pores in the morning and my face woke up looking more red and stressed this week than normally. Oh boy, I'm glad the week is over. Switching back to some of my normal products, like Ordinary Buffet and Niacinimide, or Kiehl's Midnight Recovery. I was looking for a nice exfoliating product to help with texture, but it's not this.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I received a sample of this and loved it! I bought a full size, but somehow now I don't see much of a difference. Not sure if my skin has adjusted to it and now it doesn't really have an effect...
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I really hate that I spent so much money on something that didn’t do anything for my face :(
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: Smells good, is lightweight, and you can feel is working immediately!! I received this product free for testing purposes only, but I will definitely be buying again! I can definitely tell a difference in my skin!
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: Tried this out for two weeks before making my decision but, I decided I love it! I initially used 3 pumps per night on my face and decided for the price and size, you can definitely use 2 pumps per night. Its more than enough to cover your face. I don’t need a moisturizer after because the squalane does a great job keeping me hydrated. I put it on before bed and wake up in the morning with amazing skin! Seriously, it’s impressive. I do love my other serums as well so I’ve recently started rotating which nights I use which products. I usually use this 4 times per week and a retinol 3 times per week on the off days. I highly recommend trying this in your routine! Thanks to Influenster, I received this product complimentary.
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Squalane + 10% Lactic Acid Resurfacing Night Serum
review_text: I received this product complementary for testing purposes - and I’m glad I did! It arrived just in time to help with my dry winter skin. I love that it is an effortless exfoliant and that it helps with moisturizing as well! Definitely recommend!
ingredients: Sodium Bicarbonate, Resveratrol, Retinol, Ascorbic Acid, Ubiquinone, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Soy Isoflavones, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Raphanus Sativus Root Extract, Copper PCA, Sodium PCA, Zinc PCA, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Polysorbate 80, Alcohol, BHT, Octoxynol9, Simethicone, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text:
It slightly burns when I apply, so I know it is working. I love the sensation. 

It does not "bleach" the dark spots, but the skin, overall, becomes lighter after a couple of weeks of use.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: Not sure if the burning sensation means that it's working on burning my skin. It really burns if you have sensitive skin. I have been using the ordinary for a couple of months now it has been life changing but this Vit C suspension burns a whole lot and I haven't really seen much change since using it.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: Okay I'll start out with the only negative about this stuff which many other reviewers have mentioned- the consistency isn't perfect. It's pretty thick and silicone-y, I feel like I end up using more product than I should in order to get a good spread around my face. That being said, it does spread, I haven't experienced any rolling or pilling, and it dries sheer and matte and goes on under makeup just fine. Most importantly- it works! In just two weeks I have noticed a difference in my skin, it's smoother, brighter. and my dark spots are fading rapidly. So, you can spend $80 bucks on the Sunday Riley vitamin C (which was my go to before this and before I decided I didn't want to spend that much anymore) or you can spend $8 on this and get the same results while sacrificing a little bit of ease in the application. I think it is well worth it!!
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: I love the feel of this on my skin. The Matt finish is unlike anything Ive seen before. I pair this with the alpha arbutin 2% and HA and it feels amazing. No tingling experienced.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: It is strong as heck, and spicy on the skin. BUT, effective on the dark sun spots so I'm into it and will endure the tingle. Cut down the tingling by mixing with moisturizer is a great tip! I use this in the morning after washing my face, and nothing else. I was originally using it with the Ordinary Buffet before I read that these two products don't mix together well and will render them less effective, so I screwed up in the beginning. After I stopped using Buffet concurrently (just using them on alternate days not with each other), I did start to notice the effectiveness increase. The texture of the Vitamin C suspension is like a primer. And yes, some silicone will pill up when applying, which is kind of annoying, but while still quarantining and not rushing to get ready or wearing make-up, it's no big deal. I like to pat it into the skin instead of rubbing too much to reduce the spread of pilling and to make sure to get all the goodness in.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: Mix with the Ordinary face moisturizer. Absolutely great product. If I could give as many Stars ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ as this line deserves I would. It changed my skin instantly from the pm to the am I saw the difference in my skin texture and brightness. I can literally post this in general for all the products I bought. What a brilliant line of chemist. I will try everything they have according to my needs. Brilliant!!!
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: It works well to lighten dark spots and even your skin tone but I noticed that it balls up on my skin. I’m not sure if it’s because of another product I use but it’s just something to look out for.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: The vitamin c from the ordinary that is slightly less than this one in price is better in consistency but makes everything else pill on my face. This one only pills on its own and didn’t do much but sit on my face. Pretty bummed
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text:
First of all, you have to wait until your skin is really dry before you apply this product. If you have even damp skin, the tingling will be burning. Then you have to sort of pat and rub this product on your skin bc it’s a very thick paste. And you let that absorb... and then when you apply moisturizer or sunscreen or liquid foundation over this, your skin will tingle / burn again. And the silicone base does pill with some kinds of primer or foundation. 

So it was just hard to incorporate this into a routine. Maybe the vitamin C in HA suspension would be easier.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: I feel indifferent about this vitamin c product. I found it did help to even my skin tone and reduce appearance of wrinkles, however the silicone in it made it feel like it just sits on the surface of your face and leave a film. It’s not horrible however it’s not my favourite. Also, I experienced that by not making sure it’s not removed from your fingers, it will start to turn your finger nails yellow!!! I haven’t reached for this one in awhile.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: This could be better if it wasn’t in silicone.i out just a little on and it leaves rolls on my face. Can’t really use under makeup so I only use at night. I don’t have any issues with it stinging. Just wish it was more cream form and not in silicone
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text:
An effective nighttime treatment!

Enjoy this and the 23% Vitamin C products from the Ordinary. A bit tingly (especially on neck) for me but okay to use with additional oil on top.

Would recommend at night as texture is too grainy (for me) to wear under makeup and and does pill when mixed with other products.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: Vitamin C Suspension 30% in Silicone
review_text: Starting off with the bad: the texture is gritty and doesn't glide across the skin as much as I would like. I can live with it. That does not outweigh the benefits at all. It is very brightening and fades acne and sun spots well. Can be worn well under makeup and doesn't turn my face orange over time like the Drunk Elephant vitamin C serum. I will continue to buy especially for the price.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Ascorbic Acid, Polysilicone11, PEG10 Dimethicone

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This is one of the most effective spot treatments! It shrinks breakouts very quickly. It can be a bit drying but as long as you use it with hydrating products and moisturizers, you will be fine! I have gone through countless bottles of this.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I've never used a sulfur-based acne treatment but it is a game changer. It helps dry out my stubborn acne and speeds up the whole process. The only con is that it does dry out the skin around it and can cause it to peel so I have to make sure to use stronger moisturizers.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Dramatically reduces size of acne and pimples. Reordering.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Product lid says do not shake. I don’t know if I’m just slow? but the instructions weren’t clear so I had to look up a video. Let it all settle and dip a q-tip into the pink gunk at the bottom. I didn’t see quick results with this product on a big ol zit I had. Worked on smaller ones.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This is one of my favorite items to have on hand in case of a sudden breakout. It does dry the acne up quickly, but can also cause the skin to become so dry it heals slowly. The pink pigment works like a color correcter for my skin and helps hide the acne spots.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text:
This stuff really brings down large zits but is super drying as well, I usually get flaky and find that layering on some neosporin after is very helpful. 

Not good for hormonal or cystic acne, for what it's worth.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Honestly,it’s pretty decent. it make my pimples look less visible in 2 days but i despise the smell a lot.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Didn't really work for me, took off some of the initial size of the blemish, but overall doesn't really work. The one good thing I could give it is that it really doesn't horribly dry out or irritate my skin.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Didn't really work for me, took off some of the initial size of the blemish, but overall doesn't really work. The one good thing I could give it is that it really doesn't horribly dry out or irritate my skin.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: The combo of sulfur and salicylic acid is great for treating my mixed acne. I get a lot of fungal acne (in the form of whiteheads) and hormonal acne so this solution covers my bases. I usually use a swab and apply it on and around the pimple as an overnight treatment.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I've been using this product for about 6 months and it really is a game changer in shutting down rising pimples. I don't think it works as well on my pimples that have already come to a head, but when I feel a blemish coming on this helps stop it...would recommend!!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This is my go to spot treatment. It dries up a pimple overnight!! It’s works so well and is worth every penny. It also drastically reduces the size and appearance of my pores. I love this product!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I dont get acne often and when I do I used to just dab on a bit of toothpaste and it looks better by the next day. I have a friend who swears by this product so I gave it a try and it was NOT it. When I get a pimple it would usually go away and leave a small scar or none at all. When I started to use this it left me with horrible hyper pigmentation.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Used a few days and it made me breakout on the areas I used it on :/
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I received a sample of this and really liked it! It has a gel like texture that's absorbed quickly, leaving the skin feeling very smooth. (it does contain silicone so kinda works like a primer) I usually have pretty oily t-zone and this is great at keeping the oil at bay! It has a pretty heavy chemical scent but goes away after it sets. And I wish it has a shorter ingredients list!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: One of the best acne treatments I’ve ever used.  I’ve been through 3 bottles. The only thing I dislike is when there’s about 1/4 left of product and it dries up.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This stuff is great! Really diminishes the size of blemishes. However it does have a nasty smell. I have always had problematic skin and I notice that my blemishes heal at lightning speed with this stuff!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I sometimes have outbursts of cystic acne (maybe once a month) but this treatment makes them disappear in 2-3 days. Actually, this is my second bottle
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This works wonders to treat pesky surprise bumps. I was stressed the couple days before my wedding and had a few obnoxious stress pimples. I put this treatment on at night and it was like they were never there. I am still amazed
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I found this product to be very good for my acne. my skin started to break out pretty bad over the summer time and then I used this to help clear my skin. I do find it to work either under or over a moisturizer.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I bought this when looking for products to help speed up the acne healing process and I think it’s worked! It’s very simple to use, just dip a q tip into the solution and apply overnight, and in the morning I feel like my breakouts have been minimized! The really tough breakouts still show up but I feel like their time on my face is shorter with this product. I apply it any time I feel the slightest thing coming up and I really think it’s helped prevent breakouts from forming into bad ones.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I’ve used this for months, prior to my current spot treatment. It didn’t work for me. At all. I regret how many chances I gave this.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text:
I find that these work best when you catch the blemish "early" or if they are small in size. They end up not getting too big and when I catch them early enough there aren't any hyper-pigmentation marks left on my face after they go away.

Unfortunately, if I try using this on medium to large sized blemishes, they seem to freeze in place for a while before seemingly disappearing overnight. These tend to leave hyper-pigmentation marks but I believe that these blemishes would have if they were left to their own devices. 

Either way, I find it really effective as I know the large ones would probably have gotten a lot bigger, redder and more painful to manage. I think this is playing a big part in the management of my acne as I work to clear my skin so I am very satisfied.

In addition, I tend to have multiple spots on my face and this has lasted me a long time. So if this is more than what you are used to spending, especially on this kind of treatment, I assure you it is much more effective those other treatments that affect acne that has already emerged. And I have tried a lot.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This along with the PeaceOut Acne dots really help me when I have breakouts. If you can catch them before they start to get bigger using this treatment on them works really well. It does have a smell since it has sulfur in it, but you kind of get used to it.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text:
Very Effective! 
This product truly works. Apply this stuff to a pimple and I guarantee that thing is going down!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I got it shipped so I had to wait for the contents to settle back to normal, but once it did, it worked miracles! I usually get around 3 hormonal blemish around my period that feel like planets on my face and HURT. They take forever to surface so I’ve literally got a mound on my face for a week. Not after this! As soon as I felt them I dabbed this on them and the swelling went down overnight, and disappeared after the second night, they didn’t even surface, they just vanished! I only used it at night so I didn’t experience any drying or flaking of the skin. So glad I purchased!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Works very well. Smell so gross because of  sulphur in it. Sometimes I smell even after taking shower. Your pillow smells too. so if you can do with smell its very good product.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This was on my wish list a long time but I finally pulled the trigger.  Short story: it works!  After just one day,  it calmed my daughter's inflammation and angry pimples.  After one week, her skin was clear and beautiful.  The cons are the bottle arrived shaken and I had no idea how to use it.  After a few hours the product separated into two layers and I was able to use a Qtip to scoop out the bottom layer of pink sludge.  It works but it does smell like burnt rubber while on the face.  Overall, it leaves the skin gorgeous after several uses.  I will definitely purchase again!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I really wanted to like this product but after trying it multiple times I came to the conclusion that it just comes off while I sleep. That is probably just a “me” problem but the point is, it was a fail for me.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I’ve tried every kind of drying lotion out there and this one hands down stands out from the crowd. My first Kate Somerville product and I’m glad I made the extra buck splurge. I deal with cystic hormonal acne and this can bring to the surface and calm down those breakouts which isn’t easy let me tell you! It’s lead me to try more products from her.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Keeps bad pimples under control and gets rid of them in 2 days!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This is so great for spot treatment! I put it on pimples forming, pimples already formed, and pimples popped. This helps with all stages of pimples! It helps prevent new ones from getting bigger and helps calm popped pimples. I put it on at night and let it dry before for about 5-10 minutes before going to bed, then I wash it off in the morning.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: For me it’s working pretty well!
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This stuff is amazing! It does prevent pimples from growing and if they do end up growing it will try to keep it as small as it can. On my face, every pimple I get is different, so this doesn't work on all of them, but on the majority it does. It helps so much! I would recommend for anyone who is used to getting zits. This will stop the growing process and keep it small.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: It works it very good at getting rid of pimples, big or small. This is not a cure for acne but it gets rid of nasty little boogers overnight. My mom stole it from me, so I had to buy another.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: I have been using this for about 5 days now & my acne is completely gone!! I can’t believe it. I have struggled with severe acne my entire life, and just when I thought it had gone away of course I struggle with adult acne. I was concerned I would have to find a dermatologist and spend a fortune, but now I don’t have to thanks to this product. It is definitely drying, so keep a good moisturizer on hand. Definitely a huge fan
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This stuff works. Overnight, it reduces the size and redness of pimples. I do prefer to use colloid patches that suck up the gunk but I go through those quickly. I use this product on nights where I don't use my patches. I use a q tip to apply. Fair warning, this stuff does stink of sulfur.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: My skin type is combination. I get bright red spots around the smallest sized pimples imaginable up to the huge ones. My face breaks out to almost anything!! Red marks from acne that never seem to fade on top of a pretty red face too! Large pores. Tons of blackheads. Let me tell you... I own this whole skin line and my face is CLEAR!!! Still working on the blackheads but my acne is immensely reduced. I use this only when I have to so it keeps its power. I wake up the next day and the pimple is almost gone with this spot treatment. Everyone's faces works differently but Kate Somerville is holy grail for me. Won't use anything else.

review_text: This is much more affective than the Mario Badescu version. I had a severe cystic breakouts recently and using this every night has definitely help soothe down the breakouts.

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: Amazing. Just don’t make the mistake of going crazy with it and putting it places not absolutely necessary like I did I promise it’s not worth it. Stick to major problem zits and it’ll be almost gone in the morning. Obviously it’s super drying moisturize before and the next morning. DONT shake!!  stick a q tip in it and apply.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: It works for smaller pimples, but I noticed on my larger ones that it made them go away slower. Usually pimples only last a few days on my skin, but this made it take weeks to fully disappear. It also made my acne scar easier, which I do not like. I would only recommend this product to people with small pimples and do not have scarring issues.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This product is effective at drying out blemishes, however the smell makes my eyes water, it leaves behind a pink mess on your face, and it is very intense.  It leaves my skin dry the whole next day after I use it.  I think there are better products than this one for blemishes.
