ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: EradiKate™ Acne Treatment
review_text: This is a miracle product!  It has now replaced a gel spot acne treatment I’ve been using for 2 years.  It’s so powerful.  It literally clears my acne spots overnight.  (Only use at night). I use a q-tip & dip it in (do not shake) & then apply to my acne spots.  When the area gets dry & peels I use Tarte’s Maracuja oil on it then put on this acne treatment.  The maracuja oil doesn’t clog my pores, so it works perfectly.  The oil stops the dryness & peeling immediately.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND this product.  If you have super sensitive skin this may not be for you.  I have combo oily acne prone skin that’s pretty tough when it comes to using more powerful products.  I never have an issue.
ingredients: Isopropyl Alcohol, Zinc Oxide, Sulfur, Camphor, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Salicylic Acid, CI 77491

name: InvisiScar Resurfacing Treatment
review_text: This did not do much for my skin. Did not resurface at all.. Also smelled chemically and had a hard time absorbing into my skin. Often left a crumbly texture when I tried to rub it in.

name: InvisiScar Resurfacing Treatment
review_text: Patience is needed with this product but it does work ! After about 3-4 weeks my acne scars started to fade away , I’ve used 2 bottles of this for about 2-4 months consistently after a really bad acne breakout all over my face that left a lot of scars . I have sensitive skin and this does not irritate my skin . I did take off one star because of the time it takes to see results and how much product you get but nonetheless it’s good product to help acne scars .
ingredients: Dimethicone, Polysilicone11, Ascorbic Acid, Silica, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Hexylresorcinol, Salicylic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Hydroxytyrosol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Fragrance, Limonene, Linalool, Titanium Dioxide

name: InvisiScar Resurfacing Treatment
review_text:
Invisiscar is the answer to all of my hyperpigmentation problems! I was not kind to my skin throughout school and built up layers of hyperpigmentation from acne scars. I have been actively trying to address these scars and was excited to give Invisicar a try. 

In the first 2 weeks, most of the changes were textural. With each day, I could feel my skin smoothening to an evening texture. By the end of week 2, I noticed a bit more brightness, especially around my cheekbones. 

In weeks 3 and 4, I noticed some of the lighter or smaller dark spots starting to fade. At this point, some of the larger, darker spots were still noticeable. 

After 6 weeks, the larger, darker spots starting to reduce in size and fad. Still noticeable, but appeared a bit smaller and a little bit lighter than before. 

In the last two weeks, my most prominent dark spots did not change in size. However, I noticed that there was a little bit of brightness and increased evenness in tone. 

Given that I have dark skin with a lot of dark hyperpigmentation, I knew that I wasn’t’ going to get rid of everything. Still, Invisiscar helped me to see how much hyperpigmentation was set in my skin. I’m pleased with the results, and Invisiscar has reset my skin with a newfound tone and texture that I hope continues to improve, and I will purchase this product again. Worth every penny!
ingredients: Dimethicone, Polysilicone11, Ascorbic Acid, Silica, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Hexylresorcinol, Salicylic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Hydroxytyrosol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Fragrance, Limonene, Linalool, Titanium Dioxide

name: InvisiScar Resurfacing Treatment
review_text:
i've been waiting to review this for two months, since MURAD claims it takes eight weeks for results. i have a VERY hard time believing people who saw results overnight. i saw some fading with just morning usage. 

the consistency is like a primer and yes, the bottle is tiny. i've only been using it as a spot treatment on acne scarring from an explosion of breakouts in May 2019 so i have no complaints about how long it lasts. a few of these areas on my skin were fairly 'active.' my morning routine: witch hazel, murad invisiscar spot treatment, cerave lightweight moisturizer, makeup( (IT CC Cream). night routine: dermanlogica double cleanse balm, Lira SA acne cleanser, caudalie glycolic night cream. two nights a week, OTC retinol. this is all to say, i'm doing plenty of other things to fade my scars.

two takeaways:
1. this did not make me break out further, which is a major plus. it has SA, which probably helps keep future breakouts at bay. for that reason, i recommend this for hot spot areas that seem to breakout every month.
2. when i started using an OTC retinol every other night, i noticed this spot treatment accelerated my peeling (i tested it in spots) so it DOES work to exfoliate. 

could it be stronger? probably, but i'd trade slower results for a cream that wont make me break out.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Polysilicone11, Ascorbic Acid, Silica, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Hexylresorcinol, Salicylic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Hydroxytyrosol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Fragrance, Limonene, Linalool, Titanium Dioxide

name: InvisiScar Resurfacing Treatment
review_text: Love this so much! I’ve been suffering from terrible cystic acne for the last 2.5 years. It was really severe and now that I’ve gotten medication for it, I rarely have even a whitehead. But it left horrible scarring, mainly on my cheeks. This product has helped reduce redness and they’ve faded so much since I started using this a short while ago. Truly one of the best products I’ve used in a long time!
ingredients: Dimethicone, Polysilicone11, Ascorbic Acid, Silica, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Hexylresorcinol, Salicylic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Hydroxytyrosol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Fragrance, Limonene, Linalool, Titanium Dioxide

name: InvisiScar Resurfacing Treatment
review_text: This is the best treatment for acne scars I’ve used. It’s worked better than any other treatment I’ve tried. I would recommend either this product if you’re okay with silicones (this has a distinct silicone texture and smoothness to it) OR the dark spot corrective treatment by Kiehl’s (if you have skin that’s sensitive to silicones). I rated the Kiehl’s 5/5 stars because it didn’t have any silicones in it, and definitely worked as far as reducing old acne scars. However, this product has worked better and quicker than the Kiehl’s one. The only reason I took away a star from this review is because it did break me out a little bit, due to the silicones. However, it only broke me out in the hollows of my cheeks, which is the area of my face I’m most likely to break out in (regardless of products used). I pretty much scar any time I get acne, so I wait until the blemish has disappeared and usually within a week the new scars fade and by the end of week two, the scar is completely vanished from my face. With my old acne scars, it takes about 2 weeks to see noticeable fading, and by the end of week 3 the scar is visibly less noticeable. I’ve been using it for about 6 weeks now and the only scar that’s left has been my trouble scar (nothing has completely gotten rid of it). But what’s important to me is this, is DEFINITELY not as dark and noticeable and it keeps diminishing its appearance week after week. So I’m very hopeful for the end of week 8, as this product demonstrates. I really only need about 1/2 pump for all the spots on my face, morning and night. You don’t need to use a lot of this product because the silicone does carry and spread this product over patches of the skin if you want (cuz I have some patches on my skin where I have some clusters of scars). I’d recommend trying this product first if you just started working on reducing acne scars and see how it goes, especially since it’s the kindest product to my wallet I’ve used.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Polysilicone11, Ascorbic Acid, Silica, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Hexylresorcinol, Salicylic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Hydroxytyrosol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Fragrance, Limonene, Linalool, Titanium Dioxide

name: InvisiScar Resurfacing Treatment
review_text: Updated Review: I have been using this product for almost 6 weeks now, and have noticed a subtle difference in acne scars I had around my nose. I feel like it is noticeably less red/dimensional than it used to look, however did not really do much for the ice-pick-like scar I was hoping to diminish the appearance of with this product. It has a thicker consistency that doesn't really work all that well under concealer, so I would not recommend AM use if you're planning on putting makeup on top of this (for that reason, I would only plan on using this product at night if you apply makeup on top of your scarring during the day). I am going to keep using this for another 3-4 weeks and see if I notice any more of a difference - and will update this review again accordingly. It says results are seen in as little as 8 weeks, so 2 more weeks to go before really being able to give a full assessment on this one!
ingredients: Dimethicone, Polysilicone11, Ascorbic Acid, Silica, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Hexylresorcinol, Salicylic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Hydroxytyrosol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Fragrance, Limonene, Linalool, Titanium Dioxide

name: InvisiScar Resurfacing Treatment
review_text:
Although I received a free product to try out I will be repurchasing this because I liked it so much. I use it as a primer—it helps to fill in pockmarks and acne to create a smooth canvas for makeup. There are some says I don’t feel like wearing makeup and I just apply a bit of this and it leaves my face soft and smooth and healthier looking. It is not an incredible or dramatic difference but it’s a soft blurring of the imperfections and it is enough to be noticeable. 

After about 6 weeks of using it I noticed that it was starting to make long term changes to the texture on my face. So although it does have short term effects it is the long term effects that are amazing. I use this in conjunction with Murads clarifying water gel and it leaves my skin hydrated and clear and healthy together. The only negative I can find with this product is the size and price. If you use it like a primer then you will go through the container rather quickly. I’m hoping they will sell a larger size in the future. The price is worth it for me as it gives you such a clean, smooth, and even face. I will be repurchasing!
ingredients: Dimethicone, Polysilicone11, Ascorbic Acid, Silica, Dimethicone, Dimethyl Isosorbide, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Hexylresorcinol, Salicylic Acid, Acetyl Glucosamine, Hydroxytyrosol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Fragrance, Limonene, Linalool, Titanium Dioxide

review_text: I received this product as a gift in exchange for an honest review. I have acne scaring and I still get acne flare ups so I thought this would be a great product to try. Just from trying it out so far, I've noticed my acne staying the same size or starting to go away which is super important! My scars have lightened a bit but with more time I do think the scaring will go away or almost completely. The packaging is nice and you get just the right amount for your face. I don't like to go overboard.
